original: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa gnyis pa ste bsgom pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa gnyis pa ste bsgom pa'i lam mo //
translated: The second repetition is the path of cultivation.🔽The third repetition is the path of no-more-learning.🔽The first repetition is the path of seeing.

original: sdug bsngal de yongs su shes so //🔽kun 'byung ba spangs so //🔽'gog pa mngon sum du byas so //🔽lam bsgoms so zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal de yongs su shes so // kun 'byung ba spangs so // 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so // lam bsgoms so zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa gsum pa ste /
translated: The second repetition is the path of cultivation.

original: mi slob pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lam mo //
translated: The third repetition is the path of no-more-learning.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re bzlas pa re re la yang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes bya ba ni kha cig na re bzlas pa re re la yang sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam gyi rnam pa bzhi bzhi yod pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: The twelve aspects are the four aspects of each of the three repetitions.🔽Or else, the three repetitions are the twelve aspects.

original: yang na lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba yang /🔽mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /
analyzed: yang na lan gsum du bzlas te rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes bya ba ni bzlas pa dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni sdug bsngal lo zhes bya ba yang /🔽mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /
translated: The first repetition is the path of seeing.🔽The second repetition is the path of cultivation.🔽The third repetition is the path of no-more-learning.

original: bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
analyzed: bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la sdug bsngal yongs su shes par bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
translated: The second repetition is the path of meditation, which is stated as “suffering should be fully known.”

original: mig dang / shes pa dang / rag pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
analyzed: mig dang / shes pa dang / rag pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
translated: It has four aspects: the eye, knowledge, understanding, and the arising of wisdom.🔽The third repetition is the path of no learning, which is stated as “that suffering is fully known.”

original: bzlas pa gsum pa mi slob pa'i lam la sdug bsngal de yongs su shes so zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: bzlas pa gsum pa mi slob pa'i lam la sdug bsngal de yongs su shes so zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: It has four aspects: the eye, knowledge, understanding, and the arising of wisdom.🔽Similarly, the first repetition is the path of seeing, which is stated as “this is the origin.”

original: de bzhin du bzlas pa @214b dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlas pa @214b dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni kun 'byung ba'o zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /
translated: It has four aspects: the eye, knowledge, understanding, and the arising of wisdom.

original: bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
analyzed: bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la kun 'byung ba spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
translated: The second repetition is the path of meditation, which is stated as “the origin should be abandoned.”

original: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
analyzed: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
translated: It has four aspects: the eye, knowledge, understanding, and the arising of wisdom.

original: bzlas pa gsum pa mi slob pa'i lam la kun 'byung ba spangs so zhes bya ba la yang /
analyzed: bzlas pa gsum pa mi slob pa'i lam la kun 'byung ba spangs so zhes bya ba la yang /
translated: The third repetition, “I have abandoned the origin of suffering” on the path of no learning,

original: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod de /
analyzed: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod de /
translated: has four aspects: eye, knowledge, understanding and intelligence.🔽Similarly, the first repetition, “This is cessation” on the path of seeing,

original: de bzhin du bzlas pa dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye pa'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlas pa dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni 'gog pa'o zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye pa'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /
translated: has four aspects: eye, knowledge, understanding and intelligence.

original: bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
analyzed: bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la 'gog pa mngon sum du bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
translated: The second repetition, “I have manifested cessation” on the path of meditation,

original: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
analyzed: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
translated: has four aspects: eye, knowledge, understanding and intelligence.🔽The third repetition, “I have abandoned the origin of suffering” on the path of no learning,

original: bzlas pa gsum pa mi slob pa'i lam la 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: bzlas pa gsum pa mi slob pa'i lam la 'gog pa mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: has four aspects: eye, knowledge, understanding and intelligence.

original: de bzhin du bzlas pa dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni lam mo zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod la /🔽bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlas pa dang po mthong ba'i lam la 'di ni lam mo zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod la / bzlas pa gnyis pa bsgom pa'i lam la lam bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba la yang /
translated: So too, in the first repetition on the path of seeing, there are four aspects of the arising of eye, knowledge, understanding, and wisdom in the statement, “This is the path.”

original: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
analyzed: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod cing /
translated: In the second repetition on the path of meditation, there are four aspects of the arising of eye, knowledge, understanding, and wisdom in the statement, “The path should be cultivated.”

original: bzlas pa gsum pa ni mi slob pa'i lam la lam bsgoms so zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod do //
analyzed: bzlas pa gsum pa ni mi slob pa'i lam la lam bsgoms so zhes bya ba la yang mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bzhi yod do //
translated: In the third repetition on the path of no learning, there are four aspects of the arising of eye, knowledge, understanding, and wisdom in the statement, “The path has been cultivated.”

original: de ltar byas nas mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag la bden pa dbye bas ni bzlas pa bcu gnyis yod la /
analyzed: de ltar byas nas mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam dag la bden pa dbye bas ni bzlas pa bcu gnyis yod la /
translated: Thus, in the paths of seeing, meditation, and no learning, there are twelve repetitions by way of the classification of the four truths.

original: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo'o dbye bas ni rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad yod do //
analyzed: mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo'o dbye bas ni rnam pa bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad yod do //
translated: There are forty-eight aspects by way of the classification of eye, knowledge, understanding, and wisdom.

original: 'o na de ltar lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: Well then, it is said that the Buddha turned the wheel of Dharma three times.🔽

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes gsungs pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na /🔽bden mod kyi 'on kyang bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las gsum pa dang / bcu gnyis dang chos mthun pas bden pa re re yongs su brtag pa la brten na /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes gsungs pa nyams par 'gyur ro zhe na / bden mod kyi 'on kyang bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las gsum pa dang / bcu gnyis dang chos mthun pas bden pa re re yongs su brtag pa la brten na /
translated: If that is so, then the statement Three times and twelve aspects would be undermined.

original: gsum dang / bcu gnyis las mi nyams te /
analyzed: gsum dang / bcu gnyis las mi nyams te /
translated: Indeed, that is true, but according to the Vaibhasikas, the three times and twelve aspects are not undermined because each truth has three repetitions and twelve aspects.

original: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang mthong @215a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang mthong @215a * //
translated: For example, the truth of suffering has three repetitions and twelve aspects.

original: ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob ba'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod la /
analyzed: ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob ba'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod la /
translated: The three repetitions are the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning and the twelve aspects are the arising of the eye, knowledge, understanding and cognition.

original: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba'i bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang /
translated: The truth of origin has three repetitions and twelve aspects.

original: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod cing /🔽'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod /
analyzed: mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod cing / 'gog pa'i bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang / shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod /
translated: There are three repetitions of the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning, and there are twelve aspects such as eyes, consciousness, knowledge, understanding and so on.🔽There are also three repetitions of the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning in the investigation of the truth of cessation and there are twelve aspects such as eyes, consciousness, knowledge, understanding and so on.

original: lam gyi bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod do //
analyzed: lam gyi bden pa yongs su brtag pa la yang mthong ba dang / bsgom pa dang / mi slob pa'i lam gyi bzlas pa gsum pa dang / mig dang shes pa dang / rig pa dang / blo skye ba'i rnam pa bcu gnyis yod do //
translated: There are also three repetitions of the paths of seeing, meditation and no more learning in the investigation of the truth of the path and there are twelve aspects such as eyes, consciousness, knowledge, understanding and so on.

original: de ltar na gsum dang bcu gnyis dang / chos mthun pas lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: de ltar na gsum dang bcu gnyis dang / chos mthun pas lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: Thus there are three repetitions and twelve aspects that are similar to the three repetitions and twelve aspects of the wheel of Dharma.

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes gsungs te /
translated: It says, “There are twelve aspects.”

original: gnyis dang bdun gyi gnas la mkhas pa bstan pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: gnyis dang bdun gyi gnas la mkhas pa bstan pa bzhin no zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: As it is said, “The wise know the two and seven abodes.”

original: chos dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is in accordance with the Dharma because it is in accordance with the Dharma of nirvana.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo zhes bya ba ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the path of seeing,

original: myur du 'gro ba dang / 'dor zhing gnod pa dang / ma phebs pa 'bebs pa dang / phebs par gnas pa dang / 'phar zhing 'bab pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: myur du 'gro ba dang / 'dor zhing gnod pa dang / ma phebs pa 'bebs pa dang / phebs par gnas pa dang / 'phar zhing 'bab pa dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is like a wheel that moves quickly, throws off, harms, brings down what is not yet fallen, stabilizes what is fallen, and rises up again.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo ni mthong ba'i lam ste /
translated: The wheel of the Dharma is the path of seeing,

original: rtsibs la sogs pa myur du 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsibs la sogs pa myur du 'gro ba'i phyir ro zhes kyang gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it quickly moves like spokes and so on.

original: bskor ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la don ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byed pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskor ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rgyud la don ji lta ba bzhin du shes par byed pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is turned because it generates understanding of the meaning in the mindstream of another.

original: 'o na de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam la 'ba' zhig yin na /
analyzed: 'o na de ltar chos kyi 'khor lo mthong ba'i lam la 'ba' zhig yin na /
translated: If the wheel of the Dharma is the path of seeing,

original: ji ltar bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gnyis dang bcas pa la lan gsum du bzlas te /
analyzed: ji ltar bsgom pa dang mi slob pa'i lam gnyis dang bcas pa la lan gsum du bzlas te /
translated: Why is it said that the wheel of Dharma has twelve aspects, since it is said that the wheel of Dharma has three revolutions and three aspects?

original: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes gsungs she na bden mod kyi 'on kyang mthong ba'i lam gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu gnyis su zhes gsungs she na bden mod kyi 'on kyang mthong ba'i lam gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is true that it is said that the wheel of Dharma has twelve aspects, but the path of seeing is primary.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo yin par gsungs te /
translated: It is said to be the wheel of Dharma because

original: de'i 'bras bu ni bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gnyis yin pas 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu ni bsgom pa'i lam dang / mi slob pa'i lam gnyis yin pas 'gal ba med do //
translated: the path of meditation and the path of no more learning are its results.🔽Therefore:

original: de'i phyir / de ni gtso phyir dang po'i phyir //
analyzed: de'i phyir / de ni gtso phyir dang po'i phyir //
translated: Because it is primary, because it is first,🔽because it is the cause of liberation,

original: grol ba'i rgyu phyir chos 'khor lo //🔽gsum pa rnam pa @215b bcu gnyis kyi //
analyzed: grol ba'i rgyu phyir chos 'khor lo // gsum pa rnam pa @215b bcu gnyis kyi //
translated: it is the wheel of Dharma.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo gang gsungs pa //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo gang gsungs pa //
translated: The wheel of Dharma that is said to have🔽twelve aspects

original: mthong ba'i lam la de yod pas //
analyzed: mthong ba'i lam la de yod pas //
translated: is fully included in the path of seeing

original: 'bras bur bcas pa yongs su bzung //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no /🔽// / bam po bzhi pa /
analyzed: 'bras bur bcas pa yongs su bzung // zhes gsungs pa yin no / // / bam po bzhi pa /
translated: together with its result.

original: lnga po zhes bya ba ni lnga'i tshogs kyis spyod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: lnga po zhes bya ba ni lnga'i tshogs kyis spyod pa'i phyir te /
translated: The five are called the five aggregates of appropriation because they are the objects appropriated by the view of the transitory collection.

original: de dag kyang 'phags pa kun shes koondi n+ya dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / rlangs ba dang / ming chen zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang 'phags pa kun shes koondi n+ya dang / rta thul dang / bzang ldan dang / rlangs ba dang / ming chen zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: They are the noble Kauṇḍinya, Aśvaki, Bhadrika, Vāṣpa, and Mahānāman.

original: nye lnga zhes bya ba ni lnga ba dang / nye bar zhugs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: nye lnga zhes bya ba ni lnga ba dang / nye bar zhugs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The “five close friends” are the five who were the first to enter the path of seeing.🔽They are Bhadrika, Aśvajit, Vāṣpa, Mahānāman, and Yaśas.🔽The “five great elders” are the five who were the greatest elders.

original: de dag ni grags pa dang / gong bo dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzangs zhes bya ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag ni grags pa dang / gong bo dang / dri med dang / ba lang bdag dang / lag bzangs zhes bya ba dag go //
translated: They are Nanda, Upananda, Vimala, Gavāṃpati, and Subāhu.

original: mtho ba mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dag pas kyang ches gtso bo dag ste /
analyzed: mtho ba mtho ba zhes bya ba ni gtso bo dag pas kyang ches gtso bo dag ste /
translated: “Great” means that they were the greatest of the great.

original: rnam pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
analyzed: rnam pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
translated: The repetition is for the sake of variety.

original: btul zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam skyed pas dul bar mdzad pa'o //🔽rab tu phyung zhes bya ba ni sngom pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: btul zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam skyed pas dul bar mdzad pa'o // rab tu phyung zhes bya ba ni sngom pa yang ma yin /
translated: “Subdued” means that they subdued the afflictions by generating the noble path.🔽“Gone forth” means that they attained the state of a monk by the going forth of the preceptor’s ordination.

original: sngom pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu 'byung bar thob par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: sngom pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rab tu 'byung bar thob par mdzad pa'o //
translated: “Ordained” means that they attained the state of a monk by the going forth of the threefold repetition.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa thams cad spong ba'i mtshan nyid dge slong gi dngos po la rnam par gzhag pa mdzad de /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa thams cad spong ba'i mtshan nyid dge slong gi dngos po la rnam par gzhag pa mdzad de /
translated: “Perfect approach” is the state of a fully ordained monk, which is characterized by the abandonment of all evil.

original: de la rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni don thams cad yang dag par grub pa'i dpal te /
analyzed: de la rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni don thams cad yang dag par grub pa'i dpal te /
translated: “Perfect” means the glory of the accomplishment of all goals.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for nirvana.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it is said:

original: dri ma thams cad bcom byas shing //
analyzed: dri ma thams cad bcom byas shing //
translated: Having destroyed all defilements,

original: mya ngan 'das pa rdzogs pa thob //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa rdzogs pa thob //
translated: one attains the perfection of nirvana.

original: sdug bsngal tha mar byed pa ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tha mar byed pa ste //
translated: It is the end of suffering,

original: thams cad rdzogs par gyur pa yin //🔽zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: thams cad rdzogs par gyur pa yin // zhes ji skad gsungs pa yin no //
translated: the perfection of everything.

original: der bsnyen pa ni de dang nye ba'i sgra yin te /
analyzed: der bsnyen pa ni de dang nye ba'i sgra yin te /
translated: “Approach” is a term for proximity.

original: rdzogs pa dang / nye ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa ste /
analyzed: rdzogs pa dang / nye ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa ste /
translated: “Perfect” and “approach” are “perfect approach.”

original: dge slong gi sdom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge slong gi sdom pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for the vow of a fully ordained monk.

original: 'di ltar rdzogs pa dang nye bar rnam par gnas pa yin pa de ni khad nye ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzogs pa dang nye bar rnam par gnas pa yin pa de ni khad nye ba nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das pa la gnas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because he is close to perfect and complete nirvāṇa, he is close to nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar yang nga'i dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa de ni mtho ris ni dar gyis bsgribs pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: de ltar yang nga'i dge slong tshul khrims dang ldan pa de ni mtho ris ni dar gyis bsgribs pa tsam yin la /
translated: In the same way, it is said: “My monks who are endowed with morality are like those who are covered with a cloth in the higher realms.

original: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thar pa ni yol bas bsgribs pa tsam yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Liberation is like those who are covered with a curtain.”

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa de thob par mdzad pa ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa de thob par mdzad pa ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The attainment of that which is perfect is called “perfect.”

original: kar pi sa'i tshal gseb ces bya ba ni shing ljon pa zhes mang po'i ming yin no //
analyzed: kar pi sa'i tshal gseb ces bya ba ni shing ljon pa zhes mang po'i ming yin no //
translated: The forest of Karavīra trees is a forest of many trees.

original: bzang sde'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni bzang po mdzes pa'i tshogs te /
analyzed: bzang sde'i tshogs zhes bya ba ni bzang po mdzes pa'i tshogs te /
translated: The assembly of Bhadra is an assembly of beautiful ones.

original: @216a * // des 'gro ba dang 'ongs pa la sogs pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @216a * // des 'gro ba dang 'ongs pa la sogs pas rnam par gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are established in going and coming, etc.

original: bden pa dag la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid dag la'o //
analyzed: bden pa dag la zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i mtshan nyid dag la'o //
translated: In regard to the truths means in regard to the four truths of suffering, origin, cessation, and path, which have the nature of being unmistaken.

original: bkod do zhes bya ba ni shes pa mi g-yo ba bskyed pa nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bkod do zhes bya ba ni shes pa mi g-yo ba bskyed pa nyid kyis so //
translated: He established means that he generated the unshakable knowledge.

original: lteng rgyas zhes bya ba ni grong gi ming ngo //
analyzed: lteng rgyas zhes bya ba ni grong gi ming ngo //
translated: Urubilvā means the name of a town.

original: ga ya mgo'i mchod rten zhes bya ba ni grong khyer ga yar lha khang brtsigs pas de'i phyogs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ga ya mgo'i mchod rten zhes bya ba ni grong khyer ga yar lha khang brtsigs pas de'i phyogs gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Gayāśīrṣa means the name of a town where a temple was built, because it is the principal direction of Gayā.

original: chos 'phrul gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ya mtshan bskyed pa dag gis te /
analyzed: chos 'phrul gsum gyis zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul dang / kun brjod pa dang / rjes su bstan pa'i ngo bo nyid kyi ya mtshan bskyed pa dag gis te /
translated: By means of the three miracles means by means of the three miracles of the nature of magical transformation, revelation, and instruction.

original: cho 'phrul zhes bya ba ni zhe 'gras pa dang / tha mal pa rnams kyi yid 'phrog cing sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho 'phrul zhes bya ba ni zhe 'gras pa dang / tha mal pa rnams kyi yid 'phrog cing sdud par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Miracle means that it is a miracle because it attracts and gathers the minds of those who are hostile and neutral.

original: gdams pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan ba'o //
analyzed: gdams pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bstan ba'o //
translated: Instruction means revelation.

original: shin tu mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad par 'dod pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir dang / yang bya ba nyid med pa'i phyir dang / grub pa dad pa de ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: shin tu mthar thug pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa zad par 'dod pa'i mthar thug pa'i phyir dang / yang bya ba nyid med pa'i phyir dang / grub pa dad pa de ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The extremely final is the final stage of the desire to extinguish the defilements, and because there is no more to be done.

original: grub pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ma thob pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: grub pa zhes bya ba ni sngon ma thob pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: The accomplishment is the abandonment of the defilements not previously obtained.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni de thob pa mi nyams pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni de thob pa mi nyams pa ste /
translated: The happiness is the non-degeneration of that attainment.

original: de ni grub pa yang yin la bde ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de ni grub pa yang yin la bde ba yang yin te /
translated: That is the accomplishment and the happiness.

original: yongs su mi nyams pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽shar pa'i tshal zhes bya ba ni smyug ma phra shar shar po'i tshal lo //
analyzed: yongs su mi nyams pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go // shar pa'i tshal zhes bya ba ni smyug ma phra shar shar po'i tshal lo //
translated: It means the nature of non-degeneration.🔽The Eastern Grove is a grove of slender bamboo shoots.

original: 'od ma'i tshal zhes bya ba ni 'od ma mang po'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'od ma'i tshal zhes bya ba ni 'od ma mang po'i gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Sāl forest means a place with many sāla trees.

original: bzhes te zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi don dang sbyin pa ba po rnams kyis sbyin ba po par bya ba'i chos yongs su longs spyad pa'i don du zhal gyis bzhes te'o //
analyzed: bzhes te zhes bya ba ni gnas kyi don dang sbyin pa ba po rnams kyis sbyin ba po par bya ba'i chos yongs su longs spyad pa'i don du zhal gyis bzhes te'o //
translated: Having accepted means that the Buddhas accept the gifts of the givers in order to consume the gifts that are given to them.

original: de na zhes bya ba ni 'od ma'i tshal na'o //
analyzed: de na zhes bya ba ni 'od ma'i tshal na'o //
translated: There means in the Bamboo Grove.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas yin la /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba ni lag mthil du skyu ru ra bzhag pa bzhin du 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang da ltar byung ba'i chos thams cad thugs su chud pa'i phyir sangs rgyas yin la /
translated: The Blessed Buddhas means that they are Buddhas because they have realized all dharmas of the past, future, and present, as if they were myrobalan fruits in the palm of the hand.

original: bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: They are Blessed because they have conquered the four Maras.

original: tshig gnyi ga smos pa ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: tshig gnyi ga smos pa ni yang dag par sdud par byed pa'i tshig ste /
translated: The use of both terms is a term of respect.

original: gus pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gus pa skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is for the purpose of generating respect.

original: 'di la 'dul ba bye grag tu smra ba dag mu bzhir byed de /
analyzed: 'di la 'dul ba bye grag tu smra ba dag mu bzhir byed de /
translated: Here, the Vinaya-Vaibhāṣikas make a fourfold division:

original: sangs rgyas yin la bcom ldan 'das ma yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: sangs rgyas yin la bcom ldan 'das ma yin pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who are Buddhas but not Blessed,

original: bcom ldan 'das yin la sangs rgyas ma yin pa yang yod /🔽sangs rgyas kyang yin la bcom @216b ldan 'das kyang yin pa yang yod /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yin la sangs rgyas ma yin pa yang yod / sangs rgyas kyang yin la bcom @216b ldan 'das kyang yin pa yang yod /
translated: There are those who are the Blessed One but are not the Buddha.🔽There are those who are the Buddha and also the Blessed One.

original: sangs rgyas kyang ma yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang ma yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There are those who are neither the Buddha nor the Blessed One.

original: de la sangs rgyas yin la bcom ldan 'das ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas yin la bcom ldan 'das ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Among them, those who are the Buddha but are not the Blessed One are as follows:

original: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dag go //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos kyi sangs rgyas dag go //
translated: The self-enlightened ones and the disciples.

original: bcom ldan 'das yin la sangs rgyas ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das yin la sangs rgyas ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste //
translated: Those who are the Blessed One but are not the Buddha are as follows:

original: byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma ma'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' srid pa tha ma ma'o //
translated: The bodhisattvas in their final existence.

original: sangs rgyas kyang yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyang yin la bcom ldan 'das kyang yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who are the Buddha and also the Blessed One are as follows:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //🔽sangs rgyas kyang ma yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so // sangs rgyas kyang ma yin la /
translated: The Tathagata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyang ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyang ma yin pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Those who are neither the Buddha nor the Blessed One are as follows:

original: so so'i skye bo thams cad do //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo thams cad do //
translated: All ordinary beings.

original: 'dir brgal ba ci'i phyir mdo sde dang chos mngon pa gnyis kyi gleng gzhir ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das zhes smos la /
analyzed: 'dir brgal ba ci'i phyir mdo sde dang chos mngon pa gnyis kyi gleng gzhir ni 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na bcom ldan 'das zhes smos la /
translated: Why is the nidana of the sutras and the Abhidharma stated as “Thus have I heard at one time the Bhagavan,”

original: 'dul ba'i gleng gzhir ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos she na /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i gleng gzhir ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das zhes smos she na /
translated: but the nidana of the Vinaya stated as “The Bhagavan Buddha”?

original: ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug gi gnyen po'i phyir te /
analyzed: ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug gi gnyen po'i phyir te /
translated: It is because it is the antidote to the ninety-six non-Buddhist traditions.

original: ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug po dag la ni thams cad la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra grag ste legs ldan rdzogs byed dang / legs ldan brgya byin dang / legs ldan tshangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod la /
analyzed: ya mtshan can dgu bcu rtsa drug po dag la ni thams cad la bcom ldan 'das zhes bya ba'i sgra grag ste legs ldan rdzogs byed dang / legs ldan brgya byin dang / legs ldan tshangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs par brjod la /
translated: The ninety-six non-Buddhist traditions are all called Bhagavan, such as Bṛhaspati, Indra, Bṛhaspati, and Bṛhaspati.

original: de dag la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pas de dag las ni rnam par gcad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
analyzed: de dag la sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra ni med pas de dag las ni rnam par gcad pa'i phyir sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra smos so //
translated: But the word buddha is not used for them, so the word buddha is stated in order to distinguish them.

original: gal te de ltar na mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa gnyis la yang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra smos par bya ba'i rigs na ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
analyzed: gal te de ltar na mdo sde dang / chos mngon pa gnyis la yang sangs rgyas zhes bya ba'i sgra smos par bya ba'i rigs na ci'i phyir ma smos she na /
translated: If that is so, then it would be correct to say that the Buddha is mentioned in both the sutra and Abhidharma, but why is he not mentioned?

original: mdo sde dang chos mngon pa gnyis ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / lha dang / drang srong sprul pa dag dang lhan cig thun mong du bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: mdo sde dang chos mngon pa gnyis ni nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / lha dang / drang srong sprul pa dag dang lhan cig thun mong du bstan pa yin la /
translated: The sutra and Abhidharma are taught in common with sravakas, pratyekabuddhas, gods and sages who are emanations.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba la ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dgra bcom pa dag la yang dbang med na gzhan dag la ta smos kyang ci dgos te /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba la ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu la sogs pa dgra bcom pa dag la yang dbang med na gzhan dag la ta smos kyang ci dgos te /
translated: But when the bases of training are established, even arhats such as arya Sariputra have no power, so what need is there to mention others?

original: de'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir 'dul ba'i sde snod la mtshan mar bya ba'i phyir sangs bcom ldan 'das zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi bca' ba ni thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir 'dul ba'i sde snod la mtshan mar bya ba'i phyir sangs bcom ldan 'das zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, because the establishment of the bases of training is not common, the Buddha is mentioned in the Vinaya Pitaka in order to make it authoritative.

original: mdo sde dang chos mngon pa gnyis la ni /
analyzed: mdo sde dang chos mngon pa gnyis la ni /
translated: In the sutra and Abhidharma,

original: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
analyzed: 'di skad bdag gis thos pa'i dus gcig na /
translated: at one time I heard this.

original: bcom ldan 'das zhes smos so zhes 'dul ba bye brag tu smra ba dag zer ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das zhes smos so zhes 'dul ba bye brag tu smra ba dag zer ro //

original: rgyal @217a * //

analyzed: de nyid kyi gleng gzhi gzhung 'di las 'og nas 'byung ngo //

analyzed: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis 'jigs pa shes bya ba la /
translated: With a great company of monks🔽This

original: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi yul 'khor ba 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi dmag tshogs zhes bya ba ni pha rol gyi yul 'khor ba 'ongs pa'o //
translated: “The army of the enemy” is the invasion of the enemy’s country.

original: des 'jigs pa ni grong khyer na gnas pa'i mi dag mi g-yo bar chem me chems se 'khod pa na grong khyer yang rgyun lugs med cing chem chems ser gnas par 'gyur ba'o //

translated: “Terrified by that” means that the people living in the city are frightened and remain in their houses, and the city itself is in a state of panic.

original: dge sbyod zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba 'am sdig pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyod zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba 'am sdig pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Ascetic” means one who has gone forth or one who has pacified evil.

original: bram ze zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir ram sdig pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bram ze zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'i phyir ram sdig pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Brahmin” means one who is of a good family or one who has abandoned evil.

original: dbang che bar grags pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dbang che bar grags pa zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “One of great power and fame” means one who has merit.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa ste /
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dug pa ste /
translated: “Dwelling” means staying.

original: de 'dug pa nyid kyis na de'i mthus zhi ba nyid du 'gyur ro snyam nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de 'dug pa nyid kyis na de'i mthus zhi ba nyid du 'gyur ro snyam nas zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The idea is that by his mere presence, through his power, there will be peace.

original: re zhig pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis 'jigs pa med pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu gnyis po dag las zhes bya bar tshig khong nas 'byung ngo //
analyzed: re zhig pha rol gyi dmag tshogs kyis 'jigs pa med pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu gnyis po dag las zhes bya bar tshig khong nas 'byung ngo //
translated: “For the time being, there is no fear of an army of enemies” is to be supplied from the second reason.

original: sang zhes bya ba ni sang nang par ro //
analyzed: sang zhes bya ba ni sang nang par ro //
translated: “Tomorrow” means the next day.

original: 'phral ris gsum zhes bya ba ni 'phral ba'i phyogs su thal ba'i ri mo gsum byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'phral ris gsum zhes bya ba ni 'phral ba'i phyogs su thal ba'i ri mo gsum byas pa'o //
translated: “Three lines on the forehead” means three lines of ash on the forehead.

original: spyod yul du zhes bya ba ni don gyi phyir phyi rol du 'dong ba'i sar ro //
analyzed: spyod yul du zhes bya ba ni don gyi phyir phyi rol du 'dong ba'i sar ro //
translated: “In the range” means in the place where one goes outside for the purpose.

original: phyi bzhin phyi bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes bzhin du ste /
analyzed: phyi bzhin phyi bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes bzhin du ste /
translated: “Following, following” means following after.

original: bzlas pa'i phyir tshig gnyis su smos so //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i phyir tshig gnyis su smos so //
translated: The two phrases are stated for the purpose of repetition.

original: phyir gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyir log ste'o //
analyzed: phyir gyur te zhes bya ba ni phyir log ste'o //
translated: “Having returned” means having come back.

original: de'i skabs su zhes bya ba ni de'i bar skabs su'o //
analyzed: de'i skabs su zhes bya ba ni de'i bar skabs su'o //
translated: “At that time” means in the middle of that.

original: mi mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis sam /
analyzed: mi mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni ye shes kyis sam /
translated: “Not knowing” means not knowing through wisdom.

original: 'jig rten pa'i mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i mkhyen pas so //
translated: Or it means not knowing through worldly knowledge.

original: ma gzigs pas zhes bya ba ni spyan gyis sam /
analyzed: ma gzigs pas zhes bya ba ni spyan gyis sam /
translated: “Not seeing” means not seeing with the eyes.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mkhyen pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mkhyen pas so //
translated: Or it means not seeing through supramundane knowledge.

original: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni snyan gyis sam /
analyzed: ma rig pa zhes bya ba ni snyan gyis sam /
translated: The so-called ignorance is the non-perception of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: thag ring po'i gzugs gzigs pas so /🔽rnam par @217b mi mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas sam /
analyzed: thag ring po'i gzugs gzigs pas so / rnam par @217b mi mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pas sam /
translated: Ignorance is the non-perception of the ear and the distant form.

original: cha phra zhing bsgribs pa'i gzugs gzigs pas so //
analyzed: cha phra zhing bsgribs pa'i gzugs gzigs pas so //
translated: Non-knowledge is the non-perception of the mental consciousness and the subtle and obscured form.

original: yang na sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mkhyen pa dag gis go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal dang / kun 'byung ba dang / 'gog pa dang / lam mkhyen pa dag gis go rims bzhin no //
translated: Or else, it is the knowledge of suffering, of the origin of suffering, of the cessation of suffering, and of the path, respectively.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid ni nyid lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs nas mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa 'jug go zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi chos nyid ni nyid lan gsum mtshan lan gsum sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis 'jig rten la rnam par gzigs nas mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa 'jug go zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: The nature of the Blessed Buddhas is such that they look upon the world with their Buddha-eye three times during the day and three times during the night, and their knowledge and vision function accordingly.

original: 'tsho zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho zhes bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las 'das par mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: They live means they do not hold to complete nirvana.

original: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ; ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba yongs su spangs te /
analyzed: bzhugs pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan dang ; ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i bde ba yongs su spangs te /
translated: They abide means they abandon the bliss of concentration and meditative absorption.

original: 'jig rten la phan pa mdzad pa rjes su bsgrub par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la phan pa mdzad pa rjes su bsgrub par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He is the one who accomplishes the benefit of the world.

original: gson zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi dga' ba'i phung po lnga po khung du gyur ba de dag bsnams pas sdug bsngal bsnams pa'o //
analyzed: gson zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi dga' ba'i phung po lnga po khung du gyur ba de dag bsnams pas sdug bsngal bsnams pa'o //
translated: “He is the one who is alive” means that he is the one who has taken up the five aggregates that are not subject to degeneration.

original: bzhes zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas mngon par mi dgyes pa'i dngos po thams cad dang du bzhes shing bzhes pa'o //
analyzed: bzhes zhes bya ba ni thugs rje chen po dang ldan pas mngon par mi dgyes pa'i dngos po thams cad dang du bzhes shing bzhes pa'o //
translated: “He is the one who is to be served” means that he is the one who has taken up all things that are not subject to degeneration.

original: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni thugs rje bla na med pas bskyod pas so //
analyzed: thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni thugs rje bla na med pas bskyod pas so //
translated: “He is the one who is endowed with great compassion” means that he is the one who is moved by unsurpassed compassion.

original: 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrubs pas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten la phan par zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su bsgrubs pas so //
translated: “He is the one who is engaged in the benefit of the world” means that he is the one who accomplishes the benefit of the world.

original: srung ba gcig pu bzhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo srung dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: srung ba gcig pu bzhes bya ba ni rtag tu dran pa nye bar gzhag pa'i sgo srung dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “He is the one who is the sole protector” means that he is the one who is endowed with the door of mindfulness that is always present.

original: nyag gcig dpa' ba zhes bya ba ni grogs la mi stos ba'o //
analyzed: nyag gcig dpa' ba zhes bya ba ni grogs la mi stos ba'o //
translated: “He is the one who is the sole hero” means that he is the one who does not rely on a companion.

original: gnyis pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba gnyis pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa med pa zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba gnyis pa med pa'o //
translated: “He is the one who is without a second” means that he is the one who has no equal.

original: gnyis su mi gsung ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu nges par gsungs pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis su mi gsung ba zhes bya ba ni shin tu nges par gsungs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “he does not teach in a dualistic manner” means that he teaches with certainty.

original: snga phyi 'gal bar mi gsung ba'o //
analyzed: snga phyi 'gal bar mi gsung ba'o //
translated: He does not teach in a manner that is contradictory.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bzhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong gis bzhugs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “he abides in tranquility and insight” means that

original: zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: zhi gnas zhes bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: tranquility is meditative absorption.

original: nyes pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa zhi bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it pacifies the faults.

original: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni shes rab mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: lhag mthong zhes bya ba ni shes rab mkhas pa ste /
translated: Insight is wisdom.

original: lhag mthong gi skyes bu mkhas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag mthong gi skyes bu mkhas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is so called because it makes one a person of insight.

original: rig pa gsum gsal bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i rig pa gsum ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa gsum gsal bar mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang / skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i rig pa gsum ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: The phrase “he illuminates the three knowledges” means that he reveals the three knowledges of the former existences, the passing away and rebirth of beings, and the destruction of the impurities.

original: bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gsum rjes su @218a * //
analyzed: bslab pa gsum la legs par bslabs pa zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa gsum rjes su @218a * //
translated: The phrase “he is well trained in the three trainings” means that he is well trained in the three higher trainings of moral discipline, the mind, and wisdom.

original: bsgrub pa'o // dul ba'i gnas gsum gyi gzhi la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu 'jam pa dang gcig tu rtsub pa dang 'jam rtsub 'dren mas 'dul ba gnas gsum la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: bsgrub pa'o // dul ba'i gnas gsum gyi gzhi la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni gcig tu 'jam pa dang gcig tu rtsub pa dang 'jam rtsub 'dren mas 'dul ba gnas gsum la mkhas pa'o //
translated: 1.1.1.2.2. “He is skilled in the three bases of taming” means he is skilled in the three bases of taming: being gentle, being harsh, and being both gentle and harsh.

original: chu po bzhi las rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i chu po las rgal ba'o //
analyzed: chu po bzhi las rgal ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa dang / srid pa dang / lta ba dang / ma rig pa'i chu po las rgal ba'o //
translated: 1.1.1.2.3. “He has crossed over the four rivers” means he has crossed over the rivers of desire, existence, view, and ignorance.

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis spyod pa'i gzhi la legs par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ting de 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhis spyod pa'i gzhi la legs par gnas pa zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i ting de 'dzin spong ba'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdu 'phrul gyi rkang pa dang / sems dang / brtson 'grus dang / dpyod pa'i ting nge 'dzin spong pa'i 'du byed dang ldan pa'i rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa la'o //
translated: 1.1.1.2.4. “He is well-established in the basis of practice through the four bases of supernatural powers” means he is established in the basis of practice through the base of supernatural power that possesses the meditative stabilization of aspiration, the meditative stabilization of mind, the meditative stabilization of diligence, and the meditative stabilization of investigation that possesses the formative force of elimination.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas yongs su sbyang ba mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa la yun ring po nas goms par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi la yun ring po nas yongs su sbyang ba mdzad pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / snyan par smra ba dang / don mthun pa dang / don spyod pa la yun ring po nas goms par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He has long practiced the four means of gathering disciples. Generosity, agreeable speech, beneficent conduct, and practicing what one preaches are the four means of gathering disciples.

original: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid dang / zag pa zad pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa nyid dang / bar du gcod pa'i de bzhin du bstan pa la /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyel ba mi mnga' ba zhes bya ba ni yang dag par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa nyid dang / zag pa zad pa nyid dang / nges par 'byung ba'i lam ston pa nyid dang / bar du gcod pa'i de bzhin du bstan pa la /
translated: He is not forgetful in his four forms of fearlessness. He is not forgetful in his four forms of fearlessness, which are: perfect enlightenment, the destruction of all defilements, the obstacles to the path of salvation, and the obstacles to the path of the destruction of defilements.

original: bsnyel ba mi mnga' zhing khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam 'cha' la 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyel ba mi mnga' zhing khyu mchog rlabs po che'i gnas su dam 'cha' la 'khor gyi nang du seng ge'i sgra yang dag par sgrogs pa'o //
translated: He is not forgetful in teaching these four forms of fearlessness, and he proclaims his lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly.

original: yan lag lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang / lha ba dang / the tshom zhes bya ba 'khor bar byed pa'i yan lag lnga po dag spangs pa'o //🔽'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yan lag lnga spangs pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la 'dun pa dang / gnod sems dang / rmugs pa dang / gnyid dang / 'gyod pa dang / rgod pa dang / lha ba dang / the tshom zhes bya ba 'khor bar byed pa'i yan lag lnga po dag spangs pa'o // 'gro ba lnga las yang dag par 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase, “having abandoned the five branches” refers to the five branches of cyclic existence: sensual desire, malice, torpor, sleep, excitation, regret, and doubt.

original: lha dang mi dang sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba lha las so //
analyzed: lha dang mi dang sems can dmyal ba dang / dud 'gro dang / yi dags kyi 'gro ba lha las so //
translated: The phrase, “having transcended the five destinies” refers to the five destinies of gods, humans, hell beings, animals, and hungry ghosts.

original: yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa dag brnyes pa'o //
analyzed: yan lag drug dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni rdzu 'phrul gyi yul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas dang / 'chi 'pho dang skye ba dang / zag pa zad pa shes pa dag brnyes pa'o //
translated: The phrase, “having attained the six branches” refers to the attainment of the six superknowledges: the superknowledge of magical power, the superknowledge of the divine ear, the superknowledge of the minds of others, the superknowledge of previous lives, the superknowledge of death and rebirth, and the superknowledge of the destruction of the impurities.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa dang / tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dag yongs su rdzogs pa ste /
translated: The phrase “perfection of the six perfections” refers to the perfection of generosity, morality, patience, effort, meditation, and wisdom.

original: de dag 'phel @218b ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag 'phel @218b ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They are perfected because they are increased.

original: rtag tu gnas pa drug gis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i yul drug po dag la rtag tu dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyi gnas so //
analyzed: rtag tu gnas pa drug gis gnas pa zhes bya ba ni mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rnam par shes par bya ba'i yul drug po dag la rtag tu dran pa dang / shes bzhin gyi gnas so //
translated: The phrase “always abiding in the six abodes” means that he always abides in mindfulness and vigilance with regard to the six objects of the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
analyzed: byang chub kyi yan lag bdun gyi me tog gis phyug pa zhes bya ba ni dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang /
translated: The phrase “rich with the flowers of the seven factors of enlightenment” refers to the factors of enlightenment that consist of mindfulness, the investigation of things, effort, joy, fitness, samādhi, and equanimity.

original: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi'o //
analyzed: btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag gi'o //
translated: and the limb of enlightenment of equanimity.

original: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
analyzed: lam gyi yan lag brgyad ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang /
translated: The eightfold noble path is taught, that is, right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort,

original: yang dang pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: yang dang pa'i dran pa dang / yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi 'phags pa'i lam ston par mdzad pa'o //
translated: right mindfulness, and right concentration.

original: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyom par 'jug pa la'o //
analyzed: mthar gyis gnas pa'i snyoms par 'jug pa dgu la mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan bzhi dang / gzugs med pa bzhi dang / 'gog pa'i snyom par 'jug pa la'o //
translated: Skill in the nine serial absorptions is in the four meditative concentrations, the four formless states, and the absorption of cessation.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs dang /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gnas dang gnas ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / las bdag gir bya ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par 'jug pa'i stobs dang /
translated: The phrase “endowed with the power of the ten powers” refers to the power of knowledge regarding proper and improper conditions, the power of knowledge regarding one’s deeds are one’s own, the power of knowledge regarding the absorptions, the liberations, and entering states of one-pointed concentration,

original: dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang /
analyzed: dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / khams sna tshogs pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / 'chi 'pho dang /
translated: the power of knowledge regarding superior and nonsuperior faculties, the power of knowledge regarding the various dhātus, the power of knowledge regarding the paths that lead everywhere, the power of knowledge regarding recollection of former existences, the power of knowledge regarding death and rebirth,

original: skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ngo /
analyzed: skye ba mkhyen pa'i stobs dang / zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ngo /
translated: and the power of knowledge regarding the termination of the outflows.

original: phyogs bcur snyan pas yang dag par rgyas ba zhis bya ba la /
analyzed: phyogs bcur snyan pas yang dag par rgyas ba zhis bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “his fame has spread throughout the ten directions” means that

original: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi /
analyzed: phyogs bcu zhes bya ba ni phyogs bzhi dang / phyogs mtshams bzhi /
translated: the ten directions are the four cardinal directions, the four intermediate directions,

original: steng dang / 'og go //
analyzed: steng dang / 'og go //
translated: the zenith, and the nadir.

original: brgya phrag bcur dbang bskyur ba las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brgya phrag bcur dbang bskyur ba las khyad par du 'phags pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Superior to the one who rules over a hundred times ten million means:

original: brgya phrag bcu zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi khyad par ste /
analyzed: brgya phrag bcu zhes bya ba ni grangs kyi khyad par ste /
translated: a hundred times ten million is a particular number.

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams so //
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams so //
translated: It is a world system of a thousand.

original: der dbang sgyur ba ni 'khor gyi bdag po ste /
analyzed: der dbang sgyur ba ni 'khor gyi bdag po ste /
translated: The one who rules there is the lord of the assembly.

original: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su dbang sgyur ba'i stangs pa'o //🔽de las khyad @219a * //
analyzed: stong gi 'jig rten gyi khams su dbang sgyur ba'i stangs pa'o // de las khyad @219a * //
translated: He is the one who rules over a world system of a thousand.

original: par du 'phags pa ni mthus lhag pa'o //
analyzed: par du 'phags pa ni mthus lhag pa'o //
translated: Superior to that means superior in power.

original: chos nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i tshul te /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba ni dngos po'i tshul te /
translated: The nature of things is the way things are.

original: gdon mi za bar sku don rjes su 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gdon mi za bar sku don rjes su 'grub pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that the body must be accomplished in accordance with that.

original: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum zhes bya ba ni nyid par snga dro'i cha gsum dang / mtshan mo'i thun dang po dang / gung dang tha ma gsum mo //
analyzed: nyin lan gsum mtshan lan gsum zhes bya ba ni nyid par snga dro'i cha gsum dang / mtshan mo'i thun dang po dang / gung dang tha ma gsum mo //
translated: Three times during the day and three times during the night means the three periods of the morning, the three periods of the night, and the three periods of the middle of the day and the middle of the night.

original: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi spyan gyis zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyis so //
translated: With the eye of the Buddha means with the wisdom of omniscience.

original: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba la'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten la zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba la'o //
translated: In the world means in the beings of the three realms.

original: rnam par gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags nas so //
analyzed: rnam par gzigs nas zhes bya ba ni so sor brtags nas so //
translated: Having seen means having investigated.

original: nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dag las ltung ba'o //
analyzed: nyams par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dge ba'i chos dag las ltung ba'o //
translated: They will decline means they will fall from the virtues of faith, etc.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dge ba de dag gis nye bar sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dad pa la sogs pa dge ba de dag gis nye bar sogs par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: They will increase means they will be nourished by those virtues of faith, etc.

original: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes bya ba ni lus kyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: Harm means suffering of the body.

original: nya ma nga bzhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: nya ma nga bzhes bya ba ni sdug pa dang bral ba'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Calamity means the suffering of being separated from the loved.

original: kha cig na re gnod pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: kha cig na re gnod pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Some say that harm means

original: dbyung bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbyung bar dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: that which is difficult to remove.

original: nyam nga bzhes bya ba ni phyir bcos pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyam nga bzhes bya ba ni phyir bcos pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Calamity means that which has no opportunity for remedy.

original: mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni gnod pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Misery means that which has the nature of harm.

original: gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang / mi bde ba zhes bya ba bsdus pa ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa dang nyam nga ba dang / mi bde ba zhes bya ba bsdus pa ni sdug bsngal 'byung ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The words “harm, distress, and unhappiness” are included because suffering occurs.

original: gang ni ngan song la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / ngan song zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang ni ngan song la zhes bya ba la sogs pa dang / ngan song zhes bya ba ni sems can dmyal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Those who are headed for the lower realms” and so on. The “lower realms” are the hells and so on.

original: gzhol ba dang / 'bab pa dang / bab pa zhes bya ba ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam pas mngon par phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: gzhol ba dang / 'bab pa dang / bab pa zhes bya ba ni chung du dang / 'bring dang / chen po'i rnam pas mngon par phyogs pa'o //
translated: “Headed for,” “descending,” and “fallen” refer to the lesser, medium, and great stages of orientation.

original: kha cig na re gzhol zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i las kyi sbyor ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhol zhes bya ba ni ngan song ba'i las kyi sbyor ba byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Some say that “headed for” means the preparation for the karma that leads to the lower realms.

original: 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi dngos gzhi yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bab pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi dngos gzhi yongs su rdzogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Descending” means the completion of the actual karma.

original: bab pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi mjug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: bab pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi mjug yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: “Fallen” means the completion of the conclusion of the karma.

original: mtho ris zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'jig rten no //
analyzed: mtho ris zhes bya ba ni lha'i 'jig rten no //
translated: “Headed for the higher realms” means the divine world.

original: thar pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum las thar pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: thar pa zhes bya ba ni dus gsum las thar pa gsum pa ste /
translated: “Headed for liberation” means the third stage of liberation from the three times.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: Nirvana.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gi tshul gyi 'bras bu'o //
translated: Fruit means the fruit of the religious life.

original: 'dod pa'i 'dam zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa ste 'dam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i 'dam zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i 'dod pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i 'dod pa ste 'dam dang chos mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Mud of desire means the desire for things and the desire for the passions, because they are similar to mud.

original: 'phags pa'i nor @219b zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi nor bdun po dag go //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i nor @219b zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i dad pa dang / tshul khrims dang ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / thos pa dang / gtong ba dang / shes rab kyi nor bdun po dag go //
translated: Noble wealth means the seven riches of the noble ones: faith, morality, shame, conscience, learning, generosity, and wisdom.

original: 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas la dad pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
analyzed: 'bras bu dang bcas pa zhes bya ba ni gnas la dad pa la sogs pa'i rim gyis so //
translated: With fruit means by the order of faith in the holy men, etc.

original: dge ba'i rtsa bdag la bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma spangs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa bdag la bskyed pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ma spangs pa'o //
translated: Having generated the roots of virtue means not having abandoned the aids to liberation.

original: yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni mthus shes shing spel ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed pa zhes bya ba ni mthus shes shing spel ba'o //
translated: Ripening means knowing and increasing by power.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bur 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Liberation means becoming a fruit.

original: mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mkhyen pa dang gzigs pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: Knowledge and seeing.

original: mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: Knowledge is the determination of an object.

original: yang na rang gi ngo bo nges par rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na rang gi ngo bo nges par rtogs pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is the understanding of its own nature.

original: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ste bye brag tu so sor rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni rtog pa ste bye brag tu so sor rtog pa'o //
translated: Seeing is the discernment of a particular object.

original: kha cig na re mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis mkhyen par bya ba'i dngos po mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni yid kyis mkhyen par bya ba'i dngos po mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Some say: Knowledge is the knowledge of an object that is known by the mind.

original: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni spyan gyis gzigs par bya ba dngos po gzigs pa'o //
analyzed: gzigs pa zhes bya ba ni spyan gyis gzigs par bya ba dngos po gzigs pa'o //
translated: Seeing is the seeing of an object that is seen by the eye.

original: yang na med pa la med par mkhyen pa dang / yod pa la yod par gzigs pa ste go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na med pa la med par mkhyen pa dang / yod pa la yod par gzigs pa ste go rims bzhin no //
translated: Or else, knowledge is the knowledge of the non-existent as non-existent, and seeing is the seeing of the existent as existent, respectively.

original: yang na mkhyen pa ni zag pa med pa'i yul mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: yang na mkhyen pa ni zag pa med pa'i yul mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Or else, knowledge is the knowledge of the object of the uncontaminated path.

original: gzigs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i yul gzigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzigs pa ni 'jig rten pa'i yul gzigs pa'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Seeing is the seeing of the object of the contaminated path.

original: smras pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sdud pa stod pa byed pa las so //🔽chu srin gnas kyi dug can pa //
analyzed: smras pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par sdud pa stod pa byed pa las so //🔽chu srin gnas kyi dug can pa //
translated: It is said that the Bhagavān, the Blessed One, the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, the One with Skillful Means, the One with Great Compassion, the One with the Power of Knowledge, the One with the Power of Great Compassion, the One with the Power of Great Skillful Means, the One with the Power of Great Vows, the One with the Power of Great Wisdom, the One with the Power of Great Renunciation, the One with the Power of Great Strength, the One with the Power of Great Courage, the One with the Power of Great Effort, the One with the Power of Great Diligence, the One with the Power of Great Perseverance, the One with the Power of Great Endurance, the One with the Power of Great Patience, the One with the Power of Great Joy, the One with the Power of Great Faith, the One with the Power of Great Concentration, the One with the Power of Great Wisdom, the One with the Power of Great Liberation, the One with the Power of Great Knowledge, the One with the Power of Great Skillful Means, the One with the Power of Great Compassion, the One with the Power of Great Renunciation, the One with the Power of Great Strength, the One with the Power of Great Courage, the One with the Power of Great Effort, the One with the Power of Great Diligence, the One with the Power of Great Perseverance, the One with the Power of Great Endurance, the One with the Power of Great Patience, the One with the Power of Great Joy, the One with the Power of Great Faith, the One with the Power of Great Concentration, the One with the Power of Great Wisdom, the One with the Power of Great Liberation, the One with the Power of Great Knowledge, the One with the Power of Great Skillful Means, the One with the Power

original: zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho chen po'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rgya mtsho chen po'o //
translated: This is the great ocean.

original: de ni chu srin gyi gnas kyang yin la /
analyzed: de ni chu srin gyi gnas kyang yin la /
translated: It is the abode of sea monsters and

original: dug can pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dug can pa yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is poisonous.

original: chu srin smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
analyzed: chu srin smos pa ni mtshon pa tsam ste /
translated: The mention of sea monsters is merely an illustration;

original: nya chen dang / nya chen med dang nya chen mid chen po la sogs pa srog chags 'byung po gzhan gyi gnas kyang yin no //
analyzed: nya chen dang / nya chen med dang nya chen mid chen po la sogs pa srog chags 'byung po gzhan gyi gnas kyang yin no //
translated: it is also the abode of other creatures such as whales, whale-eaters, and great whale-eaters.

original: chu srin gyi gnas dang dgu can pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi ga smos pa ni /
analyzed: chu srin gyi gnas dang dgu can pa zhes bya ba'i tshig gnyi ga smos pa ni /
translated: The mention of both the abode of sea monsters and poisonous

analyzed: rgyal ba dug can gyis bsogs pa'i chu klung dang / rdzing bu gzhan dag kyang yod pas de las dgar bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: is for the purpose of excluding other rivers and ponds that are poisonous.

original: dus las zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du rlabs byung ba'i dus las so //
analyzed: dus las zhes bya ba ni dus gsum du rlabs byung ba'i dus las so //
translated: In time means in the time of the occurrence of the waves in the three times.

original: 'da' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yol bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'da' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yol bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Passing over means passing by.

original: gdul ba zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i skye po la'o //
analyzed: gdul ba zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i skye po la'o //
translated: Those to be disciplined means those who are to be disciplined.

original: byams pa zhes bya ba ni spyan ras gzigs kyis 'tsho ba'o //
analyzed: byams pa zhes bya ba ni spyan ras gzigs kyis 'tsho ba'o //
translated: Loving means those who live by Avalokita.

original: rtog cing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rtog cing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Thinking means

original: dus thams cad du byams pa'i bsam pas nye bar gnas par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du byams pa'i bsam pas nye bar gnas par byed pa'o //
translated: to remain with a loving attitude at all times.

original: de srog srung bar byed ces bya ba ni /🔽sbrul dang / dug dang / @220a * //
analyzed: de srog srung bar byed ces bya ba ni / sbrul dang / dug dang / @220a * //
translated: He protects their lives means🔽that he protects them from snakes, poison,

original: tsher ma la sogs pa srog la gnod pa dag las kun du srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: tsher ma la sogs pa srog la gnod pa dag las kun du srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: thorns, and so forth, which are harmful to life.

original: gdul ba'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gdul ba'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni gdul bar bya ba'i sems can gyi tshogs so //
translated: The group of beings to be trained means the group of sentient beings to be trained.

original: rtog par mdzad ces bya ba ni bu gcig pa la byams pa dang 'dra bar dus thams cad du byams par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: rtog par mdzad ces bya ba ni bu gcig pa la byams pa dang 'dra bar dus thams cad du byams par mdzad pa'o //
translated: He thinks means that he loves them at all times, like a mother loves her only son.

original: de srog srung bar mdzad ces bya ba ni rgyud la 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i rgyu dang mi mthun pa dag la kun nas srung bar mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: de srog srung bar mdzad ces bya ba ni rgyud la 'phags pa'i lam skye ba'i rgyu dang mi mthun pa dag la kun nas srung bar mdzad pa'o //
translated: He protects their lives means that he protects them from causes that are incompatible with the arising of the noble path in their mental continuums.

original: ji ltar de ltar rtog par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de ltar rtog par mdzad ce na /
translated: How does he think in this way?

original: de'i phyir kun mkhyen zhes bya ba sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun mkhyen zhes bya ba sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it says, the Omniscient One, and so forth.

original: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje ba bzhon ma lha bu mnga' ba gang yin pa de 'dul ba 'khor ba'i btson rar 'khyams pa be'u lta bu dag tshol bas mi skyo ba de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa 'dul ba'i skye bo
analyzed: gang gi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje ba bzhon ma lha bu mnga' ba gang yin pa de 'dul ba 'khor ba'i btson rar 'khyams pa be'u lta bu dag tshol bas mi skyo ba de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa 'dul ba'i skye bo
translated: Because the compassion that exists in the continuum of the Tathāgata, like a horse, never tires of seeking out those to be tamed, like a calf, who wander in the prison of saṃsāra, therefore the Tathāgata

original: rtog par mdzad cing de'i srog srung bar mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: rtog par mdzad cing de'i srog srung bar mdzad do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: is engaged in the welfare of those to be tamed and protects their lives.🔽Therefore,

original: de'i phyir / gdul ba srid dang ngan 'gros nyams la byams pa ni //
analyzed: de'i phyir / gdul ba srid dang ngan 'gros nyams la byams pa ni //
translated: His love for those to be tamed who are weak from existence and bad rebirth

original: rab nyams be'u la byams pa yi ba bzhin no //🔽zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: rab nyams be'u la byams pa yi ba bzhin no // zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: is like a mother’s love for her calf.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje ni ba bzhon drus ma lta bu yin la gdul ba'i skye bo srid pa dang / ngan 'gros nyams pa ni be'u lta bu yin pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud la mnga' ba'i thugs rje ni ba bzhon drus ma lta bu yin la gdul ba'i skye bo srid pa dang / ngan 'gros nyams pa ni be'u lta bu yin pas /
translated: The compassion that exists in the continuum of the Tathāgata is like an unbroken horse, and those to be tamed who are weak from existence and bad rebirth are like a calf.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rjes gdul ba'i skye bo tshol bas mi skyo ba ni ba bzhon drus ma be'u tshol bas mi skyo ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i thugs rjes gdul ba'i skye bo tshol bas mi skyo ba ni ba bzhon drus ma be'u tshol bas mi skyo ba dang 'dra'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Tathāgata’s compassion is not wearied by seeking disciples to be disciplined, like a cow with a young calf is not wearied by seeking her calf.
