original: bya ba lhag par byas pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba lhag par byas pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha dang mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba 'phags pa'o //
translated: “The roots of virtue conducive to liberation have been planted” means the roots of virtue conducive to liberation have been planted by the āryas.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su brtas pa ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba'i tshogs bsags pa zhes bya ba ni thar pa'i cha mthun pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su brtas pa ste /
translated: “The roots of virtue conducive to liberation have been accumulated” means the roots of virtue conducive to liberation have been fully developed.

original: 'bras bu bskyed pa la mngon du phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu bskyed pa la mngon du phyogs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “They are directed toward producing the fruit” means they are directed toward producing the fruit.

original: de nyid 'bras bu yongs su smin pa mtshon gyis brtol ba la sdod pa lta bu zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: de nyid 'bras bu yongs su smin pa mtshon gyis brtol ba la sdod pa lta bu zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: “They are like a ripe fruit ready to fall” illustrates the fruit.

original: ci 'di gnyis re zhig ston pas gdul ba yin nam /
analyzed: ci 'di gnyis re zhig ston pas gdul ba yin nam /
translated: Are these two disciples taught by the Teacher?

original: 'on te nyan thos kyis gdul ba yin snyam du dgongs na zhes byad ba la sogs pa'i tshig de ni nyan thos kyis gdul ba thams cad 'dul bar mi 'gyur ba dgag pa yin gyi ston pas gdul ba kha cig mi gdul bar dgag pa ni ma yin
analyzed: 'on te nyan thos kyis gdul ba yin snyam du dgongs na zhes byad ba la sogs pa'i tshig de ni nyan thos kyis gdul ba thams cad 'dul bar mi 'gyur ba dgag pa yin gyi ston pas gdul ba kha cig mi gdul bar dgag pa ni ma yin
translated: If he thinks, Should I tame him with the Disciple Vehicle? and so on, the words he would not be tamed refute the possibility that not all disciples are tamed by the Disciple Vehicle, but do not refute the possibility that some disciples are not tamed by the Teacher.

original: te / 'di ltar ston pas ni gdul @220b ba thams cad 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: te / 'di ltar ston pas ni gdul @220b ba thams cad 'dul bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: For the Teacher does tame all disciples.

original: sgo gang nas zhes bya ba ni gdul bar 'gyur ba'i thabs gang nas so //
analyzed: sgo gang nas zhes bya ba ni gdul bar 'gyur ba'i thabs gang nas so //
translated: By what door? means By what method of taming?

original: 'dug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstan la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dug par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni bstan la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would enter means he would enter the teaching.

original: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul zhes bya ba ni nam mkha' la 'gro ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Miracles means such things as walking on water.

original: spyod lam lam zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: spyod lam lam zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba dang / 'ong ba la sogs pa bya ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: Behavior means such things as going and coming, which are characterized by activity.

original: yid sdung par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dang po skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yid sdung par byed pa zhes bya ba ni dang po skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: He would be disheartened means he would be discouraged at first.

original: sems shig ces bya ba ni ltos shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: sems shig ces bya ba ni ltos shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: He would think means he would consider.

original: cang mi smra bas zhes bya ba ni kha rog pas so //
analyzed: cang mi smra bas zhes bya ba ni kha rog pas so //
translated: By remaining silent means by remaining silent.

original: blang ba zhes bya ba ni dang du blangs pas so //🔽mngon par bstod pas zhes bya ba ni sems kyis khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: blang ba zhes bya ba ni dang du blangs pas so // mngon par bstod pas zhes bya ba ni sems kyis khas blangs pa'o //
translated: By accepting means by accepting.🔽By praising means by praising in mind.

original: rjes su yi rangs pa zhes bya ba ni de lta lags so zhes tshig gi bstod pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su yi rangs pa zhes bya ba ni de lta lags so zhes tshig gi bstod pa'o //
translated: By rejoicing means by praising with the words “Excellent!”

original: snga dro zhes bya ba ni gung tshigs kyi mdun rol lo //
analyzed: snga dro zhes bya ba ni gung tshigs kyi mdun rol lo //
translated: In the morning means before noon.

original: sham thabs bgos zhes bya ba ni smad kyi gos bgos ba'o /
analyzed: sham thabs bgos zhes bya ba ni smad kyi gos bgos ba'o /
translated: Wearing the lower robe means wearing the lower garment.

original: 'di ltar sham thabs ni snga nas kyang bgos zin mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar sham thabs ni snga nas kyang bgos zin mod kyi /
translated: Although the lower robe has already been worn,

original: 'on kyang spyod yul du 'jug pa'i tshe legs par bcos pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang spyod yul du 'jug pa'i tshe legs par bcos pa yin pas nyes pa med do //
translated: nevertheless, there is no fault because it is well-arranged when entering the village.

original: kha cig na re sham thabs kyi gzhan gyon gyon pa phud de spyod yul du 'jug khar sham thabs nyid bgos pa la bya'o zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sham thabs kyi gzhan gyon gyon pa phud de spyod yul du 'jug khar sham thabs nyid bgos pa la bya'o zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some say that it means taking off the other lower robe and wearing the lower robe when entering the village.

original: ltung bzed thogs zhes bya ba ni lag na thogs pa'o //
analyzed: ltung bzed thogs zhes bya ba ni lag na thogs pa'o //
translated: Carrying the alms bowl means holding it in the hand.

original: chos gos thogs zhes bya ba ni stod kyi gom bgos pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos thogs zhes bya ba ni stod kyi gom bgos pa'o //
translated: Wearing the upper robe means wearing the upper garment.

original: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni phar 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni phar 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going means going forward.

original: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa'o //🔽cung zang lta ba zhes bya ba ni mdun du lta ba'o //
analyzed: ldog pa zhes bya ba ni phyir ldog pa'o // cung zang lta ba zhes bya ba ni mdun du lta ba'o //
translated: Returning means coming back.🔽Looking ahead means looking in front.

original: rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba ni g-yas du lta ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par lta ba zhes bya ba ni g-yas du lta ba'o //
translated: Looking around means looking to the right.

original: bskum pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa bskum pa'o //
analyzed: bskum pa zhes bya ba ni lag pa la sogs pa bskum pa'o //
translated: Contracting means drawing in the arms and so forth.

original: brkyang ba zhes bya ba yang lag pa la sogs pa brkyang ba'o //
analyzed: brkyang ba zhes bya ba yang lag pa la sogs pa brkyang ba'o //
translated: Extending means stretching out the arms and so forth.

original: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam phran gyi glegs bu sbyar ba'i gos stod du bgo ba'o //
analyzed: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam phran gyi glegs bu sbyar ba'i gos stod du bgo ba'o //
translated: Wearing the patched robe means wearing the upper garment made of patches.

original: chos gos zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar las gzhan pa bla gos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos gos zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar las gzhan pa bla gos la sogs pa'o //
translated: Wearing the Dharma robe means wearing the upper robe and so forth, which are different from the patched robe.

original: bya ba zhig gi phyir zhes bya ba ni don gtso bo ma yin pas ming mi smos so ;
analyzed: bya ba zhig gi phyir zhes bya ba ni don gtso bo ma yin pas ming mi smos so ;
translated: For the sake of some action means that since it is not the primary purpose, it is not mentioned by name.

original: ; gang gi phyir ni rab tu byung ba zhes byad ba ni rab tu byung ba mthong ngam /
analyzed: ; gang gi phyir ni rab tu byung ba zhes byad ba ni rab tu byung ba mthong ngam /
translated: For what purpose? means for the purpose of seeing the fully ordained.

original: thos pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: thos pa'i phyir rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: He went forth in order to hear the Dharma.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Delight” means desire.

original: lam chen po zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i lam mo //
analyzed: lam chen po zhes bya ba ni shing rta'i lam mo //
translated: “Great road” means a road for carts.

original: de ni yangs pa yang yod pas de'i phyir rub pa zhes bya ba ni smos te /
analyzed: de ni yangs pa yang yod pas de'i phyir rub pa zhes bya ba ni smos te /
translated: Since it is also wide, it is called “crowded.”

original: srang dog pa @221a * //🔽bsgugs sla bzhig na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: srang dog pa @221a * // bsgugs sla bzhig na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Narrow” means🔽“crowded.”

original: 'gro ba dang ldog pas zhes bya ba ni chags pas so //
analyzed: 'gro ba dang ldog pas zhes bya ba ni chags pas so //
translated: “Going and coming” means attachment.

original: shas cher zhes bya ba ni gtso cher te zhar la don gzhan yang byed pa'o //
analyzed: shas cher zhes bya ba ni gtso cher te zhar la don gzhan yang byed pa'o //
translated: “Mostly” means “predominantly,” but it also has other meanings.

original: sdod cing zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'o //
analyzed: sdod cing zhes bya ba ni sdod pa'o //
translated: “Staying” means “dwelling.”

original: dge sbyong goo ta ma zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
analyzed: dge sbyong goo ta ma zhes bya ba smos pa ni /
translated: The statement “the śramaṇa Gautama”

original: gzhan dag de skad zer ba'i tshig gi rjes snyegs pa yin gyi tshe dang ldan pa rta thul nyid ni ston pa la de skad ces mi brjod do //
analyzed: gzhan dag de skad zer ba'i tshig gi rjes snyegs pa yin gyi tshe dang ldan pa rta thul nyid ni ston pa la de skad ces mi brjod do //
translated: is a repetition of the words that others say. The venerable Aśvajit himself would not say this about the Teacher.

original: goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni drong  srong goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: goo ta ma zhes bya ba ni drong  srong goo ta ma'i rgyud yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Gautama” is because he is of the Gautama family of sages.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub ces bya ba ni bla na med pa'i mkhyen pa'o //
translated: Supreme perfect enlightenment is the supreme knowledge.

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni brnyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ba ni brnyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: Fully awakened means having attained.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i chos so //
translated: The Dharma is the Dharma of teaching.

original: ston cig ces bya ba ni smos shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: ston cig ces bya ba ni smos shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Teach means explain.

original: na gzhon zhes bya ba ni na tshod gzhon pa'o //
analyzed: na gzhon zhes bya ba ni na tshod gzhon pa'o //
translated: Youth means young age.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni chos so //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni chos so //
translated: Teaching means the Dharma.

original: sla ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi nus te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sla ba ma yin te zhes bya ba ni mi nus te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is not easy means it is not possible.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni ston pa'i 'o //
translated: His means the Teacher's.

original: chos gang rgyus byung zhes bya ba ni sogs pa la chos gang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: chos gang rgyus byung zhes bya ba ni sogs pa la chos gang zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa 'dus byas kyi dngos po rnams so //
translated: The Dharma that arises from causes means the Dharma that arises from causes. The Dharma that arises from causes means the five appropriated aggregates that arise from causes and become results.

original: rgyus byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu la brten te /
analyzed: rgyus byung zhes bya ba ni rgyu la brten te /
translated: Arising from causes means depending on causes.

original: byung ba 'bras bur gyur pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung ba 'bras bur gyur pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Arising from causes means the five appropriated aggregates that arise from causes and become results.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan te de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan te de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, this teaches the truth of suffering, and it should be applied that “the Tathāgata taught this.🔽”

original: de dag gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan ma thag pa'i chos gang dag rgyu la brten te /
analyzed: de dag gi rgyu zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan ma thag pa'i chos gang dag rgyu la brten te /
translated: The cause of those is the cause of those phenomena that were just taught,

original: byung ba de dag gi rgyu ste rgyur gyur pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byung ba de dag gi rgyu ste rgyur gyur pa'i nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: which is the appropriated aggregates that are the cause, that is, the cause that is the basis.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, this teaches the truth of origin,

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and it should be applied that “the Tathāgata taught this.🔽”

original: de 'gog pa gang yin pa'ang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal te 'gog pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: de 'gog pa gang yin pa'ang zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal te 'gog pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: The cessation of that is the cessation of suffering,

original: mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: that is, nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan te /
translated: Thus, this teaches the truth of cessation,

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal te zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: and it should be applied that “the Tathāgata taught this.🔽”

original: dge sbyong chen po zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gzhan dag pas gtso bor gyur pa ste sdig pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge sbyong chen po zhes bya ba ni dge sbyong gzhan dag pas gtso bor gyur pa ste sdig pa zhi ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term great ascetic means that he is the foremost of all ascetics, because he has pacified all evil.

original: de skad gsungs zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i dang tshul can te /
analyzed: de skad gsungs zhes bya ba ni gsungs pa'i dang tshul can te /
translated: The term thus indicates the manner in which he spoke.

original: @221b 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa bstan te /
analyzed: @221b 'dis ni lam gyi bden pa bstan te /
translated: This refers to the truth of the path.

original: de skad ces bya ba'i sgra smos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skad ces bya ba'i sgra smos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term thus is mentioned, it is the path that is indicated by the term thus.

original: 'di ltar de skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste de ltar sga yang ji ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra dang sbyar ro //🔽des nas ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rgyu dang bcas pa de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: 'di ltar de skad ces bya ba'i sgra ni de ltar zhes bya ba ste de ltar sga yang ji ltar zhes bya ba'i sgra dang sbyar ro // des nas ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rgyu dang bcas pa de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal pa /
translated: The term thus is like the term in this way, and the term in this way is like the term how.

original: de ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa yang rgyu dang bcas par de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to zhes sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar 'gog pa'i bden pa yang rgyu dang bcas par de bzhin gshegs pas bka' stsal to zhes sbyar ro //
translated: Just as the Tathāgata spoke of the truth of suffering and its cause, in this way, the Tathāgata spoke of the truth of cessation and its cause.

original: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na tshigs su bcad pa 'dis ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this verse teaches the four noble truths.

original: kha cig na re chos gang zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re chos gang zhes bya ba 'dis ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa ste /
translated: Some say: The phrase “any dharma” indicates the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba 'dis ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “its cause” indicates the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis bstan te /
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba 'dis ni 'gog pa'i bden pa dang / lam gyi bden pa gnyis bstan te /
translated: The phrase “its cessation” indicates both the truth of cessation and the truth of the path,

original: de gnyis 'brel ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de gnyis 'brel ba'i phyir te /
translated: because these two are related.

original: 'di ltar bya ba bsgrub pas ni 'gog pa bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ba bsgrub pas ni 'gog pa bstan te /
translated: For the truth of cessation is taught by the accomplishment of action,

original: 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gog pa ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin no //
translated: and cessation is nirvana.

original: byed pa bsgrub pas ni lam bstan te /
analyzed: byed pa bsgrub pas ni lam bstan te /
translated: The truth of the path is taught by the accomplishment of activity,

original: lam 'dis 'gog par byed pas na 'gog par byed pa ni lam yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lam 'dis 'gog par byed pas na 'gog par byed pa ni lam yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: because this path causes cessation, and that which causes cessation is the path.

original: yang kha cig na re chos gang zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: yang kha cig na re chos gang zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: Some say: The phrase “any dharma” indicates the truth of suffering.

original: rgyu zhes bya bas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya bas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “its cause” indicates the truth of origin.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya bas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya bas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: The phrase “its cessation” indicates the truth of cessation.

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lam gyi bden pa bstan to /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgras ni lam gyi bden pa bstan to /
translated: The word “also” indicates the truth of the path.

original: 'di ltar 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni bsdu ba'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra 'di ni bsdu ba'i don to //
translated: The word “also” has the sense of “including.”

original: des na ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rgyu dang bcas par gsungs pa de bzhin du 'gog pa'i bden pa la rgyu dang bcas par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: des na ji ltar sdug bsngal gyi bden pa rgyu dang bcas par gsungs pa de bzhin du 'gog pa'i bden pa la rgyu dang bcas par gsungs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, just as the truth of suffering is taught along with its cause, so the truth of cessation is taught along with its cause.

original: lam ni 'gog pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag gi / skyed pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: lam ni 'gog pa thob pa'i rgyu nyid du rnam par gzhag gi / skyed pa'i rgyu nyid ni ma yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: The path is established as the cause for attaining cessation, but it is not the cause for producing it.

original: chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam pa 'am chos kyi go rims so //
analyzed: chos kyi rnam grangs zhes bya ba ni chos kyi rnam pa 'am chos kyi go rims so //
translated: The term “Dharma discourse” means the aspects of the Dharma or the order of the Dharma.

original: bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: bden pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The four truths are characterized by the following:

original: chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong bas te /
analyzed: chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi mthong bas te /
translated: The term “in regard to phenomena” means in regard to the four noble truths.

original: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽rdul med ces bya ba ni phra rgyas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // rdul med ces bya ba ni phra rgyas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “stream-enterer” means the fruit of stream-entry.🔽The term “free from dust” means free from the proclivities.

original: dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dri ma dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni kun nas dkris pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “free from defilements” means free from the entanglements.

original: yang na rdul med ces bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro //🔽dri ma dang bral @222a * //
analyzed: yang na rdul med ces bya ba ni gsal bar snang ba'i phyir ro // dri ma dang bral @222a * //
translated: Or else, “without dust” means that it is clear, because it appears clearly.

original: ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Free from defilements” means that it is without outflows.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba ste //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis gsal ba ste //
translated: It is clear by the power of meditation,

original: 'jigs la sogs pa sdang ba bzhin //🔽shes pa ma nor mi rtog pa //
analyzed: 'jigs la sogs pa sdang ba bzhin // shes pa ma nor mi rtog pa //
translated: like fear and so on, which are clear.

original: gang yin de ni mngon sum mo //
analyzed: gang yin de ni mngon sum mo //
translated: That knowledge which is nonerroneous and nonconceptual🔽is direct perception.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //
translated: And so on.

original: skyes so zhes bya ba ni thos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: skyes so zhes bya ba ni thos pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Arisen” means “heard.”

original: chos mthong ba zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos mthong ba zhes bya bas ni sdug bsngal gyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: “Seen the Dharma” refers to the truth of suffering.

original: chos thob pa zhes bya bas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos thob pa zhes bya bas ni 'gog pa'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: “Attained the Dharma” refers to the truth of cessation.

original: chos rig pa zhes bya bas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos rig pa zhes bya bas ni kun 'byung ba'i bden pa bstan to //
translated: “Realized the Dharma” refers to the truth of the origin of suffering.

original: chos kyi gting slebs zhes bya bas ni lam gyi bden pa bstan to //
analyzed: chos kyi gting slebs zhes bya bas ni lam gyi bden pa bstan to //
translated: “Reached the depths of the Dharma” refers to the truth of the path.

original: som nyi las rgal ba zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas bag chags kyis bsgos pas chos rnams ma rtogs pa rtogs par 'dod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: som nyi las rgal ba zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa'i dus nas bag chags kyis bsgos pas chos rnams ma rtogs pa rtogs par 'dod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Having crossed over doubt means that, because of being stained by habitual tendencies since beginningless time, one is free from the desire to realize what has not been realized.

original: the tshom rgal ba zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i yul la yid gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: the tshom rgal ba zhes bya ba ni bden pa'i yul la yid gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: Having crossed over hesitation means being free from doubt regarding the object of the truths.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis chos rnams rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyis chos rnams rtogs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rkyen gyis mi 'gro ba'o //
translated: Not relying on others means not going by the conditions of others because one has realized the dharmas by oneself.

original: gzhan gyis mi bkri ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bkri bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis mi bkri ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bkri bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Not being led by others means not being able to be led by others.

original: ston pa'i bstan pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i chos rnams la'o //
analyzed: ston pa'i bstan pa'i chos rnams la zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i chos rnams la'o //
translated: The dharmas taught by the Teacher means the explained dharmas.

original: mi 'jigs pa thob ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa thob pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa thob ces bya ba ni chos rnams kyi rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid yongs su shes pa'i phyir mi 'jigs pa thob pa'o //
translated: Having attained fearlessness means having attained fearlessness because of thoroughly knowing the specific and general characteristics of the dharmas.

original: bla gos zhes bya ba ni steng du bgo ba'i gos so //
analyzed: bla gos zhes bya ba ni steng du bgo ba'i gos so //
translated: Upper robe means the robe worn on top.

original: phrag pa gcig tu zhes bya ba ni phrag pa ya gcig tu'o //
analyzed: phrag pa gcig tu zhes bya ba ni phrag pa ya gcig tu'o //
translated: On one shoulder means on one side.

original: thal mo sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni lag mthil gnyis sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar ba zhes bya ba ni lag mthil gnyis sbyar ba'o //
translated: With palms joined means with the two palms joined together.

original: btud de zhes bya ba ni brkyang ste'o //
analyzed: btud de zhes bya ba ni brkyang ste'o //
translated: Bowing means stretching out.

original: skyob pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i skye bo yongs su srung ba la gzhol ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
analyzed: skyob pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni gdul ba'i skye bo yongs su srung ba la gzhol ba sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi'o //
translated: Of the protectors means of the Lord Buddhas, who are intent on protecting the beings to be trained.

original: chos 'di yin zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos 'di'o //
analyzed: chos 'di yin zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyi chos 'di'o //
translated: This Dharma means this Dharma which has the nature of the Four Noble Truths.

original: bskal pa zhes bya ba ni dar gyi bskal pa la sogs pa dus kyi bye brag go //
analyzed: bskal pa zhes bya ba ni dar gyi bskal pa la sogs pa dus kyi bye brag go //
translated: For eons means for the duration of a particular time, such as the eon of destruction.

original: bye ba khrag khrig ces bya ba ni bye ba khrag khrig ste /
analyzed: bye ba khrag khrig ces bya ba ni bye ba khrag khrig ste /
translated: Trillions means a trillion.

original: grangs kyi tshad kyi gnas bcu gnyis pa'o //🔽sngon chad ma mthong zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas /🔽lan 'ga' yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: grangs kyi tshad kyi gnas bcu gnyis pa'o // sngon chad ma mthong zhes bya ba ni 'khor ba thog ma med pa nas / lan 'ga' yang ma mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the twelfth stage of the measure of number.🔽Never before seen means never seen before, from beginningless cyclic existence.

original: ma thos zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma thos zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Never before heard means never heard before, without a teacher.

original: 'chi @222b med ces bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chi @222b med ces bya ba ni yongs su nyams pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Immortal” means without degeneration.

original: mya ngan med pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan med pa zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Without sorrow” means without suffering.

original: go 'phang zhes bya ba ni gnas te /
analyzed: go 'phang zhes bya ba ni gnas te /
translated: “State” means abode,

original: yon tan thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan thams cad kyi gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the abode of all good qualities.

original: rjes su rtogs zhes bya ba ni da ltar shes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su rtogs zhes bya ba ni da ltar shes par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Realization” means knowledge in the present.

original: gal bzhugs zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
analyzed: gal bzhugs zhes bya ba ni dri ba'o //
translated: “Where” is a question.

original: rnam par dang zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba'o //🔽yongs su dag cas bya ba ni mdangs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dang zhes bya ba ni shin tu gsal ba'o // yongs su dag cas bya ba ni mdangs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Pure” means very clear.🔽“Cleansed” means radiant.

original: yongs su dkar zhes bya ba ni ches bkrag pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su dkar zhes bya ba ni ches bkrag pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Wholesome” means very radiant.

original: da dung yang lan cig rjod cig ces bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'i phyir yang lan cig zlos su bcug pa'o //
analyzed: da dung yang lan cig rjod cig ces bya ba ni ma rtogs pa'i phyir yang lan cig zlos su bcug pa'o //
translated: “Say it again” means to repeat it once more because of non-understanding.

original: 'khor la lta ba ni legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni g-yog 'khor la lta ba bzang pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor la lta ba ni legs pa yin no zhes bya ba ni g-yog 'khor la lta ba bzang pa'o //
translated: “It is good to look at the retinue” means it is good to look at the attendants.

original: da zhes bya ba ni da ltar te 'grub pa'i dus so //
analyzed: da zhes bya ba ni da ltar te 'grub pa'i dus so //
translated: “Now” means in the present, the time of accomplishment.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa de'i 'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba zhes bya ba'i dgongs pa de'i 'o //
translated: “That” refers to the one who has gone forth.

original: shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par byos shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes par gyis shig ces bya ba ni khong du chud par byos shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Understand” means to comprehend.

original: nyin mo spyod pa zhes bya ba ni nyin par dge ba'i phyogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyin mo spyod pa zhes bya ba ni nyin par dge ba'i phyogs byed pa'o //
translated: “Daytime conduct” means to practice virtue during the day.

original: bsnyen bkur zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'o //
translated: “Service” means worship.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba ni spyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba ni spyad pa'o //
translated: “Or” means practice.

original: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
analyzed: 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni skabs so //
translated: “Arising” means opportunity.

original: gang las zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa las so //
analyzed: gang las zhes bya ba ni nye bar ston pa las so //
translated: “From where” means from the teaching.

original: chos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyis ka dang mi 'gal ba'o //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyis ka dang mi 'gal ba'o //
translated: “Dharma” means that which is not in conflict with either of the two worlds.

original: rnams shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rnams shes pa zhes bya ba ni rtogs par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Knowledge” means realization.

original: gus byas zhes bya ba ni rjes byas te'o //
analyzed: gus byas zhes bya ba ni rjes byas te'o //
translated: “Respect” means to follow.

original: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni khrus la sogs pas so //
analyzed: gtsang ma zhes bya ba ni khrus la sogs pas so //
translated: “Pure” means to wash and so on.

original: brgya phrag du ma zhes bya ba ni brgya phrag mang po'i tshad do //
analyzed: brgya phrag du ma zhes bya ba ni brgya phrag mang po'i tshad do //
translated: “Many hundreds” means a quantity of many hundreds.

original: grogs po zhes bya ba ni snying du sdug pa'o //
analyzed: grogs po zhes bya ba ni snying du sdug pa'o //
translated: “Friend” means a dear one.

original: tshogs yongs su sdud pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs yongs su srung ba ste /
analyzed: tshogs yongs su sdud pa zhes bya ba ni tshogs yongs su srung ba ste /
translated: The one who gathers the assembly is the one who protects the assembly.

original: tshogs mtha' dag sdud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs mtha' dag sdud par byed pa'o //
translated: He gathers the whole assembly.

original: tshogs yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir tshogs kyi mdun nas bdar ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su 'dren pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir tshogs kyi mdun nas bdar ba'o //
translated: The one who leads the assembly is the one who goes in front of the assembly because he is the chief.

original: mchod pa'i tshig ste /
analyzed: mchod pa'i tshig ste /
translated: These are the words of praise.

original: shin tu dge ba dang / bde ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu dge ba dang / bde ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he generates great virtue and happiness.

original: nyan thos zung zhes bya ba ni zung gcig ste /
analyzed: nyan thos zung zhes bya ba ni zung gcig ste /
translated: The pair of śrāvakas is the one pair.

original: gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is two.

original: zung gcig mchog ces bya ba ni nyan thos rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog go //
analyzed: zung gcig mchog ces bya ba ni nyan thos rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa dang / shes rab dang ldan pa rnams kyi mchog go //
translated: The supreme pair is the supreme one among those who have the superknowledges and those who have wisdom.

original: zung bzang po zhes bya ba ni tshegs chung dus gdul ba dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
analyzed: zung bzang po zhes bya ba ni tshegs chung dus gdul ba dang // gzhan la phan 'dogs pa'i phyir bzang po'o //
translated: The excellent pair is excellent because of being easy to tame and because of benefiting others.

original: dgongs yul @223a * //
analyzed: dgongs yul @223a * //
translated: The intended meaning of the Buddha’s words

original: mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa zhes bya ba ni thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul mtha' yas pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Infinite” means that it is endowed with the infinite object of omniscient knowledge.

original: skyes bu'i dbang po mkhyen mthar byon //
analyzed: skyes bu'i dbang po mkhyen mthar byon //
translated: He has arrived at the culmination of the knowledge of the faculties of beings.

original: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi dad pha la sogs pa'i dbang po mkhyen pa'i pha rol tu byon pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams kyi dad pha la sogs pa'i dbang po mkhyen pa'i pha rol tu byon pa ste /
translated: This means that he has arrived at the culmination of the knowledge of the faculties of faith, etc. of beings.

original: 'dis ni dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ldan par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni dbang po mchog dang / mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs dang ldan par bstan to //
translated: This shows that he possesses the power of knowledge of the superior and inferior faculties.🔽Having brought existence to an end,

original: srid pa mthar mdzad pas zhes bya ba ni srid pa gsum gyi mthar phyin pas so //
analyzed: srid pa mthar mdzad pas zhes bya ba ni srid pa gsum gyi mthar phyin pas so //
translated: means having reached the end of the three kinds of existence.

original: tshogs mchog ces bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun no //🔽lung bstan mdzad ces bya ba ni lung bstan par gyur pa'o ;
analyzed: tshogs mchog ces bya ba ni dge slong gi dge 'dun no // lung bstan mdzad ces bya ba ni lung bstan par gyur pa'o ;
translated: The supreme assembly is the assembly of monks.🔽He gave predictions to them.

original: ; legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: ; legs par gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa'o //
translated: Well-spoken means spoken in accordance with reality.

original: chos 'dul ba la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa'i gsung rab la'o //
analyzed: chos 'dul ba la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i don du nye bar bstan pa'i gsung rab la'o //
translated: In the Dharma and Vinaya means in the scriptures taught for the purpose of nirvana.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge slong gi dngos po'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa dge slong gi dngos po zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dge slong gi dngos po'o //
translated: The state of a fully ordained monk means the state of a fully ordained monk characterized by full ordination.

original: tshig gnyis ka smos pa ni ming gi dge slong la sogs pa bslang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gnyis ka smos pa ni ming gi dge slong la sogs pa bslang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Both terms are used to exclude those who are monks only in name.

original: dge slong tshur shog pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba yod pa de ni dge slong tshur shog pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong tshur shog pa zhes bya ba ni bya ba gang la dge slong tshur shog ces bya ba yod pa de ni dge slong tshur shog pa'o //
translated: Come, monk means that in whatever activity a monk is told, “Come, monk,” that is “Come, monk.”

original: gang la khas blang ba bya ba dang byed du 'jug pa tsam kho nas rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: gang la khas blang ba bya ba dang byed du 'jug pa tsam kho nas rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: One who becomes fully ordained merely by the act of accepting and being made to do that is a monk by the words of ordination.

original: smon lam btab pa'i phyir slob dpon la sogs pa la mi ltos pas des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
analyzed: smon lam btab pa'i phyir slob dpon la sogs pa la mi ltos pas des zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go /
translated: Because he makes a vow, he does not depend on a preceptor, etc.

original: // dge slong dag ces bya ba ni phyis dge slong du ma gyur pa la brten nas bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: // dge slong dag ces bya ba ni phyis dge slong du ma gyur pa la brten nas bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: “Monks” refers to those who later became monks.

original: bka'i mjug kho nar zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ma thag pa kho nar ro //
analyzed: bka'i mjug kho nar zhes bya ba ni bka' stsal ma thag pa kho nar ro //
translated: “Immediately” means immediately after the pronouncement.

original: lag pa lhung bzed dang byam bum gyis brel bas zhes bya ba ni lag na de dag bsrel ba'o //
analyzed: lag pa lhung bzed dang byam bum gyis brel bas zhes bya ba ni lag na de dag bsrel ba'o //
translated: “Hands busy with the alms bowl and water jar” means that they were holding those in their hands.

original: snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus dang ldan zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Bodies clothed in the outer robe” means🔽that they were wearing the outer robe.

original: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam bur dras shing sbyar ba'i chos gos te /
analyzed: snam sbyar zhes bya ba ni snam bur dras shing sbyar ba'i chos gos te /
translated: The outer robe is a Dharma robe made of cloth cut into strips and sewn together.

original: gang gi lus la de gyon pa de ni snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus dang ldan pa'o //🔽mod la dbang po rab zhig nas gyur te //
analyzed: gang gi lus la de gyon pa de ni snam sbyar gyon pa'i lus dang ldan pa'o // mod la dbang po rab zhig nas gyur te //
translated: Those whose bodies are clothed in that are “bodies clothed in the outer robe.”

original: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i mod la dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bar gnas par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i mod la dbang po rnams rab tu zhi bar gnas par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Immediately, the faculties became very calm” means that immediately after going forth, their faculties became very calm.

original: dgongs pas zhes bya ba ni thugs la dgongs pas so //
analyzed: dgongs pas zhes bya ba ni thugs la dgongs pas so //
translated: “With a thought” means with a thought in mind.

original: de dag gis ji zhig dgongs par gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gis ji zhig dgongs par gyur zhe na de'i phyir /
translated: What was the thought?

original: lus gzugs bkab par gyur ces gsungs te /
analyzed: lus gzugs bkab par gyur ces gsungs te /
translated: The text says, having covered the body's form.

original: lus @223b gzugs zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: lus @223b gzugs zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin du gnas pa'i lus kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: The body's form is the body's natural condition.

original: de bkab pa ni 'gebs shing g-yogs par byed pa ste cha lugs so //
analyzed: de bkab pa ni 'gebs shing g-yogs par byed pa ste cha lugs so //
translated: Having covered it means to conceal it, to cover it up, to put on an appearance.

original: cha lugs de dang ldan par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: cha lugs de dang ldan par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having become endowed with that appearance is what is meant.

original: rab tu mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis las lhag pa ni mang po yin no /
analyzed: rab tu mang po zhes bya ba ni gnyis las lhag pa ni mang po yin no /
translated: A great many means more than two.

original: yang dag rgyal ba can gyi mu stegs can gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni ston pa yang dag rgyal ba can gyi slob ma mu stegs can gyi gnas kun du rgyu nye rgyal dang / pang nas skyes 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag rgyal ba can gyi mu stegs can gyi gnas zhes bya ba ni ston pa yang dag rgyal ba can gyi slob ma mu stegs can gyi gnas kun du rgyu nye rgyal dang / pang nas skyes 'khor dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The abode of the tīrthikas who are the followers of Pūraṇa refers to the abode of the tīrthikas who are the disciples of the teacher Pūraṇa, namely, the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kolita, together with their retinue.

original: rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag rgyal ba can gyi slob ma mu stegs can gyi gnas pa dag rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen par mdzad pa yin gyi yang dag rgyal ba can nyid ni ma
analyzed: rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen nas zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis yang dag rgyal ba can gyi slob ma mu stegs can gyi gnas pa dag rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen par mdzad pa yin gyi yang dag rgyal ba can nyid ni ma
translated: “Having gone forth and been ordained” means that the Bhagavān allowed the disciples of Pūraṇa Kāśyapa, who were living as non-Buddhists, to go forth and be ordained.

original: yin te / de ltar dus la bab pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yin te / de ltar dus la bab pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Pūraṇa Kāśyapa himself was not allowed to do so, because his time had not come.

original: ring po ma lon pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu des rgyal po'i khab kyi mi dag yi ma rangs shing mngon par mi dga' bar gyur to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ring po ma lon pas zhes bya ba ni rgyu des rgyal po'i khab kyi mi dag yi ma rangs shing mngon par mi dga' bar gyur to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “Not long after” means that for that reason the people of Rājagṛha became displeased and disaffected.

original: yi ma rangs zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis yi chad pa'o //
analyzed: yi ma rangs zhes bya ba ni nang gi bdag nyid kyis yi chad pa'o //
translated: “Displeased” means that they were internally disappointed.

original: mngon par mi dga' zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nye bar ma zhi bas 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par mi dga' zhes bya ba ni phyi rol nye bar ma zhi bas 'khrug pa'o //
translated: “Disaffected” means that they were externally agitated because of their lack of peace.

original: de dang de dag ces bya ba ni bzlas pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
analyzed: de dang de dag ces bya ba ni bzlas pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
translated: “Those and those” is stated twice for the purpose of repetition.

original: co 'dri zhes bya ba ni zher 'debs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: co 'dri zhes bya ba ni zher 'debs par byed pa'o //
translated: “Mocking” means ridiculing.

original: grong mchog ces bya ba ni grong khyer gyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: grong mchog ces bya ba ni grong khyer gyi gtso bo'o //
translated: The “best village” is the chief city.

original: yang dag rgyal ba'i zhes bya ba ni de'i slob ma kun zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: yang dag rgyal ba'i zhes bya ba ni de'i slob ma kun zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: “The Victor’s disciples” refers to his students.

original: khrid na zhes bya ba ni rab tu phyung na'o //
analyzed: khrid na zhes bya ba ni rab tu phyung na'o //
translated: “If you lead them” means if you ordain them.

original: phyin chad ci zhig bkri bar bya zhes bya ba ni da yang gzhan ci zhig bkri bar byar yod na khyed cag yang grong khyer du lhags zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: phyin chad ci zhig bkri bar bya zhes bya ba ni da yang gzhan ci zhig bkri bar byar yod na khyed cag yang grong khyer du lhags zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: “What will you lead them to?” means “What else is there for you to lead them to now that you have returned to the city?”

original: brgyus nas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba byas nas so //
analyzed: brgyus nas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms kyi phyir rgyu ba byas nas so //
translated: “Having gone for alms” means having gone for alms.

original: zas kyi bya ba byas te zhes bya ba ni zas kyi bya ba bsgrubs pas te /
analyzed: zas kyi bya ba byas te zhes bya ba ni zas kyi bya ba bsgrubs pas te /
translated: “Having finished their meal” means having completed their meal.

original: zas zos te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zas zos te zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the same as “having eaten their meal.”🔽“Having returned from their alms round” means having returned from their alms round after the midday meal.

original: phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pa'i zhes bya ba la phyi ma'i zas zhes bya ba ni phyed yol phan chad de'i phyi dro'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i zas kyi bsod snyoms las phyir log pa'i zhes bya ba la phyi ma'i zas zhes bya ba ni phyed yol phan chad de'i phyi dro'o //
translated: “The later meal” is the afternoon meal after midday.

original: bsod snyoms las phyir log pas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms mi byed pas te /
analyzed: bsod snyoms las phyir log pas zhes bya ba ni bsod snyoms mi byed pas te /
translated: Having returned from alms-round means not having gone for alms.

original: tshig gi don phyir bsdu na /
analyzed: tshig gi don phyir bsdu na /
translated: The meaning of the words is summarized:

original: phyi dro bsod snyoms la mi rgyu bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyi dro bsod snyoms la mi rgyu bas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Not wandering for alms in the afternoon.

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab nas zhes bya ba ni so sor des pa'i gnas su rnam par bzhag nas so //
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos mkhos su phab nas zhes bya ba ni so sor des pa'i gnas su rnam par bzhag nas so //
translated: Having put away the bowl and robe means having placed them in their respective proper places.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni lus kyi'o //🔽mi bde @224a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni lus kyi'o // mi bde @224a * //
translated: Suffering refers to physical suffering.

original: bas zhes bya ba ni sems kyis te /
analyzed: bas zhes bya ba ni sems kyis te /
translated: Pain refers to mental suffering.

original: de gnyis ni bya ba'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis ni bya ba'i bye brag yin no //
translated: These two are specific actions.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni bstan pa 'di la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni bstan pa 'di la'o //
translated: Here refers to this teaching.

original: dpa' chen zhes bya ba ni stobs bla na med pa dang ldan pa'am bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpa' chen zhes bya ba ni stobs bla na med pa dang ldan pa'am bdud bzhi bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Great hero means possessing unsurpassed strength or having conquered the four demons.

original: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis yin gyi nan khugs kyis ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyis zhes bya ba ni dam pa'i chos kyis yin gyi nan khugs kyis ma yin pa'o //
translated: By the Dharma means by the true Dharma, not by force.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o //
translated: Wise means knowing.

original: mi bzod ces bya ba ni su zhig mi bzod pa skyed par byed ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi bzod ces bya ba ni su zhig mi bzod pa skyed par byed ces bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase one who is intolerant refers to one who generates intolerance.

original: rlom pa tsam zhes bya ba ni khengs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rlom pa tsam zhes bya ba ni khengs pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase mere conceit refers to haughtiness.

original: sbobs pa tsam zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbobs pa tsam zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa nyid do //
translated: The phrase mere courage refers to fearlessness.

original: sgo ba zhes bya ba ni sgo srung ngo //
analyzed: sgo ba zhes bya ba ni sgo srung ngo //
translated: The phrase gatekeeper refers to a doorkeeper.

original: bzhin gyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni ngo shes par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid kyi rtags so //
analyzed: bzhin gyi gzugs zhes bya ba ni ngo shes par 'gyur ba'i mtshan ma kha dog dang / dbyibs kyi mtshan nyid kyi rtags so //
translated: The phrase facial expression refers to a sign that is recognized by others and that is characterized by a particular color and shape.

original: mngon du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o //🔽yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsnyun gsol ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon du zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du'o // yang dag par dga' bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bsnyun gsol ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase in person means in the presence of.🔽The phrase delights them means they are pleased by them.

original: yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i gtam thos pas mgu ba skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag par mgu bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i gtam thos pas mgu ba skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase gratifies them means they are satisfied by them.

original: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs zhes bya ba ni rnam pa du ma'o //
translated: The phrase various topics means many kinds of topics.

original: byas te zhes bya ba ni phan tshun byas te'o //
analyzed: byas te zhes bya ba ni phan tshun byas te'o //
translated: The phrase having done so means having engaged in this activity with each other.

original: kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang rigs pas rigs pa ma yin pa de bdag mi 'dod de 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid la sogs pa ni rigs pas rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gang rigs pas rigs pa ma yin pa de bdag mi 'dod de 'jig rten pha rol yod pa nyid la sogs pa ni rigs pas rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: “O Gautama, I cannot accept all of that” and so on.

original: mngon sum gyi yul ni dngos po mdun na 'dug pa yin la /
analyzed: mngon sum gyi yul ni dngos po mdun na 'dug pa yin la /
translated: The object of direct perception is a thing that is present in front of one.

original: 'jig rten pha rol ni dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol ni dbang po'i yul ma yin te /
translated: The world beyond is not an object of the sense faculties.

original: dbang po'i yul ma yin pa la ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma ldog go //
analyzed: dbang po'i yul ma yin pa la ni mngon sum gyi tshad ma ldog go //
translated: Direct perception is not a valid cognition with regard to objects that are not objects of the sense faculties.

original: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pas ;
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa'i yul ni spyi'i mtshan nyid yin pas ;
translated: The object of inference is a universal characteristic.

original: yul gyi dngos po med pas tshad mar mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: yul gyi dngos po med pas tshad mar mi rung ba ste /
translated: Since the object does not exist, it is not a valid cognition.

original: de ltar yang mngon sum du ma yin pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyir bdag ni de mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar yang mngon sum du ma yin pa ni tshad ma yin no zhes zer ba de'i phyir bdag ni de mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, it is said, “That which is not direct perception is not a valid cognition.” Therefore, the meaning of “I do not accept that” is that he does not accept that.

original: de ltar kun du rgyu sen rings ni chad par lta ba yin pas de mngal na gnas pa ni skye ba dang po yin la /
analyzed: de ltar kun du rgyu sen rings ni chad par lta ba yin pas de mngal na gnas pa ni skye ba dang po yin la /
translated: Thus, since the wandering mendicant Dīrghanakha is a nihilist, his first birth was in the womb.

original: 'chi ba ni skye ba'i tha ma yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ba ni skye ba'i tha ma yin te /
translated: Death is the end of birth,🔽because they view the annihilation of sentient beings after death.🔽The noble Shariputra, having gone forth, became unhappy and gave rise to the following thought:

original: sems can shi ba'i 'og tu chad par 'gyur bar lta ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung bas yid mi bde bar gyur nas de la 'di lta bu'i sems skyes te shes pa mthar thug pa dag ni med pas re zhig ring du song ba'i blo can dag kyang /
analyzed: sems can shi ba'i 'og tu chad par 'gyur bar lta ba'i phyir dang / 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung bas yid mi bde bar gyur nas de la 'di lta bu'i sems skyes te shes pa mthar thug pa dag ni med pas re zhig ring du song ba'i blo can dag kyang /
translated: “Since there is no final limit to knowledge, even those with far-reaching minds

original: bstan @224b bcos las phyir log pas na sh'a ri'i bu bas dge sbyong goo ta ma ches mkhas la /
analyzed: bstan @224b bcos las phyir log pas na sh'a ri'i bu bas dge sbyong goo ta ma ches mkhas la /
translated: have turned away from the treatises. Therefore, the ascetic Gautama is more learned than Shariputra.

original: de bas kyang gzhan zhig ches mkhas shing de bas kyang gzhan zhig ches mkhas gor ma chag go //
analyzed: de bas kyang gzhan zhig ches mkhas shing de bas kyang gzhan zhig ches mkhas gor ma chag go //
translated: There must be someone else even more learned than him, and someone else even more learned than that one.

original: sh'a ri'i bu'i shes pa ni dge sbyong goo ta ma'i shes pas zil gyis non la /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu'i shes pa ni dge sbyong goo ta ma'i shes pas zil gyis non la /
translated: Shariputra’s knowledge is surpassed by the ascetic Gautama’s knowledge,

original: de'i shes pa yang gzhan zhig gis zil gyis non par 'gyur zhing de'i yang gzhan gyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur bas de'i phyir shes pa mthar thug pa dag med do //
analyzed: de'i shes pa yang gzhan zhig gis zil gyis non par 'gyur zhing de'i yang gzhan gyis zil gyis gnon par 'gyur bas de'i phyir shes pa mthar thug pa dag med do //
translated: and that knowledge is surpassed by someone else’s, and that one’s by someone else’s. Therefore, there is no final limit to knowledge.”

original: phul du phyin pa'i khyad par can med do /
analyzed: phul du phyin pa'i khyad par can med do /
translated: There is no distinction of being superior or inferior.

original: snyam nas / kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes zer ro //
analyzed: snyam nas / kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes zer ro //
translated: O Gautama, I do not accept anything.

original: de de skad zer ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis mer 'jug gi bu yod kyi bdag cag thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba bka' stsal te /
analyzed: de de skad zer ba la bcom ldan 'das kyis mer 'jug gi bu yod kyi bdag cag thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba bka' stsal te /
translated: The Bhagavån replied to him, “O Vatsagotra, we do not accept anything, and we do not accept even the view that one should not accept anything.”

original: bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes khyab pa'i tshig gis thams cad bkag pas chad par lta ba nyid kyang bkag par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes khyab pa'i tshig gis thams cad bkag pas chad par lta ba nyid kyang bkag par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the statement “I do not accept anything” negates everything by a universal statement, it also negates the view that one should not accept anything.

original: de nas sen rings kyis dam bcas pa nyams kyis dogs pas kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba gsol to //
analyzed: de nas sen rings kyis dam bcas pa nyams kyis dogs pas kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba gsol to //
translated: Then Vatsagotra, fearing that his thesis would be violated, said, “O Gautama, I do not accept even the view that one should not accept anything.”

original: 'di ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba chad par lta bas bsdus pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni mthar 'dzin pa'i lta ba chad par lta bas bsdus pa yin te /
translated: This is the view that grasps an extreme, included in the view of annihilation.

original: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be abandoned by seeing the truth of suffering.

original: 'di'i kun nas slong ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan thob pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung bas yid mi byed pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di'i kun nas slong ba ni 'jig rten rgyang pan thob pa'i phyir dang / 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu rab tu byung bas yid mi byed pa'i phyir /
translated: Its motivation is the desire to obtain the title of a great teacher, and the desire to make the noble Shariputra lose his faith in the Buddha.

original: kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ste /
analyzed: kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes de ltar lta zhing de skad smra ste /
translated: He says, O Gautama, I do not accept any of it, and he holds and proclaims this view.

original: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ni re zhig spyi'i don yin no //
translated: This is the general meaning of the passage.

original: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni yan lag gi don bshad par bya ste /
translated: Now we will explain the specific meaning.

original: kye zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: kye zhes bya ba ni bod pa'i tshig go //
translated: O is a vocative particle.

original: thams cad ces bya ba ni rtag par smra ba'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba ni rtag par smra ba'i bdag nyid la sogs pa'o //
translated: All refers to the self that is said to be permanent.

original: mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: I do not accept means I do not desire.

original: mer 'jug gi bu zhes bya ba ni mer 'jug gi ris las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mer 'jug gi bu zhes bya ba ni mer 'jug gi ris las skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The son of Mahakashyapa means that he was born in the family of Mahakashyapa.

original: thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni thams cad mi bzod pa'i khongs su chad par lta ba de yang 'dus pas khyed kyis chad par lta ba'i lta ba da yang mi bzod par rigs so
analyzed: thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes bya ba ni thams cad mi bzod pa'i khongs su chad par lta ba de yang 'dus pas khyed kyis chad par lta ba'i lta ba da yang mi bzod par rigs so
translated: Since the view of annihilation is included in the view that all views are not to be endured, it is reasonable that you also do not endure the view of annihilation.

original: zhes bka' stsal pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bka' stsal pa yin no //
translated: This is what the Buddha said.🔽Then Pūraṇa, fearing that his promise would be violated, said,

original: de nas sen rings dam bcas pa nyams kyis dogs pas bdag ni thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes @225a * //🔽khas blangs so //
analyzed: de nas sen rings dam bcas pa nyams kyis dogs pas bdag ni thams cad mi bzod par lta ba gang yin pa'i lta ba'i lta ba de yang mi bzod do zhes @225a * // khas blangs so //
translated: I do not endure the view that all views are not to be endured.

original: 'o na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs na'o //
analyzed: 'o na zhes bya ba ni khas blangs na'o //
translated: If you say,

original: sen rings kyis de ltar khas blangs nas /
analyzed: sen rings kyis de ltar khas blangs nas /
translated: Pūraṇa having thus promised,

original: de'i phan yon gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phan yon gang zhe na /
translated: what is the benefit of that?

original: sen rings chad par lta ba yin pas gang gi tshe des thams cad mi bzod pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: sen rings chad par lta ba yin pas gang gi tshe des thams cad mi bzod pa de'i tshe na /
translated: Since Pūraṇa is a nihilist, when he says that he does not endure all views,

original: des lta ba thams cad yongs su gtang ba de nyid de'i phan yon chen po yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: des lta ba thams cad yongs su gtang ba de nyid de'i phan yon chen po yin no zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: that very abandonment of all views is his great benefit.

original: de ltar shes shing zhes bya ba ni lta ba thams cad mi rigs pa nyid yin pas snga phyi 'gal bar shes shing ngo //
analyzed: de ltar shes shing zhes bya ba ni lta ba thams cad mi rigs pa nyid yin pas snga phyi 'gal bar shes shing ngo //
translated: Thus, knowing means knowing that the former and latter are contradictory because all views are unreasonable.

original: de ltar mthong na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i sgo nas de ltar mthong na'o //
analyzed: de ltar mthong na zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i sgo nas de ltar mthong na'o //
translated: If one sees thus means if one sees in this way by means of reasoning.

original: lta ba de yang zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba de yang ngo //
analyzed: lta ba de yang zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba de yang ngo //
translated: That view also means that view of annihilation.

original: lta ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab ste /
analyzed: lta ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i nyon mongs pa can gyi shes rab ste /
translated: View is an afflicted understanding concomitant with mental consciousness.

original: kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is of the nature of imagination.

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnon pa'i sgo nas so //
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnon pa'i sgo nas so //
translated: Abandonment is by way of subduing.

original: 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'thob pa chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dor ba zhes bya ba ni de'i 'thob pa chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Rejection is because the obtainment of that is severed.

original: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med par 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Non-existence is because it does not occur again.

original: lta ba gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba las gzhan pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i lta ba gzhan dag go //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba las gzhan pa de'i rgyu las byung ba'i lta ba gzhan dag go //
translated: Other views are other views that arise from the cause of that view of annihilation.

original: mtshams mi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //🔽nye bar mi len pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshams mi sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro // nye bar mi len pa zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not connecting” means not becoming manifest.🔽“Not appropriating” means not being related.

original: mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Not arising” means not being continuous.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gal te khyod kyis lta ba thams cad mi rigs par shes na de'i tshe lta ba thams cad las log par 'gyur pas de nyid phan yon no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gal te khyod kyis lta ba thams cad mi rigs par shes na de'i tshe lta ba thams cad las log par 'gyur pas de nyid phan yon no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If you know that all views are unreasonable, then at that time you will turn away from all views. Therefore, that itself is the benefit. This is the meaning.

original: sen rings kyi phan yon legs par mnyan pas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzlas pa'i phyir kye goo ta ma bdag gis de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
analyzed: sen rings kyi phan yon legs par mnyan pas bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' bzlas pa'i phyir kye goo ta ma bdag gis de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsol te /
translated: In order to repeat the Blessed One’s words, since the benefits of the long fingernail were well heard, he said, “O Gautama, if I know thus, if I see thus,” and so on.

original: de de bzhin te bdag gis de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de de bzhin te bdag gis de ltar shes shing de ltar mthong na lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “That is so. If I know thus, if I see thus, then I turn away from all aspects of views.” This is the meaning.

original: gal te sen rings 'di snyam du lta ba thams cad dang bral bar gyur na de'i tshe bdag gi chad par smra ba dang / bye brag 'ga' yang med do snyam du dogs pa de'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu khyod ni skye bo phal po che dang lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te sen rings 'di snyam du lta ba thams cad dang bral bar gyur na de'i tshe bdag gi chad par smra ba dang / bye brag 'ga' yang med do snyam du dogs pa de'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu khyod ni skye bo phal po che dang lhan cig ces bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If the long-nailed one thinks that if he were free from all views, then he would not be different from the nihilist, then in order to dispel that doubt, the Buddha said, “You, son of Vṛji, together with the multitude…”

original: khyod ni skye bo phal po che lta ba mi bzad pa dag dang lhan cig lta ba @225b mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: khyod ni skye bo phal po che lta ba mi bzad pa dag dang lhan cig lta ba @225b mtshungs par 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: You will be similar to the multitude who have an unbearable view.

original: mtshungs shing zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshungs shing zhes bya ba ni brgyud pas gzhan du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Similar” means that they go elsewhere by way of the continuum.

original: 'dra bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dngos po gcig pa'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'dra bar 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni dngos po gcig pa'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “You will be like them” means that you will be like them in the manner of having the same thing.

original: skye bo phal po che yang de ltar lta zhing de skad smras bas khyod kyang de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rdzogs byed pa mang po gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa dag ni rnam pa de lta bu dag gis lta ba'i
analyzed: skye bo phal po che yang de ltar lta zhing de skad smras bas khyod kyang de dang 'dra ba kho nar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni rdzogs byed pa mang po gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa dag ni rnam pa de lta bu dag gis lta ba'i
translated: Those who are confused by the many who are completely bound by delusion see it that way.

original: chu bo dang ldan pa yin gyi khyod ni shes rab can yin pas gal te de 'dra ba kho nar gyur na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chu bo dang ldan pa yin gyi khyod ni shes rab can yin pas gal te de 'dra ba kho nar gyur na mi rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: But you are wise, so if you were to be just like them, it would be inappropriate. This is the meaning.

original: 'di yang lta ba ngan par yongs su spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di yang lta ba ngan par yongs su spangs pa'i phan yon bstan pa'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu 'jig rten na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: This also is stated to show the benefit of completely abandoning bad views: The son of Meru, in the world...

original: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni 'di las phyi rol ba'i rab tu byung ba'o //
analyzed: dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni 'di las phyi rol ba'i rab tu byung ba'o //
translated: Ascetic refers to those who have gone forth outside of this [Buddhist] tradition.

original: lta ba 'di yang zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba 'di yang zhes bya ba ni chad par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: This view refers to the view of annihilation and so on.

original: 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ni yongs su spong zhing ngo //
analyzed: 'dor zhing zhes bya ba ni yongs su spong zhing ngo //
translated: Abandon means completely reject.

original: lta ba gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni log par lta ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Other views” refers to wrong views and so on.

original: nye bar mi len pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar mi len pa'i zhes bya ba ni mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: “Not grasping” means not holding.

original: nyung pa bas kyang ches nyung ba ste srab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyung pa bas kyang ches nyung ba ste srab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Even less” means even less than a few, which is to say, “very few.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is the point.

original: sa gzhi la brten pa'i rdul ji snyed kyi sems can ni blo ma byang ba yin la sen mo'i rtse la brten pa'i rdul ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sems can ni blo byang ba yin pas de'i phyir khyod kyis kyang skye bo ya rabs ches nyung ba'i
analyzed: sa gzhi la brten pa'i rdul ji snyed kyi sems can ni blo ma byang ba yin la sen mo'i rtse la brten pa'i rdul ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sems can ni blo byang ba yin pas de'i phyir khyod kyis kyang skye bo ya rabs ches nyung ba'i
translated: The sentient beings who are based on the dust particles on the surface of the earth are those whose minds are untrained. The sentient beings who are based on the dust particles on the tip of a fingernail are those whose minds are trained. Therefore, you should also enter into the ranks of the most upright people.

original: nang du bdag nyid 'jug par bya zhing lta ba'i rnam pa gtang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang du bdag nyid 'jug par bya zhing lta ba'i rnam pa gtang bar gyis shig ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the statement, “Give up the various views.”

original: de nas sen rings lan rigs pa thos pa'i phyir dang / rigs pa brjod pa'i phyir dan /
analyzed: de nas sen rings lan rigs pa thos pa'i phyir dang / rigs pa brjod pa'i phyir dan /
translated: Then, because he had heard the correct response, and because he had spoken correctly,

original: tshig 'jam po bka' stsal ba'i phyir sems gtod pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis lta ba rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / nyes dmigs dang phan yon bstan pa'i rim gyis mdo sde bstan bstsal ba'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽lta ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni lta ba rnams skye ba'i gnas te /
analyzed: tshig 'jam po bka' stsal ba'i phyir sems gtod pa la bcom ldan 'das kyis lta ba rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / nyes dmigs dang phan yon bstan pa'i rim gyis mdo sde bstan bstsal ba'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so // lta ba'i gnas zhes bya ba ni lta ba rnams skye ba'i gnas te /
translated: Because he spoke with gentle words, the Bhagavān taught the sūtra in stages, beginning with the nature of the views, their faults, and their benefits.🔽The phrase “the bases of views” means the bases for the arising of views.

original: 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byung gnas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means the source of views.

original: gsum gang zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gsum gang zhes bya ba ni dri ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The phrase “what are the three?” means “what are the three?”

original: dri ba 'di yang kha cig tu bcom ldan 'das kyis skye bo mi 'jigs pa ma thob par mkhyen pa nas nyid kyis mdzad pa'i 'am /
analyzed: dri ba 'di yang kha cig tu bcom ldan 'das kyis skye bo mi 'jigs pa ma thob par mkhyen pa nas nyid kyis mdzad pa'i 'am /
translated: This question is asked by the Bhagavān in some places, because he knows that the audience has not yet attained fearlessness.

original: yang na nyan pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pas rang gi @226a * //
analyzed: yang na nyan pa'i mi 'jigs pa dang ldan pas rang gi @226a * //
translated: Or, it is asked by someone who has attained fearlessness in listening, in order to show his own

original: byas pa shes par bya'o //
analyzed: byas pa shes par bya'o //
translated: knowledge.

original: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lta ba yongs su brjod pa la'o //
analyzed: 'di la zhes bya ba ni lta ba yongs su brjod pa la'o //
translated: The phrase “in this regard” means “in regard to the description of views.”

original: la la zhes bya ba ni 'ga' ste thams cad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: la la zhes bya ba ni 'ga' ste thams cad ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Some” means some, not all.

original: thams cad bzod do zhes bya bas ni rtag par lta ba bstan to //
analyzed: thams cad bzod do zhes bya bas ni rtag par lta ba bstan to //
translated: “All are accepted” indicates the view of eternalism.

original: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang ngam /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes bya ba ni rnam grangs gzhan yang ngam /
translated: “Moreover” means another way of explaining,

original: dngos po brjod pa'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dngos po brjod pa'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: or it is a remainder of the words expressing the topic.

original: thams cad mi bzod do zhes bya bas ni chad par lta ba bstan pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad mi bzod do zhes bya bas ni chad par lta ba bstan pa'o //
translated: “All are not accepted” indicates the view of annihilationism.

original: kha cig ni bzod la kha cig ni mi bzod do zhes bya bas ni rtag par lta ba dang / chad par lta ba gnyis ka bstan to //🔽'o na gang zag de nyid rtag par yang lta /
analyzed: kha cig ni bzod la kha cig ni mi bzod do zhes bya bas ni rtag par lta ba dang / chad par lta ba gnyis ka bstan to // 'o na gang zag de nyid rtag par yang lta /
translated: “Some are accepted and some are not accepted” indicates both the view of eternalism and the view of annihilationism.

original: chad par yang lta bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: chad par yang lta bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can that very person have the view of eternalism and the view of annihilationism?

original: 'di lta gang zag la gzugs rtag par 'dzin pa de'i tshe na /
analyzed: 'di lta gang zag la gzugs rtag par 'dzin pa de'i tshe na /
translated: When one grasps the person as permanent,

original: phung po bzhi chad par 'dzin to //
analyzed: phung po bzhi chad par 'dzin to //
translated: at that time one grasps the four aggregates as annihilated.

original: yang na gzugs chad par 'dzin pa de'i tshe phung po bzhi rtag par 'dzin pas 'gal ba med do zhes bye brag pa'i gzhung las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: yang na gzugs chad par 'dzin pa de'i tshe phung po bzhi rtag par 'dzin pas 'gal ba med do zhes bye brag pa'i gzhung las 'byung ngo //
translated: Or, when form is apprehended as annihilated, there is no contradiction, since the four aggregates are apprehended as permanent.🔽This is stated in the Vaisesika scriptures.

original: mer 'jug gi bu de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: mer 'jug gi bu de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: The son of Matrceta says:

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bsal ba ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bsal ba ste /
translated: The word “there” is an exception.

original: dmigs kyis bsal ba zhes bya ba ni rigs dang / yon tan dang bya ba dag gi spyi las phyogs gcig tha dad par dgar ba'o //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal ba zhes bya ba ni rigs dang / yon tan dang bya ba dag gi spyi las phyogs gcig tha dad par dgar ba'o //
translated: An exception is the exclusion of one part from a universal of a type, quality, or action.

original: de yang re re la rnam pa gsum gsum ste /
analyzed: de yang re re la rnam pa gsum gsum ste /
translated: And each of these has three aspects:

original: gang las dang / gang gis dang / ji'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang las dang / gang gis dang / ji'i phyir ro //
translated: from what, by what, and why.

original: de la gang las dmigs kyis bsal zhe na /
analyzed: de la gang las dmigs kyis bsal zhe na /
translated: From what is there an exception?

original: lta ba gsum gyi spyi las so //
analyzed: lta ba gsum gyi spyi las so //
translated: From the universal of the three views.

original: gang gis dmigs kyis bsal zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis dmigs kyis bsal zhe na /
translated: By what is there an exception?

original: rtag pa nyid kyis rigs so //
analyzed: rtag pa nyid kyis rigs so //
