translated: By the type of permanence.

original: ci'i phyir dmigs kyis bsal la zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dmigs kyis bsal la zhe na /
translated: Why is there an exception?

original: ma grags pa'i chos shes par bya ba'i phyir te rnam pa gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
analyzed: ma grags pa'i chos shes par bya ba'i phyir te rnam pa gzhan dag la yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o ;
translated: in order to know the Dharma that is not well known. The rest should be understood in the same way.

original: ; lta ba gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rtag par lta ba'o //
analyzed: ; lta ba gang yin pa 'di ni zhes bya ba ni rtag par lta ba'o //
translated: “This view” refers to the view of eternalism.

original: kun 'dod chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rgyun to //
analyzed: kun 'dod chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi rgyun to //
translated: “Attachment” refers to the continuum of attachment.

original: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyur zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i dngos por 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Would become” means would become the cause.

original: kun du zhe sdang ba dang / kun du gti mug pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du zhe sdang ba dang / kun du gti mug pa yang de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: Aversion and delusion should be understood in the same way.

original: gal te rang gi la kun du zhe sdang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rang gi la kun du zhe sdang bar ji ltar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If one is attached to one’s own view, how can one have aversion to the views of others?

original: de ltar mi 'gyur te /🔽'di ltar gzhan gyi lta ba la zhes sdang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'gyur te / 'di ltar gzhan gyi lta ba la zhes sdang bar 'gyur te /
translated: It is not like that.🔽It is said that one has aversion to the views of others.

original: 'di ltar rang gi lta ba la lhag par chags par 'gyur na de'i dgra bor gyur pa gzhan gyi lta ba la kun du zhes sdang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar rang gi lta ba la lhag par chags par 'gyur na de'i dgra bor gyur pa gzhan gyi lta ba la kun du zhes sdang bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If one is attached to one’s own view, one has aversion to the views of others, which are the enemies of one’s own view.

original: kun du sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar @226b byed pa'i las rnams brtas pa'o //🔽kun du sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar byed pa'i las rnams ldog pa'o //
analyzed: kun du sogs pa zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar @226b byed pa'i las rnams brtas pa'o // kun du sogs pa med pa zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar byed pa'i las rnams ldog pa'o //
translated: “Accumulation” means the increase of the actions that produce rebirth.🔽“Non-accumulation” means the cessation of the actions that produce rebirth.

original: kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar byed pa'i phung po 'phangs pa rnams dang lhan cig kun du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar byed pa'i phung po 'phangs pa rnams dang lhan cig kun du sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Bondage” means the connection with the aggregates projected by the actions that produce rebirth.

original: kun sbyor ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de dag dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: kun sbyor ba dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de dag dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Liberation from bondage” means being free from that.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyun to //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni skye ba la sogs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i sdug bsngal gyi rgyun to //
translated: “Affliction” means the continuum of suffering that arises from the causes of birth, etc.

original: rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las log pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las log pa'o //
translated: “Purification” means turning away from suffering.

original: mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par dga' ba zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs par 'dod pa'o //
translated: “Delight” means desiring the future.

original: nye bar len pa zhes ba ba ni de'i thob pa yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
analyzed: nye bar len pa zhes ba ba ni de'i thob pa yongs su tshol ba las byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'o //
translated: “Grasping” means the affliction that arises from the search for the obtainment of that.

original: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa las lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni thob pa las lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: Attachment to what has been obtained is called “excessive attachment.”

original: de dag las bzlog pa yang /
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pa yang /
translated: The opposite of those is

original: de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du shes par bya'o //
translated: known in the same way.

original: 'on lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyang kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yin na ci'i phyir rtag par lta ba na 'ba' zhig kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'on lta ba'i rnam pa thams cad kyang kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par 'gyur ba yin na ci'i phyir rtag par lta ba na 'ba' zhig kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par 'gyur la /
translated: If all aspects of view are attachment and so on, why is it said that only the view of permanence is attachment and so on,

original: chad par lta ba ni kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par mi 'gyur bar bstan ce na /
analyzed: chad par lta ba ni kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par mi 'gyur bar bstan ce na /
translated: and the view of annihilation is not attachment and so on?

original: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba dag gis lan btab pa de ni dgongs te gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di la bye brag tu smra ba dag gis lan btab pa de ni dgongs te gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Vaibhasikas respond: This is stated from the perspective of the majority.

original: mu stegs can rtag par lta ba la yang 'byung ba yod pas de ni yang 'byung ba 'phen pa'i sems brtas par byed do //
analyzed: mu stegs can rtag par lta ba la yang 'byung ba yod pas de ni yang 'byung ba 'phen pa'i sems brtas par byed do //
translated: Since the tirthikas who view things as permanent also have views of annihilation, their minds are reinforced by the projection of further existence.

original: mu stegs can chad par lta ba la ni yang 'byung ba med pas mngal na gnas pa ni de'i skye bo tha ma yin pas de ni yang 'byung ba 'phen pa'i sems brtas par mi byed do //
analyzed: mu stegs can chad par lta ba la ni yang 'byung ba med pas mngal na gnas pa ni de'i skye bo tha ma yin pas de ni yang 'byung ba 'phen pa'i sems brtas par mi byed do //
translated: For the tīrthikas who have the view of annihilation, since there is no rebirth, the being in the womb is their last birth, so the mind that propels rebirth does not develop.

original: de'i phyir de las dgongs nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir de las dgongs nas /
translated: Therefore, with that in mind,

original: rtag par lta ba ni kun du 'dod chags par 'gyur la chad par lta ba ni kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par mi 'gyur bar bstan to //
analyzed: rtag par lta ba ni kun du 'dod chags par 'gyur la chad par lta ba ni kun du 'dod chags pa la sogs par mi 'gyur bar bstan to //
translated: it is taught that the view of permanence leads to attachment, while the view of annihilation does not lead to attachment and so on.

original: de lta bas na mu stegs can rtag par lta ba ni 'jig rten pha rol 'dod pa sngon du btang bas de la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na mu stegs can rtag par lta ba ni 'jig rten pha rol 'dod pa sngon du btang bas de la nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung ngo //
translated: Thus, for tīrthikas who have the view of permanence, since they assert a next world, all afflictions and branch afflictions arise for them.

original: mu stegs can chad par lta ba ni 'jig rten pha rol mi 'dod pas de la ni nyon mongs pa dag mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mu stegs can chad par lta ba ni 'jig rten pha rol mi 'dod pas de la ni nyon mongs pa dag mi 'byung ngo //
translated: For tīrthikas who have the view of annihilation, since they do not assert a next world, afflictions do not arise for them.

original: de ltar na 'dis lta ba rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon bstan pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis lta ba rnams kyi ngo bo nyid dang / nyes dmigs dang / phan yon bstan pa yin no /
translated: Thus this teaches the nature of the views, their disadvantages, and their benefits.

original: // / bam po lnga pa /🔽gal te sen rings 'di snyam du rtag par lta ba sngon du btang ba las /
analyzed: // / bam po lnga pa / gal te sen rings 'di snyam du rtag par lta ba sngon du btang ba las /
translated: 🔽If the long-nailed one thinks, “Having made the view of permanence prior,🔽

original: @227a * // nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung bas chad par lta ba nyid bzang ste /
analyzed: @227a * // nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa thams cad 'byung bas chad par lta ba nyid bzang ste /
translated: If the Elder thought, “Since all the afflictions and secondary afflictions arise from the prior view of the transitory collection, the view of annihilation is better,

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in accord with nirvana,”

original: de'i phyir phyi rol pa'i lta ba rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste /🔽bdag med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir phyi rol pa'i lta ba rnams kyi nang na 'di lta ste / bdag med do //
translated: then for that reason he said, “Among the views of the non-Buddhists, the best is this one,🔽namely, ‘There is no self,🔽there is no mine,

original: bdag gi med do //
analyzed: bdag gi med do //
translated: the self does not exist,

original: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: the self does not arise.’ ”

original: bdag gi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni mchog yin no zhes bstan to snyam du dgongs pa de'i phyir de la 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: bdag gi 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di ni mchog yin no zhes bstan to snyam du dgongs pa de'i phyir de la 'phags pa'i nyan thos thos pa dang ldan pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, the Elder said, “The noble disciple who has heard much...,” and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni dmigs kyis bsal ba yin no //
translated: Here, “this” refers to the view of annihilation.

original: 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas dang / sangs rgyas kyi nyan thos sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The noble ones are the Buddhas and the disciples of the Buddhas, who have gone far from sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas.

original: de rnams kyi nyan thos zhes bya ba ni gus par nyan pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyi nyan thos zhes bya ba ni gus par nyan pa ste /
translated: Their disciples are those who listen respectfully.

original: slob ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: slob ma zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by students.

original: 'di ltar so sor rtog par byed de zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba ltar rtog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar so sor rtog par byed de zhes bya ba ni 'og nas 'byung ba ltar rtog par byed pa'o //
translated: It is as follows: One should investigate as will be explained below.

original: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'i bsam pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'i bsam pas gnas pa'o //
translated: A dispute is a state of mind that is harmful.

original: 'gyod ces bya ba ni rtsub po smra zhing lan 'debs pa'i bdag nyid de 'thab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'gyod ces bya ba ni rtsub po smra zhing lan 'debs pa'i bdag nyid de 'thab ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: A quarrel is a state of mind that is harsh, abusive, and argumentative. This is what is meant by fight.

original: rnam par 'tshe zhes bya ba ni khu tshur dang / thal lcag la sogs pas bsnun pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par 'tshe zhes bya ba ni khu tshur dang / thal lcag la sogs pas bsnun pa'o //
translated: A brawl is a state of mind that is violent, and involves striking with the hand, a clod of earth, a stick, or a knife.

original: bdag la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i nyan thos la'o //
analyzed: bdag la zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i nyan thos la'o //
translated: The self is the noble disciple.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni mngon par zhe pa dam pos bskyed pa'i lta ba rnam pa thams cad ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i gnod pa skyed par byed pa yin pas rnam pa thams cad du thag pa srid zhing spang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni mngon par zhe pa dam pos bskyed pa'i lta ba rnam pa thams cad ni tshe 'di dang tshe phyi ma'i gnod pa skyed par byed pa yin pas rnam pa thams cad du thag pa srid zhing spang bar bya'o zhes bstan to //
translated: Thus, it is taught that all views generated by intense desire cause harm in this life and in future lives, and so they should be completely rejected and avoided.

original: 'khor ba na rtsod pa'i gzhi ni gnyis te /
analyzed: 'khor ba na rtsod pa'i gzhi ni gnyis te /
translated: In cyclic existence, there are two bases of dispute:

original: lta ba la lhag par chags pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'o //
analyzed: lta ba la lhag par chags pa dang / 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'o //
translated: attachment to views and attachment to desire.

original: de gnyis las lta ba la lhag par chags pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir de la chos bstan nas /
analyzed: de gnyis las lta ba la lhag par chags pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir de la chos bstan nas /
translated: In order to completely abandon attachment to views, the Buddha taught the Dharma to those who were attached to views.

original: de ni 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir de la chos bstan pa brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa yongs su spang ba'i phyir de la chos bstan pa brtsam par bya ste /
translated: In order to completely abandon attachment to desire, he began to teach the Dharma to those who were attached to desire.

original: de'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu 'di ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Therefore, he said, “Kāśyapa, this is the root of cyclic existence,” and so on.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa ni tshor ba'i dbang gis 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa ni tshor ba'i dbang gis 'byung ste /
translated: Attachment to desire arises due to the power of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i ro myang ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa dag la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ro myang ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa dag la mngon par chags par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One becomes attached to sense objects because of the relish for feeling.

original: tshor ba'i ro myang ba yang @227b dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyis 'grub pas de'i phyir lus la lhag par chags pa de bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa'i rim pa 'di brtsams so //
analyzed: tshor ba'i ro myang ba yang @227b dbang po dang bcas pa'i lus kyis 'grub pas de'i phyir lus la lhag par chags pa de bzlog pa'i phyir bshad pa'i rim pa 'di brtsams so //
translated: Since the relish for feeling is accomplished by the body together with the sense faculties, therefore, in order to stop attachment to the body, this exposition is undertaken in this order.

original: lus zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i tshogs 'jig pa'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: lus zhes bya ba ni 'byung ba dang 'byung ba las gyur ba'i tshogs 'jig pa'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The body is a collection of the elements and the derivatives of the elements, which is subject to destruction.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir gzugs te /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni gnod par byar rung ba'i phyir gzugs te /
translated: Form is that which can be injured.

original: 'di la gzugs te yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la gzugs te yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is form because it exists as form.

original: rags pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs dgag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rags pa zhes bya ba smos pa ni bar ma do'i srid pa'i gzugs dgag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word “gross” is mentioned in order to exclude the form of the intermediate existence.

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes bya bas ni dbang phyug la sogs pas ma bskyed par bstan to //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi las gyur pa zhes bya bas ni dbang phyug la sogs pas ma bskyed par bstan to //
translated: The phrase “arisen from the four great elements” shows that it is not produced by Īśvara, etc.

original: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
analyzed: yang dang yang du zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du'o //
translated: Again and again means at all times.

original: 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang 'jig par rjes su lta zhing gnas par bya'o zhes bya ba la 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bskyed pa'o //
translated: Origination is production.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni 'gag pa'o //
translated: Destruction is cessation.

original: de gnyis su rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni brtag ching ngo //
analyzed: de gnyis su rjes su lta zhing zhes bya ba ni brtag ching ngo //
translated: Contemplation of those two is investigation.

original: yang na lus 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du bstan pa la skad cig la 'byung zhing 'jig par brtag par bya ba ste /
analyzed: yang na lus 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid du bstan pa la skad cig la 'byung zhing 'jig par brtag par bya ba ste /
translated: Or else, the body is taught to have the characteristics of the compounded, and one should investigate its origination and destruction in each moment.

original: ji skad du dge slong khyod ni skad cig la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / nyams pa dang / 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong khyod ni skad cig la skye ba dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba dang / nyams pa dang / 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: As it is said, “Bhikṣus, you are subject to origination, aging, death, loss, and appearance in each moment.”

original: de la lus la 'dun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yul tha dad par grags pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: de la lus la 'dun pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni yul tha dad par grags pa'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: Here, “longing for the body” and so on are synonyms for different objects.

original: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das chos ston pa mdzad pa ni gdul ba gang dag sems g-yengs pas don de ma go ba de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyi tshig gzhan dag gis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar bcom ldan 'das chos ston pa mdzad pa ni gdul ba gang dag sems g-yengs pas don de ma go ba de dag la bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyi tshig gzhan dag gis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat teaches the Dharma in this way for the sake of those disciples whose minds are distracted and who do not understand that meaning. The Bhagavat teaches that meaning with other words.🔽Or else, the Bhagavat teaches that very meaning with other collections of names, collections of words, and collections of letters for the sake of those disciples who are not vessels for the meaning taught with those collections of names, words, and letters.🔽Or else, the Bhagavat teaches that very meaning with other collections of names, words, and letters for the sake of those disciples who are vessels for the meaning taught with those collections of names, words, and letters.

original: yang na de bstan pa'i snod du gyur pa phyis lhags pa ma thos pa rnams kyis thos par bya ba'i phyir te /🔽ji skad du bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las btsun pa blos mi 'bebs kyis bstan pa las /
analyzed: yang na de bstan pa'i snod du gyur pa phyis lhags pa ma thos pa rnams kyis thos par bya ba'i phyir te /🔽ji skad du bye brag tu smra ba'i gzhung las btsun pa blos mi 'bebs kyis bstan pa las /

original: bcom ldan 'das ni gdul ba snga ma dang / 'brel ba'i bshad pa mthar phyin nas de bstan pas 'dul ba'i gdul ba gzhan dag lhags pa na don de nyid ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / @228a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni gdul ba snga ma dang / 'brel ba'i bshad pa mthar phyin nas de bstan pas 'dul ba'i gdul ba gzhan dag lhags pa na don de nyid ming gi tshogs dang / tshig gi tshogs dang / @228a * //
translated: The Bhagavan completed the explanation of the former disciples'🔽connection and then taught that, and when other disciples arrived, he taught🔽the same thing using different words, phrases, and letters.🔽

original: yi ge'i tshogs gzhan dag gis ston par mdzad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yi ge'i tshogs gzhan dag gis ston par mdzad do zhes gsungs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The Bhagavat, having completed the explanation of the connection with the former disciples, teaches the same meaning to other disciples who have come to be trained by means of other collections of names, collections of words, and collections of letters.

original: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa'i skye bo blo rtul po rnam par bshad pa'i rnam pa'i tshig gcig gi don 'dzin par mi nus par 'byung bar mkhyen nas /
analyzed: yang na bcom ldan 'das kyi ltar nyan pa'i skye bo blo rtul po rnam par bshad pa'i rnam pa'i tshig gcig gi don 'dzin par mi nus par 'byung bar mkhyen nas /
translated: Or, the Bhagavat, knowing that the people who listen to him have dull faculties and are unable to grasp the meaning of a single word of the explanation,

original: de'i phyir rnam grangs kyi tshig mang bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam grangs kyi tshig mang bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: teaches with many synonymous words.

original: yang na lus la 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin te /
analyzed: yang na lus la 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin te /
translated: Or, the word “inclination” is a word of explanation,

original: gong nas gong du rnam par bshad par gyur pa dag yin no //
analyzed: gong nas gong du rnam par bshad par gyur pa dag yin no //
translated: and the rest are explanations of that.

original: tshul 'di ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam grangs kyis tshig gzhan dag la yang da bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshul 'di ni 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam grangs kyis tshig gzhan dag la yang da bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: This method of explanation should be applied to the other synonyms that will be mentioned below.

original: yang na de dag gi don tha dad par yang bshad par bya ste /
analyzed: yang na de dag gi don tha dad par yang bshad par bya ste /
translated: Or else, their meanings should be explained as different.

original: de la 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'dun pa zhes bya ba ni ma 'ongs pa 'dod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Among them, desire is the wish for something future.

original: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa de grub pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: chags pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa de grub pa la nyon mongs pa can gyi dga' ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: Attachment is the production of an afflicted delight in the attainment of that desired object.

original: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du 'dod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba zhes bya ba ni yang dang yang du 'dod par byed pa'o //
translated: Delight is the repeated desire for that object.

original: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan yongs su gtang pa de la lhag par chags pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhen pa zhes bya ba ni yul gzhan yongs su gtang pa de la lhag par chags pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Clinging is the production of an excessive attachment to that object, not relinquishing it even for other objects.

original: 'chums pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig kyang yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'chums pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig kyang yongs su mi gtong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Longing is the inability to relinquish it even for a moment.

original: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bzlog pa na zhes dang skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhag par chags pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyis bzlog pa na zhes dang skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Excessive attachment is the production of a strong desire when one is prevented from obtaining it by others.

original: de'i sems yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni lus la 'dun pa la sogs pa des de'i sems gtugs shing yongs su zad par byas te mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i thag tshig go //
analyzed: de'i sems yongs su gtugs te mi gnas so zhes bya ba ni lus la 'dun pa la sogs pa des de'i sems gtugs shing yongs su zad par byas te mi gnas so zhes bya ba'i thag tshig go //
translated: His mind does not rest in the extreme of that, i.e., his mind does not rest in the extreme of the body, etc.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la lhag par chags pa'i gzhi nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lus la lhag par chags pa'i gzhi nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, this shows the basis of the body's excessive attachment in the realm of desire.

original: lus la lhag par chags pa de yang tshor ba'i ro myang ba'i dbang gis 'byung bas de'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: lus la lhag par chags pa de yang tshor ba'i ro myang ba'i dbang gis 'byung bas de'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu gsum po 'di dag ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, that excessive attachment to the body arises through the power of the experience of feeling. Therefore, he says, these three sons of Mṛgāra...

original: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni myong ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: tshor ba zhes bya ba ni myong ba'i ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Feeling is the intrinsic nature of experience.

original: bde ba zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Pleasure is beneficial.

original: sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal la zhes bya ba ni gnod par byed pa'o //
translated: Pain is harmful.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnyi ga ma yin pa ste /
translated: Neither pain nor pleasure is neither of the two.

original: btang snyoms zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: btang snyoms zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is synonymous with indifference.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyi tshor ba dang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de dag bka' stsal to @228b da ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams kyi tshor ba gang
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni nyon mongs pa ma spangs kyi tshor ba dang dag yin pa de dag ni 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de dag bka' stsal to @228b da ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa rnams kyi tshor ba gang
translated: Thus, he taught that those who have not abandoned the afflictions and who have feelings and discriminations are the cause of attachment to sense objects.

original: dag yin pa de dag ji ltar 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur bar de ltar bstan pa'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dag yin pa de dag ji ltar 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyu nyid du mi 'gyur bar de ltar bstan pa'i phyir mer 'jug gi bu gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Now, in order to teach that the feelings of those who have abandoned the afflictions are not the cause of attachment to sense objects, he says, “When the son of Meru,” and so on.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba ni dgra bcom pas kyang yul gyi dbang gis myong bar byed do /
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba ni dgra bcom pas kyang yul gyi dbang gis myong bar byed do /
translated: The feeling of pleasure is experienced by arhats through the power of objects.

original: lus kyi tshor ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kyi tshor ba 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because bodily feelings arise.

original: de'i phyir dge sbyong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa gson zhing 'dug la 'tsho zhing sdod pa'i dbang po lnga pa sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyen  las byung ba dag ni ma 'gags te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge sbyong dgra bcom pa zag pa zad pa gson zhing 'dug la 'tsho zhing sdod pa'i dbang po lnga pa sngon gyi mngon par 'du byed pa'i rgyen  las byung ba dag ni ma 'gags te /
translated: Therefore, the five faculties of the arhat, the śramaṇa, who has exhausted the defilements, who lives, who abides, who exists, who remains, who is born of previous formations, are not ceased.

original: de las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal so sor myong bar byed do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i tshor ba bde ba dang / sdug bsngal so sor myong bar byed do zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the feeling that arises from that is experienced as pleasure.🔽Some think that all three feelings are experienced at the same time.

original: la la dag tshor ba gsum char dus gcig tu myong bar 'gyur ra snyam du dogs pa de'i phyir de'i tshe na de la sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gnyis 'ga' par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la la dag tshor ba gsum char dus gcig tu myong bar 'gyur ra snyam du dogs pa de'i phyir de'i tshe na de la sdug bsngal ba dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gnyis 'ga' par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To dispel that doubt, it says, “At that time, two feelings, painful and neither pleasure nor pain, would exist for him.”

original: 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sos ro ma brtags pa'i 'gog pas so //
analyzed: 'gag par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni sos ro ma brtags pa'i 'gog pas so //
translated: “Would exist” means they would exist through the cessation of not investigating the taste of pleasure.

original: dus gcig tu tshor ba rnam gsum myong bar mi rigs pas de'i phyir de'i tshe na 'phags pa nyan thos bde ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong bar byed de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dus gcig tu tshor ba rnam gsum myong bar mi rigs pas de'i phyir de'i tshe na 'phags pa nyan thos bde ba'i tshor ba 'ba' zhig myong bar byed de zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Since it is illogical that all three feelings are experienced at the same time, it says, “Therefore, at that time, the noble disciple experiences only the feeling of pleasure.”

original: sems can rnams kyis sems kyi rgyud ni re re nas byung ngo zhes bstan bcos ye shes la 'jug pa las gsungs so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis sems kyi rgyud ni re re nas byung ngo zhes bstan bcos ye shes la 'jug pa las gsungs so //
translated: The treatise Entering Pristine Awareness explains that the mindstreams of sentient beings arise individually.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Impermanent means momentary.

original: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gnyis kyis so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba zhes bya ba ni 'du byed kyi sdug bsngal dang / 'gyur ba'i sdug bsngal gnyis kyis so //
translated: Suffering means the two kinds of suffering, the suffering of conditioned states and the suffering of change.

original: 'gog pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa'i chos can zhes bya ba ni rgyu mi rtag pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having the nature of cessation means that the cause is impermanent.

original: gzhi ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni dang po kun nas slong ba'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: gzhi ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni dang po kun nas slong ba'i rgyu ste /
translated: What is the basis? It is the first cause of motivation.

original: dper na bad kan gyi dang po kun nas slong ba'i rgyu grang ba dang / snum pa dang / mngar ba dag lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bad kan gyi dang po kun nas slong ba'i rgyu grang ba dang / snum pa dang / mngar ba dag lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the first cause of motivation of phlegm is cold, oiliness, and sweetness.

original: kun 'byung ba ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi tshogs pas 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: kun 'byung ba ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni rkyen gyi tshogs pas 'dus pa ste /
translated: What is the origination? It is the collection of conditions.

original: rkyen gcig skyed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gcig skyed pa ni 'ga' yang med do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For it is said that there is no single condition.

original: rigs mthun ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i rgyu ste bde ba'i tshor ba ni reg pa bde ba las 'byung la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang reg pa sdug bsngal ba las 'byung la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang reg pa sdug bsngal ba las
analyzed: rigs mthun ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni 'dra ba'i rgyu ste bde ba'i tshor ba ni reg pa bde ba las 'byung la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang reg pa sdug bsngal ba las 'byung la sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yang reg pa sdug bsngal ba las
translated: What is a homogeneous cause?

original: 'byung / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang reg pa gnyis ka ma yin pa las 'byung ba lta @229a * //🔽bu'o // rab tu bskyed pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: 'byung / gnyis ka ma yin pa'i tshor ba yang reg pa gnyis ka ma yin pa las 'byung ba lta @229a * // bu'o // rab tu bskyed pa ni gang yin zhes bya ba ni bar chad med pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: It is a cause of similar type, for a pleasant feeling arises from a pleasant contact, a painful feeling arises from a painful contact, and a neither pleasant nor painful feeling arises from a neutral contact.🔽What is an immediately preceding cause?

original: gang las 'bras bu mngon sum du skye ba'o //
analyzed: gang las 'bras bu mngon sum du skye ba'o //
translated: It is the cause of the uninterrupted production of the effect.

original: kha cig na re rgyu thag ging ba dang / thag nye ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / du ma las 'byung ba dang go rims bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyu thag ging ba dang / thag nye ba dang / rgyun mi 'chad pa dang / du ma las 'byung ba dang go rims bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that the homogeneous cause is like a seed, the universal cause is like the earth, the concomitant cause is like a field, the sovereign cause is like rain, and the immediately preceding cause is like the seed, the sprout, the stalk, etc.

original: kha cig na re rgyu med pa nyi dang / rgyu gcig pa nyid dang / rgyu rtag pa nyid dang / rgyu 'gyur bar smra ba'i gnyen por go rims bzhin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re rgyu med pa nyi dang / rgyu gcig pa nyid dang / rgyu rtag pa nyid dang / rgyu 'gyur bar smra ba'i gnyen por go rims bzhin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say: They are, respectively, antidotes for those who advocate causelessness, a single cause, a permanent cause, and a changing cause.

original: bzhin ni reg pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bzhin ni reg pa yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The verse states: “Contact, etc.”

original: reg pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa ste /
analyzed: reg pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po dang yul dang rnam par shes pa gsum 'dus pa ste /
translated: Contact is the convergence of three factors: a faculty, an object, and a consciousness.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bstan pa yin no //🔽reg pa dang de dang de zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mthun pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni reg pa'i rkyen gyis tshor ba zhes bstan pa yin no // reg pa dang de dang de zhes bya ba ni bde ba'i tshor ba dang mthun pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba dang mthun pa dang / sdug bsngal yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, this verse teaches that feeling has contact as its condition.🔽“ Contact and that” refers to the origination of contact that is conducive to the feeling of pleasure, the feeling of pain, and the feeling that is neither pleasurable nor painful.

original: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i kun 'byung ba las zhes bya ba ni skyes pa las so //
analyzed: bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba dang mthun pa'i kun 'byung ba las zhes bya ba ni skyes pa las so //
translated: “ From birth” means from arising.

original: 'gags pa las zhes bya ba 'dis ni reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag ces bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'gags pa las zhes bya ba 'dis ni reg pa 'gags pas tshor ba 'gag ces bstan pa yin no //
translated: “ From cessation” means that this verse teaches that feeling ceases due to the cessation of contact.

original: de la 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig la 'gag pa'i phyir ro //🔽nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni srabs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la 'gag pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig la 'gag pa'i phyir ro // nye bar zhi ba zhes bya ba ni srabs par gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Cessation” is because of momentariness.🔽“Quiescence” is because of being attenuated.

original: bsal ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsal ba zhes bya ba ni rgyun chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Elimination” is because of the termination of the continuum.

original: nus pa zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nus pa zhes bya ba ni yang mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Powerlessness” is because of not being able to change.

original: ro myang ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs can gyi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ro myang ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs can gyi bde ba skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Savor” is because of generating afflicted pleasure.

original: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes dmigs zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Defilement” is because of impermanence.

original: gang mi rtag pa de ni nyes dmigs yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa de ni nyes dmigs yin no zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said, “Whatever is impermanent is a defilement.”

original: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa'i 'dod chags las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Renunciation” is because of transcending the desire for craving.

original: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽zad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi rtag pa zhes bya ba ni skad cig pa nyid yin pa'i phyir ro // zad pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun gyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Impermanence” is because of momentariness.🔽“Destruction” is because of the destruction of the continuum.

original: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig pa zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis 'jig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Disintegration” is because of the disintegration of the essence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnod pa tsam gyi phyir ro //🔽'gog pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po zag pa med pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni rnam par gnod pa tsam gyi phyir ro // 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni gnyen po zag pa med pa sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Free from passion” means that it is merely a cessation.🔽“Cessation” means that it is the attainment of the uncontaminated antidote.

original: rab tu sbang ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu sbang ba zhes bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Extinguished” means that it is the attainment of nirvana without remainder.

original: 'jig rten la cung zad kyang nye bar len par mi byed ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dngos po gang las yang snying po @229b nyid du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten la cung zad kyang nye bar len par mi byed ces bya ba ni 'khor ba'i dngos po gang las yang snying po @229b nyid du mi 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It does not take up anything in the world” means that it does not grasp anything in samsara as having an essence.

original: kha cig na re sred pa mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re sred pa mngon sum du mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that it does not manifest craving.

original: nye bar len par mi byed na zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i kun 'byung ba bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nye bar len par mi byed na zhes bya ba ni sred pa'i kun 'byung ba bzlog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It does not take up” means that it stops the origin of craving.

original: yongs su gdung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam skye ba la nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: yongs su gdung bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa'i lam skye ba la nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “It does not burn” means that the origin of the afflictions does not arise in the arya’s path.

original: rgyud la yongs su gdung ba mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rgyud la yongs su gdung ba mi skye ba'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the meaning that there is no further complete torment of the continuum.

original: bdag nyid kho nas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis so //
analyzed: bdag nyid kho nas zhes bya ba ni rang nyid kyis so //
translated: “By oneself” means by one’s own self.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byed ces bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dad bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das par byed ces bya ba ni phung po'i lhag ma dad bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: “One causes complete nirvana” means one causes the attainment of nirvana with remainder of aggregates.

original: de thob nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
analyzed: de thob nas bdag gi skye ba zad do //
translated: Having attained that, one causes the understanding: “My births are exhausted.

original: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa bsten to //
translated: I have maintained the holy life.

original: bya ba bas so //
analyzed: bya ba bas so //
translated: I have done what needed to be done.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //🔽lus kyi mtha' pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzugs can lnga la brten pa ste /🔽lus kyi mtha' ni lus kyi mthar thug pa'i dbang po lnga'o //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes go bar byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro // lus kyi mtha' pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni dbang po gzugs can lnga la brten pa ste / lus kyi mtha' ni lus kyi mthar thug pa'i dbang po lnga'o //
translated: I know of no other existences beyond this one.”🔽“Feeling at the end of the body” is based on the five physical faculties.🔽The end of the body is the five faculties that are the end of the body.

original: dra'i tshor ba ni dang po lnga la brten pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dra'i tshor ba ni dang po lnga la brten pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Feeling at the end of the body is feeling based on the first five.

original: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pa sa ga'i tshor ba gang yin pa de la ni 'dod chags bag la nyal ba sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gang yin pa de la ni khong khro ba bag la nyal sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i🔽tshor ba gang yin pa de la gti mug bag la nyal lo zhes gsungs pas /
analyzed: de ltar yang tshe dang ldan pa sa ga'i tshor ba gang yin pa de la ni 'dod chags bag la nyal ba sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gang yin pa de la ni khong khro ba bag la nyal sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba gang yin pa de la gti mug bag la nyal lo zhes gsungs pas /
translated: The latent states of attachment exist for any feeling that is pleasant, the latent states of anger exist for any feeling that is painful and the latent states of delusion exist for any feeling that is neither painful nor pleasant.

original: de la bag la nyal gyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshor ba dag ni mi 'byung gi lus kyi khur thogs pa tsam 'ba' zhig las byung ba'i tshor ba rgyud la 'byung ste /
analyzed: de la bag la nyal gyi ngo bo nyid kyi tshor ba dag ni mi 'byung gi lus kyi khur thogs pa tsam 'ba' zhig las byung ba'i tshor ba rgyud la 'byung ste /
translated: Thus feelings that are the essential nature of latent states do not occur, but feelings that arise from the mere burden of the body occur in the mindstream.

original: de'i phyir lus tsam yod na de dag 'byung gi lus 'gags na de dag 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir lus tsam yod na de dag 'byung gi lus 'gags na de dag 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, if the body exists, they occur, but if the body ceases, they cease.

original: dgra bcom pa dag la yang yul gyi dbang gis tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag la yang yul gyi dbang gis tshor ba 'byung ngo zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The Buddha said that even arhats experience feelings due to objects.

original: myong ro snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni shes bzhin du spod pa nyid bstan te /
analyzed: myong ro snyam du yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu shes so zhes bya ba 'dis ni shes bzhin du spod pa nyid bstan te /
translated: This shows that he practices with full awareness.

original: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid la ni nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba med do //
analyzed: shes bzhin du spyod pa nyid la ni nyon mongs pa kun du 'byung ba med do //
translated: He does not arouse the afflictions while practicing with full awareness.

original: srog gi mtha' pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni yid tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa btang snyoms kyi tshor ba ste /
analyzed: srog gi mtha' pa'i tshor ba zhes bya ba ni yid tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa btang snyoms kyi tshor ba ste /
translated: The feeling at the end of life is the feeling of equanimity that is associated only with the mind faculty.

original: 'di ltar ji srid du 'tsho ba de srid du yid tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa btang snyoms kyi tshor ba med pa de'i rgyu las 'byung ngo //🔽de'i phyir mdo sde las dge slong gi sems tshor ba gsum po 'di dag las 'dod chags @230a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji srid du 'tsho ba de srid du yid tsam dang mtshungs par ldan pa btang snyoms kyi tshor ba med pa de'i rgyu las 'byung ngo // de'i phyir mdo sde las dge slong gi sems tshor ba gsum po 'di dag las 'dod chags @230a * //
translated: The feeling of equanimity that is associated only with the mind faculty arises from its own causes for as long as one lives.🔽Therefore, a sutra states:

original: dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba ni de las lhag ma btang snyoms kyi tshor ba yongs su dag pa yongs su byang ba tsam zhig yod ces gsungs te /
analyzed: dang bral zhing rnam par grol ba ni de las lhag ma btang snyoms kyi tshor ba yongs su dag pa yongs su byang ba tsam zhig yod ces gsungs te /
translated: “Monks, those who are free from attachment to the three feelings and are liberated have only the feeling of equanimity that remains, which is pure and clear.”

original: de'i phyir de'i srog yod na /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i srog yod na /
translated: Therefore, as long as one is alive,

original: btang snyoms kyi tshor kun du 'byung ba yod na srog zad la /
analyzed: btang snyoms kyi tshor kun du 'byung ba yod na srog zad la /
translated: If there is the occurrence of the feeling of equanimity, then life is exhausted.

original: de yang par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang par gyur to zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of the phrase, “and then it ceases.”

original: btang snyoms srog dang yid ldan na //
analyzed: btang snyoms srog dang yid ldan na //
translated: When there is equanimity, life, and mind,

original: nges par gsum dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: nges par gsum dang ldan pa yin //
translated: one definitely possesses three.

original: gzugs med pa nas 'chi ba na //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas 'chi ba na //
translated: When dying in the formless realm,

original: srog yid btang snyoms 'gag par 'gyur //
analyzed: srog yid btang snyoms 'gag par 'gyur //
translated: life, mind, and equanimity cease.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained in the Abhidharma.

original: lus zhig pa'i zhes bya ba ni lus shi ba'i 'o //
analyzed: lus zhig pa'i zhes bya ba ni lus shi ba'i 'o //
translated: “The body is destroyed” means that the body dies.

original: 'og tu yongs su gtugs pas zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar byed pa'i las nye bar ma bsags pas mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'og tu yongs su gtugs pas zhes bya ba ni yang 'byung bar byed pa'i las nye bar ma bsags pas mtshams sbyor ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “It is exhausted in the end” means that because one does not accumulate karma that will lead to rebirth, there is no linking of death with birth.

original: dus phyi mar srog kyang med pas zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
analyzed: dus phyi mar srog kyang med pas zhes bya bar dgongs pa yin no //
translated: The intention is that in the future, there is no life.

original: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid du zhes bya ba ni tshe 'di nyid du'o //
translated: “In this very life” means in this very lifetime.

original: de'i tshor ba thams cad ces bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi tshor ba lus kyi mtha' ba dang / srog gi mtha' pa thams cad do //🔽ma lus par 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas lus dang / srog gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du bsags pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i tshor ba thams cad ces bya ba ni bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / btang snyoms kyi tshor ba lus kyi mtha' ba dang / srog gi mtha' pa thams cad do // ma lus par 'gag par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas lus dang / srog gnyis thams cad kyi thams cad du bsags pa'i phyir te /
translated: They will cease without remainder means that both the body and life are completely exhausted,

original: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽ma lus par nus par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas de gnyis kyang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro // ma lus par nus par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni gnas de gnyis kyang mi skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one attains nirvana without remainder of the aggregates.🔽They will be able to without remainder means that both the body and life will not arise again.🔽They will be completely exhausted without remainder means that there is no other basis besides those two.🔽They will be completely exhausted without remainder means that there is no other basis besides those two.
