original: bdag bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa ni lus zhig par gyur pa de nyid sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chi ba'i tshe na 'chi ba'i mtha'i tshor ba dag ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur bar dgongs te
analyzed: bdag bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa ni lus zhig par gyur pa de nyid sdug bsngal gyi mtha' yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'chi ba'i tshe na 'chi ba'i mtha'i tshor ba dag ni sdug bsngal skye ba'i rgyur mi 'gyur bar dgongs te
translated: The thought is that the feeling at the end of death does not cause the generation of suffering at death.

original: / ji skad du /
analyzed: / ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽One who has well practiced pure conduct

original: tshangs spyod legs par spyad pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
analyzed: tshangs spyod legs par spyad pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
translated: and well cultivated the path

original: tshe zad dga' bar 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: tshe zad dga' bar 'gyur ba ste //
translated: is happy when life ends

original: nad dang bral ba ji bzhin no //
analyzed: nad dang bral ba ji bzhin no //
translated: just like being free of illness.🔽One who has well practiced pure conduct

original: tshangs spyod legs par spyad pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
analyzed: tshangs spyod legs par spyad pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
translated: and well cultivated the path

original: tshe zad dga' bar 'gyur ba ste //
analyzed: tshe zad dga' bar 'gyur ba ste //
translated: is happy when life ends

original: dug snod spangs pa ji bzhin @230b no ;
analyzed: dug snod spangs pa ji bzhin @230b no ;
translated: just like discarding a poisoned vessel.🔽One who has well practiced pure conduct

original: ; tshangs spyod legs par spyod pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
analyzed: ; tshangs spyod legs par spyod pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
translated: and well cultivated the path🔽is happy when life ends

original: 'bar ba'i khyim nas thar ba ltar //
analyzed: 'bar ba'i khyim nas thar ba ltar //
translated: just like being freed from a burning house.

original: 'chi ba'i mtha' ni mya ngan med //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i mtha' ni mya ngan med //
translated: The end of death is free of sorrow.

original: tshangs spyod legs par spyad pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
analyzed: tshangs spyod legs par spyad pa dang // lam nyid legs par bsgoms pa ni //
translated: and well cultivated the path🔽when seeing the world

original: gang tshe 'jig rten shes rab kyis //
analyzed: gang tshe 'jig rten shes rab kyis //
translated: through the wisdom of the āryas

original: rtsva dang shing 'drar mthong gyur pa //🔽de tshe nyid mtshams sbyor med las //🔽gzhan pa 'dod par mi byed do //
analyzed: rtsva dang shing 'drar mthong gyur pa // de tshe nyid mtshams sbyor med las // gzhan pa 'dod par mi byed do //
translated: as like grass and trees,🔽then one does not desire

original: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: anything other than the absence of connection to existence.

original: dgra bcom pa dag 'chi ba'i mthar bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gnyis ni mi myong gi //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa dag 'chi ba'i mthar bde ba'i tshor ba dang / sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba gnyis ni mi myong gi //
translated: Arhats do not experience the two feelings of pleasure and pain at the end of death.

original: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni myong bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal yang ma yin bde ba yang ma yin pa'i tshor ba ni myong bar 'gyur te /
translated: They experience the feeling that is neither pleasure nor pain.

original: 'chi ba dang skye ba gnyis la ni btang snyoms kyi tshor ba yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba dang skye ba gnyis la ni btang snyoms kyi tshor ba yod do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because it is said that both death and birth have the feeling of equanimity.

original: de bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'chi ba'i mtha'i skad cig ma gcig la ni btang snyoms kyi tshor ba 'ba' zhig yod la /
analyzed: de bden mod kyi 'on kyang 'chi ba'i mtha'i skad cig ma gcig la ni btang snyoms kyi tshor ba 'ba' zhig yod la /
translated: That is true, but in the single moment at the end of death, only the feeling of equanimity exists.

original: tshor ba gzhan med kyi lus 'jig pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis yin pas de'i phyir skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis lus 'jig pa la ni tshor ba gsum char yod pas nyes pa'i skad med do //
analyzed: tshor ba gzhan med kyi lus 'jig pa ni skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis yin pas de'i phyir skad cig ma'i rgyun gyis lus 'jig pa la ni tshor ba gsum char yod pas nyes pa'i skad med do //
translated: But the body is destroyed by the stream of moments, and therefore all three feelings exist in the stream of moments that destroys the body.

original: de bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa ni mi ldan pa myong bar byed kyi ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo //
analyzed: de bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar byed pa ni mi ldan pa myong bar byed kyi ldan pa ni ma yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo //
translated: The Venerable Ananda said, “I experience the feeling of pleasure without attachment, but not with attachment.”

original: kho bo la ni sten pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing gzhan du gyur kyang /
analyzed: kho bo la ni sten pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das shing gzhan du gyur kyang /
translated: “Even though my companion has passed into nirvana and has changed,

original: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag mi 'byung do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid mi bde ba dang / 'khrug pa dag mi 'byung do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: I do not experience sorrow, lamentation, pain, unhappiness, and mental disturbance.”

original: de la mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Without attachment” means that he has abandoned the afflictions such as passion.

original: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldan pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kun du 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: “Endowed” means that the afflictions such as desire are present.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de gsum gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang yang dang yang du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir smos par zad kyi /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang mi ldan pa zhes bya ba ni de gsum gtso bo yin pa'i phyir dang yang dang yang du kun du 'byung ba'i phyir smos par zad kyi /
translated: “Not endowed” means that desire, hatred, and delusion are not present.

original: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag kyang 'dar gzung bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang nye ba'i nyon mongs pa gzhan dag kyang 'dar gzung bar bya ba'o //
translated: However, this does not mean that other afflictions and secondary afflictions are absent.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni phung po mngon par 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni phung po mngon par 'grub pa'o //
translated: “Birth” means the establishment of the aggregates.

original: rga ba zhes bya ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o //
analyzed: rga ba zhes bya ba ni phung po yongs su smin pa'o //
translated: “Aging” means the maturation of the aggregates.

original: na ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: na ba zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: “Sickness” means the suffering of the body.

original: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni phung po 'dor ba'o /
analyzed: 'chi ba zhes bya ba ni phung po 'dor ba'o /
translated: “Death” means the loss of the aggregates.

original: @231a * // mya ngan zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: @231a * // mya ngan zhes bya ba ni yid mi bde ba dang mtshungs par ldan pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: “Sorrow” means the thought that is associated with mental dissatisfaction.

original: smre sngags 'don pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan gyis bslang ba'i tshig tu 'don pa'o //
analyzed: smre sngags 'don pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan gyis bslang ba'i tshig tu 'don pa'o //
translated: Lamentation is the utterance of words that arise from grief.

original: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni lus kyi tshor ba sdug bsngal glo bur du 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni lus kyi tshor ba sdug bsngal glo bur du 'byung ba'o //
translated: Pain is the sudden arising of physical feeling.

original: yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi tshor ba'o //
analyzed: yid mi bde ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi tshor ba'o //
translated: Sorrow is mental feeling.

original: 'khrug pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan dang bcas pa'i brang brdung ba la sogs pa lus rnam par 'gyur ba'o //🔽sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa spyi'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi chu bo'am /
analyzed: 'khrug pa zhes bya ba ni mya ngan dang bcas pa'i brang brdung ba la sogs pa lus rnam par 'gyur ba'o // sdug bsngal zhes bya ba ni sngar bstan pa spyi'i bdag nyid kyi sdug bsngal gyi chu bo'am /
translated: Despair is the agitation of the body, such as beating the chest with grief.🔽Suffering is the suffering that arises from the burden of the aggregates, as previously explained.

original: phung po'i khur thogs pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: phung po'i khur thogs pa las skyes pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The suffering of change is the suffering that arises from the burden of the aggregates, as previously explained.

original: de ltar na chos bstan pa des ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du rgyu sen rings la lta ba la lhag par chags pas gzugs dang / gzugs med na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa bstan pa la 'dod pa la lhag par chags pas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa bstan /
analyzed: de ltar na chos bstan pa des ni bcom ldan 'das kyis kun du rgyu sen rings la lta ba la lhag par chags pas gzugs dang / gzugs med na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa bstan pa la 'dod pa la lhag par chags pas ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyi skye ba dang 'gag pa bstan /
translated: Thus, by this teaching of the Dharma, the Lord taught the wandering mendicant Dīrghanakha that the arising and cessation of the afflictions that occur in the form and formless realms is due to attachment to views, and that the arising and cessation of the afflictions that occur in the desire realm is due to attachment to desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba rnams ni 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yang ma yin par bstan to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i zag pa dang bcas pa'i tshor ba rnams ni 'dod pa la lhag par chags pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur ba dang / 'khor ba'i rtsa ba yang ma yin par bstan to //
translated: He taught that contaminated feelings free from attachment do not serve as a cause for attachment to desire and are not the root of cyclic existence.

original: bsil yab ces bya ba ni rnga ma'o //
analyzed: bsil yab ces bya ba ni rnga ma'o //
translated: The word “fan” means a peacock’s tail.

original: chos de dang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang reg ba dag gi ste /
analyzed: chos de dang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni lus dang tshor ba dang reg ba dag gi ste /
translated: The words “those phenomena” refer to the body, feelings, and contact.

original: bzlas pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
analyzed: bzlas pa'i phyir lan gnyis su smos so //
translated: They are mentioned twice for the purpose of review.

original: spong ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: spong ba zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: The word “abandonment” means nirvana.

original: nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa rnams zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the afflictions are exhausted.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ba zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba zhes bya ba ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa ba zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Free from attachment” means that the afflictions that have that as their object are exhausted.

original: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i ngo bo nyid zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Cessation” means the exhaustion of the nature of the afflictions.

original: rab tu spong ba zhes bya ba ni kha cig la mig la sogs pa spangs kyang kun du 'byung ba yod pas /
analyzed: rab tu spong ba zhes bya ba ni kha cig la mig la sogs pa spangs kyang kun du 'byung ba yod pas /
translated: “Completely abandoned” means that even though the eye, etc. are abandoned in some cases, their arising still exists.

original: kun du 'byung ba de yang spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: kun du 'byung ba de yang spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: That arising is also abandoned.

original: 'dis ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i gnas skabs bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni phung po'i lhag ma med pa'i gnas skabs bstan to //
translated: This teaches the state of no remainder of the aggregates.🔽“The mind is completely liberated from the outflows without grasping” means that the mind is completely liberated from the outflows.

original: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba la yang zag pa rnams las zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las te /
analyzed: len pa med par zag pa rnams las sems rnam par grol lo zhes bya ba la yang zag pa rnams las zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams las te /
translated: The outflows are the afflictions of the three realms.

original: de rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
analyzed: de rnams las sems rnam par grol lo //
translated: The mind is completely liberated from them.

original: ji ltar rnam par grol zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar rnam par grol zhe na /
translated: How is it liberated?

original: de'i phyir len pa med par zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir len pa med par zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “without grasping.”

original: nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams 'thob pa'i sgo nas bzung ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa lhag ma rnams 'thob pa'i sgo nas bzung ste /
translated: The rest of the afflictions are eliminated by the path of cultivation.

original: @231b rnam par spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @231b rnam par spangs zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “completely abandoned.”

original: kha cig na re yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid kyi zhes kyang zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid kyi zhes kyang zer ro //
translated: Some say that the phrase “the nature of not falling back” is meant.

original: de la zag pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad nas mnar med pa yan chad du skye mched kyi rma drug po dag nas 'dzag cing 'byung ba 'am 'khor bar gnas par gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de la zag pa zhes bya ba'i nges pa'i tshig ni srid pa'i rtse mo man chad nas mnar med pa yan chad du skye mched kyi rma drug po dag nas 'dzag cing 'byung ba 'am 'khor bar gnas par gyur pa yin no //
translated: The Sanskrit term for “elimination” is āsrava. It means that from the peak of existence down to the lowest hell, the six sense bases are eliminated and eliminated, or they are eliminated and eliminated in the three realms.

original: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la chags pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni khams gsum la chags pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: “Liberation” means that one is free from attachment to the three realms.

original: nyon mongs pa spangs pas dgra bcom par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa spangs pas dgra bcom par gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “having become an arhat through the abandonment of the afflictions.”

original: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni grogs med pa ste lus kyis dben no //🔽dben pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis thag ring du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gcig pu zhes bya ba ni grogs med pa ste lus kyis dben no // dben pa zhes bya ba ni sems kyis thag ring du gyur pa'o //
translated: “Alone” means without a companion, physically isolated.🔽“Isolated” means mentally isolated.

original: bag yod pa zhes bya ba ni nan tan lhur len pa'o //
analyzed: bag yod pa zhes bya ba ni nan tan lhur len pa'o //
translated: “Conscientious” means being dedicated to practice.

original: brtun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grub dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: brtun pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni brtson 'grub dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Endowed with perseverance” means endowed with effort.

original: bdag nyid btang ba zhes bya ba ni yid btang ba ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid btang ba zhes bya ba ni yid btang ba ste /
translated: “Giving up oneself” means giving up one’s mind.

original: rtag tu dge ba'i phyogs 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rtag tu dge ba'i phyogs 'dod ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means “always desiring the side of virtue.”

original: gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'dug par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so zhes bya ba ni 'dug par gyur pa'o //
translated: “Abides” means remains.

original: rigs kyi bu dag ces bya ba ni rigs su skyes pa'i mi dag go //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu dag ces bya ba ni rigs su skyes pa'i mi dag go //
translated: “Sons of noble family” means men born in a good family.

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba ni gang gi don du'o //
translated: “For the sake of which” means for the sake of what.

original: tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa'i mtha' zhes bya ba ni lam gyi 'bras bu mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: “The end of pure action” means the fruit of the path, nirvāṇa.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni mchog go //
translated: “Unsurpassed” means supreme.

original: tshe de nyid la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi tshe la'o //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi tshe la'o //
translated: “In that very life” means in the life in which one has direct experience.

original: rang gi mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi shes pas so //
analyzed: rang gi mngon par shes pas zhes bya ba ni rang gi shes pas so //
translated: “By one’s own superknowledge” means by one’s own knowledge.

original: mngon sum du byas te zhes bya ba ni shes par byas te'o //
analyzed: mngon sum du byas te zhes bya ba ni shes par byas te'o //
translated: “Having realized” means having known.

original: bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa mngon sum du bya ba thob nas so //
analyzed: bsgrubs nas zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa mngon sum du bya ba thob nas so //
translated: Having practiced means having attained the realization of the obtainment of the result.

original: zad do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
analyzed: zad do zhes bya ba ni mthar thug pa'o //
translated: Crossed over means having reached the end.

original: spyad do zhes bya ba ni spyad zin pa'o //
analyzed: spyad do zhes bya ba ni spyad zin pa'o //
translated: Experienced means having experienced.

original: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba byas so zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spangs pa'o //
translated: Done what had to be done means having abandoned the afflictions.

original: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa yang ngo //
analyzed: srid pa 'di las gzhan mi shes so zhes bya ba ni bar ma do'i srid pa yang ngo //
translated: There is no more of this mundane existence means there is no more intermediate existence.

original: go bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni shes par byed cing ngo //
analyzed: go bar byed cing zhes bya ba ni shes par byed cing ngo //
translated: Having understood means having known.

original: ci zhig shes par byed cing zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig shes par byed cing zhe na /
translated: What is known?

original: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa dag go //🔽kun shes pa dang ldan pa pa'i zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa thob pa'i ste /
analyzed: bdag gi skye ba zad do zhes bya ba la sogs pa sngar bstan pa dag go // kun shes pa dang ldan pa pa'i zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba'i shes pa thob pa'i ste /
translated: The previously mentioned things such as the exhaustion of my births.🔽Possessing complete knowledge means having attained the knowledge of exhaustion and the knowledge of nonarising.

original: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i kun shes pa rtogs pa gang la yod pa de ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sdug bsngal yongs su shes par byar med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i kun shes pa rtogs pa gang la yod pa de ni kun shes pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing complete knowledge is the realization of complete knowledge that one has fully understood suffering and so on.

original: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa @232a * //
analyzed: dgra bcom pa zhes bya ba ni mchod par 'os pa @232a * //
translated: The one called Arhat is worthy of worship,

original: dang yang mi skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dang yang mi skye ba dang / nyon mongs pa'i dgra bcom pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is worthy of worship through his qualities of abandonment and realization.

original: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sems shin tu rnam par grol ba zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi nyams pa'i chos nyid kyis so //
translated: He is one whose mind is completely liberated, because he is not subject to falling away.

original: bar sdom zhes bya ba ni kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde'i khongs su gtogs pa'i rnam grangs dag mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bar sdom zhes bya ba ni kye goo ta ma bdag ni thams cad mi bzod do zhes bya ba la sogs pa mdo sde'i khongs su gtogs pa'i rnam grangs dag mi brjed par bya ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pas mdor bsdus pa'o //
translated: The summary is a verse that summarizes the sutra in order to not forget the categories that are included in the sutra, such as “O Gautama, I cannot bear all of this.”

original: so so yang dag rig pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig par zhes bya ba'i phyir mi bzlogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa dag la tshegs chung dus kun du spyod pa'i bdag po thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: so so yang dag rig pa thob pa zhes bya ba ni chos dang / don dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig par zhes bya ba'i phyir mi bzlogs pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis shes pa dag la tshegs chung dus kun du spyod pa'i bdag po thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The one who has attained the correct knowledges is one who has attained mastery over the knowledges that are by nature irreversible with regard to the teachings, meanings, etymologies, and confidence, because he practices them with little difficulty.

original: the tshom skyes nas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rabs byam klas pa dang ldan pas dge slong rnams the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i the tshom gyis dbye ba thams cad nges par mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: the tshom skyes nas zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bu shes rabs byam klas pa dang ldan pas dge slong rnams the tshom thams cad gcod pa zhes bya ba ni 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i the tshom gyis dbye ba thams cad nges par mdzad pa'o //
translated: Having doubts means that the noble Shariputra, endowed with limitless wisdom, is called the one who cuts off all doubts of the monks because he definitely resolves all the distinctions of doubts in the past, future, and present.

original: zhus pa zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
analyzed: zhus pa zhes bya ba ni dris pa'o //
translated: Asked means inquired.

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for the ripening of that karma,

original: las zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: las zhes bya ba ni dge ba zag pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: karma refers to contaminated virtue.

original: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /
translated: Ripening is the result designated in the cause.

original: 'bras bu skyed pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i las nyid la bya ba'i 'bras bur smin pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'bras bu skyed pa'i gnas skabs su gyur pa'i las nyid la bya ba'i 'bras bur smin pa'i gnas skabs ni ma yin no //
translated: It is the karma itself that has become the state of producing the result, not the state of having ripened as the result of the action.

original: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni myur du don cha phra ba dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni myur du don cha phra ba dag la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sharp wisdom means quickly engaging in subtle meanings.

original: shes rab zab pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis gting mi slebs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab zab pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dag gis gting mi slebs pa'i shes rab dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Deep wisdom means having wisdom that others cannot fathom.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni nyon mongs pa spong bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Wisdom that is penetrating means that which eliminates afflictions.

original: tshogs rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dag rnyed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs rnyed pa zhes bya ba ni nang gi lhan cig byed pa'i rgyu dag rnyed pa'o //
translated: Having obtained the collection means having obtained the internal co-arising causes.

original: rkyen yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi grogs rjes su mthun par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen yongs su gyur pa zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi grogs rjes su mthun par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The transformation of conditions means the external aids become concordant.

original: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chu'i 'od pa bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba ni chu'i 'od pa bzhin du rang gi bya ba byed pa la mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: Abiding like a light means like the light of water, it is directed towards performing its own function.

original: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar gyur pa dag ces bya ba ni nges pa ste /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar 'byung bar gyur pa dag ces bya ba ni nges pa ste /
translated: Those that will certainly occur means certainty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bzlog par mi spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang bzlog par mi spyod pa dag go //
translated: The Bhagavān also does not engage in reversal.

original: byas shing zhes bya ba ni bslang zhing ngam bsgrubs shing ngo //
analyzed: byas shing zhes bya ba ni bslang zhing ngam bsgrubs shing ngo //
translated: Having done means having raised or accomplished.

original: bsags pas zhes bya ba ni mthun @232b pa'i tshogs kyis gsos pa'am //
analyzed: bsags pas zhes bya ba ni mthun @232b pa'i tshogs kyis gsos pa'am //
translated: “By accumulation” means by the accumulation of concordant karma.

original: 'bras bur 'gyur bar nges par byas ba ste /
analyzed: 'bras bur 'gyur bar nges par byas ba ste /
translated: “It is certain to become a result” means it is certain to become a result.

original: ched du bsams te byas pas so //
analyzed: ched du bsams te byas pas so //
translated: “Intentionally” means it is done on purpose.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid can yin na /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni thugs rje'i bdag nyid can yin na /
translated: If the Bhagavān is the embodiment of compassion,

original: nyid kyis ci'i phyir zhal gyis mi bzhes she na /
analyzed: nyid kyis ci'i phyir zhal gyis mi bzhes she na /
translated: why does he not himself accept it?

original: de'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis so sor myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir sh'a ri'i bu nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag gzhan su zhig gis so sor myong bar 'gyur zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “Śāriputra, who else will experience the karma that you yourself have created and accumulated?”

original: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la 'bras bu dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dongs so //
analyzed: 'brel pa med pa'i phyir gzhan gyi rgyud la 'bras bu dag tu mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bar dongs so //
translated: Because there is no connection, the results do not occur in the continuum of another.

original: rdzu 'phrul dang gsang sngags la sogs pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po dag las ci'i phyir 'byung par mi mdzad ce na de'i phyir dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i kyams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhes bya🔽ba la sogs pa gsangs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul dang gsang sngags la sogs pa'i dbang gis phyi rol gyi dngos po dag las ci'i phyir 'byung par mi mdzad ce na de'i phyir dge slong dag las byas shing bsags pa dag ni phyi rol gyi sa'i kyams la rnam par smin par mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsangs so //
translated: Therefore, the Buddha said, “Monks, karma that is created and accumulated does not ripen externally in the soil.”

original: las dge ba zhes bya ba ni bzang ba'o //
analyzed: las dge ba zhes bya ba ni bzang ba'o //
translated: Virtuous karma is good.

original: mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni ngan pa'o //
analyzed: mi dge ba zhes bya ba ni ngan pa'o //
translated: Nonvirtuous karma is bad.

original: zin pa zhes bya ba ni sems pas zin pa ste /
analyzed: zin pa zhes bya ba ni sems pas zin pa ste /
translated: Accumulated means karma that is accumulated by intention.

original: nang gi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nang gi zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means internal.

original: phung po zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa spungs pa'i mtshan nyid lnga'o //
analyzed: phung po zhes bya ba ni gzugs la sogs pa spungs pa'i mtshan nyid lnga'o //
translated: Aggregates means the five aggregates that have the characteristic of being heaps of form and so on.

original: khams zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa 'byung gnas kyi mtshan nyid bco brgyad do //
analyzed: khams zhes bya ba ni mig gi khams la sogs pa 'byung gnas kyi mtshan nyid bco brgyad do //
translated: Elements means the eighteen elements that have the characteristic of being sources, such as the eye element and so on.

original: skye mched dag la zhes bya ba ni mig gi skye mched la sogs pa rnams par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid bcu gnyis po dag la'o //
analyzed: skye mched dag la zhes bya ba ni mig gi skye mched la sogs pa rnams par shes pa skye ba'i sgo'i mtshan nyid bcu gnyis po dag la'o //
translated: In the sense-spheres means in the twelve sense-spheres characterized as the doors for the arising of consciousness, such as the eye-sense-sphere.

original: rnam par smin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam rnams kyi phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la sogs pa sems pa med pa dag la rnams par smin par 'gyur par dgag par bstan to //
analyzed: rnam par smin par 'gyur te zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam rnams kyi phyi rol gyi sa'i khams la sogs pa sems pa med pa dag la rnams par smin par 'gyur par dgag par bstan to //
translated: The word “ripen” indicates that the ripening of the paths is not in the external elements such as earth, which are not mind.

original: dus 'phongs pas ji ltar chud mi za bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: dus 'phongs pas ji ltar chud mi za bar mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: How can it not be wasted through the passage of time?🔽Therefore it is said:

original: de'i phyir / las rnams bskal ba brgyar yang ni //🔽chud mi za ba'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / las rnams bskal ba brgyar yang ni // chud mi za ba'ang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The karmas, even after a hundred eons,

original: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug pa'i ba'i bye brag bstan te /
analyzed: 'ang zhes bya ba'i sgra gnyis pas ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba ba'i sgra'i don la 'jug pa'i ba'i bye brag bstan te /
translated: The word “also” in the second line indicates the distinction of the word “thus” in the sense of the word “thus.”

original: las rnams bskal ba brgyar yang chud mi za ba ni 'di ltar tshogs pa dang / dus rnyed na lus can rnams la 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi tshogs pa dang / dus ma rnyed na 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur bar ma nges so zhes bya ba'i thag tshig go //
analyzed: las rnams bskal ba brgyar yang chud mi za ba ni 'di ltar tshogs pa dang / dus rnyed na lus can rnams la 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid yin gyi tshogs pa dang / dus ma rnyed na 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur bar ma nges so zhes bya ba'i thag tshig go //
translated: “Karmas do not perish even in a hundred eons. When the assemblage and the occasion are obtained, they will certainly yield fruits for embodied beings. But if the assemblage and the occasion are not obtained, it is not certain that they will yield fruits.”

original: tshogs zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs zhes bya ba ni skyed pa'i rgyu'i tshogs pa'o //
translated: The assemblage is the assemblage of the causes that generate .

original: dus zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'o //
analyzed: dus zhes bya ba ni bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'o //
translated: The occasion is the absence of an obstructing cause.

original: rnyed na zhes bya ba ni ldan @233a * //
analyzed: rnyed na zhes bya ba ni ldan @233a * //
translated: “Obtained” means “possessed.”

original: na'o ; ; lus can rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la'o //
analyzed: na'o ; ; lus can rnams la zhes bya ba ni sems can rnams la'o //
translated: “Embodied beings” means “sentient beings.”

original: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dag tu smin par 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu dag tu smin par 'gyur pa'o //
translated: “Yield fruits” means “ripen as fruits.”

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba ste /
translated: The word “certainly” is a particle.

original: gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gdon mi za ba zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means “without doubt.”

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage is as follows.

original: las nges pa rnams ni bskal pa brgya phrag 'das pa dag tu yang chud mi za ba yin te /
analyzed: las nges pa rnams ni bskal pa brgya phrag 'das pa dag tu yang chud mi za ba yin te /
translated: The certain karmas do not perish even after a hundred eons have passed.

original: de yang 'di ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'i dus rnyed na byed pa po sems can lus can rnams la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid yin te 'dir don ni de yin no //
analyzed: de yang 'di ltar rgyu'i tshogs pa dang / bar du gcod pa'i rgyu med pa'i dus rnyed na byed pa po sems can lus can rnams la 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu dag tu 'gyur ba nyid yin te 'dir don ni de yin no //
translated: Moreover, when the assemblage of causes and the absence of an obstructing cause are obtained, the results, whether desirable or undesirable, come to the sentient beings who are the agents. This is the meaning here.

original: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus gang gi tshe las dag byas shing ji ltar byas she na /
analyzed: 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus gang gi tshe las dag byas shing ji ltar byas she na /
translated: When the noble Śāriputra asked, “When the karmas are done, how are they done?”

original: de'i phyir dge slong dag sngon byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong dag sngon byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “Monks, there was a time…” and so on.

original: sngon byung bar gyur pa de bsnyad par bya'i da ltar gyi dus kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon byung bar gyur pa de bsnyad par bya'i da ltar gyi dus kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is said that what happened in the past should be explained, not what happens in the present.

original: nyon mongs pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dag gis zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa'o //
translated: “By afflictions” means by attachment and so on.

original: gnod par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni gzir bar gyur nas so //
analyzed: gnod par gyur nas zhes bya ba ni gzir bar gyur nas so //
translated: “Having been harmed” means having been oppressed.

original: dgon pa'i sman dag gis zhes bya ba ni dgon pa nas 'byung ba'i sman rtsa ba sdong bu la sogs pa dag gis so//
analyzed: dgon pa'i sman dag gis zhes bya ba ni dgon pa nas 'byung ba'i sman rtsa ba sdong bu la sogs pa dag gis so//
translated: “Medicines from the wilderness” are medicines that grow in the wilderness, such as roots and tree-barks.

original: 'tsho bar zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho bar zhes bya ba ni stobs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Live” means to be strong.

original: cig car ces bya ba ni dus gcig tu'o //
analyzed: cig car ces bya ba ni dus gcig tu'o //
translated: “At once” means at the same time.

original: tshig brjod dang zhes bya ba ni tshig smra ba'o //
analyzed: tshig brjod dang zhes bya ba ni tshig smra ba'o //
translated: “Speech” means words.

original: sig pa zhes ba ba ni 'bras bu mi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: sig pa zhes ba ba ni 'bras bu mi 'dod pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “Action” means the possession of undesirable results.

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dag pa ma yin pa rnams kyi chos te /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i chos zhes bya ba ni skyes bu dag pa ma yin pa rnams kyi chos te /
translated: “Non-virtuous Dharma” means the Dharma of those who are not holy persons.

original: nyes par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos ma yin pa yang chos kyi sgrar brjod do /
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa'i mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir chos ma yin pa yang chos kyi sgrar brjod do /
translated: Non-Dharma is also called Dharma because it bears the characteristics of bad conduct.

original: lhan cig ces bya ba ni cig car ro //
analyzed: lhan cig ces bya ba ni cig car ro //
translated: “Together” means at the same time.

original: yon tan gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni yon tan chen po ste /
analyzed: yon tan gyi tshogs zhes bya ba ni yon tan chen po ste /
translated: “Mass of good qualities” means great good qualities.

original: 'dir ni shes pa'i phye brag yin no / mtha' gcig tu zhes bya ba ni skye bo med pa'i gnas su'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni shes pa'i phye brag yin no / mtha' gcig tu zhes bya ba ni skye bo med pa'i gnas su'o //
translated: Here, it is a particular kind of knowledge. “In one place” means in a place without people.

original: mkhan po med pa zhes bya ba 'dir chos ram par 'chad ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mkhan po med pa zhes bya ba 'dir chos ram par 'chad ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, without a preceptor means that there is no one to explain the Dharma in detail.

original: slob dpon med pa zhes bya ba ni lam nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slob dpon med pa zhes bya ba ni lam nye bar ston pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And without a master means that there is no one to teach the path.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs dang mthun pa zhes bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i byang chub kyi phyogs dang rjes su mthun pa'o //
translated: The factors of enlightenment are concordant with the enlightenment of the knowledge of elimination and non-arising.

original: chos su ma cu rta bdun zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin dang / yang @233b dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
analyzed: chos su ma cu rta bdun zhes bya ba ni dran pa nye bar gzhag pa bzhin dang / yang @233b dag par spong ba bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / dbang po lnga dang / stobs lnga dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang /
translated: The thirty-seven factors of enlightenment are the four establishments of mindfulness, the four right efforts, the four bases of supernatural power, the five faculties, the five powers, the seven factors of enlightenment,

original: 'phags pa'i lam yang lag brgyad pa dag bsdoms na sum cu rtsa bdun yin no //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yang lag brgyad pa dag bsdoms na sum cu rtsa bdun yin no //
translated: and the eightfold noble path. Together, they are thirty-seven.

original: bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas nas so //
analyzed: bskyed nas zhes bya ba ni mngon sum du byas nas so //
translated: Having generated means having actualized.

original: rang byang chub ces bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i dbang po 'bring gis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: rang byang chub ces bya ba ni zad pa dang mi skye ba shes pa'i dbang po 'bring gis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Solitary realizers refers to the realization of the knowledge of elimination and nonarising that is subsumed by the middling faculty.

original: mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang shes pa mngon sum du bya ba gnyis kyis mngon sum du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du byas so zhes bya ba ni 'thob pa dang shes pa mngon sum du bya ba gnyis kyis mngon sum du byas pa ste /
translated: They have actualized it means that they have actualized it by means of both attainment and knowledge.

original: rang sangs rgyas su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas su gyur ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is what is meant by they have become solitary realizers.

original: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni lus kyis chos ston gyi tshig gis mi ston pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni lus kyis chos ston gyi tshig gis mi ston pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: Those great beings teach the Dharma by means of their bodies, not by means of speech.

original: lus kyis zhes bya ba ni lus la brten pa 'bar ba dang / gsal ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lus kyis zhes bya ba ni lus la brten pa 'bar ba dang / gsal ba la sogs pas so //
translated: By means of their bodies means by means of blazing, shining, and so on that are based on their bodies.

original: chos ston ces bya ba ni chos nye bar ston pa'o //
analyzed: chos ston ces bya ba ni chos nye bar ston pa'o //
translated: They teach the Dharma means they teach the Dharma.🔽 But if teaching the Dharma is a specific type of speech, how can it be suitable to teach the Dharma by means of the body?

original: 'on chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi bye brag yin na lus kyis ji ltar chos ston pa nyid du rung zhe na pa den med kyi 'on kyang nye bar gdags pa la nyes pa med de /
analyzed: 'on chos ston pa zhes bya ba ni tshig gi bye brag yin na lus kyis ji ltar chos ston pa nyid du rung zhe na pa den med kyi 'on kyang nye bar gdags pa la nyes pa med de /
translated: It is not nonexistent, but there is no fault in positing it.

original: ji ltar tshig gis chos ston pas 'bras bu 'dod pa bskyed pa dang 'dra bar lus kyis co 'phrul ston pa 'dis kyang 'bras bu 'dod pa skyed pas 'bras bu rgyu brtags nas 'di la chos ston pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar tshig gis chos ston pas 'bras bu 'dod pa bskyed pa dang 'dra bar lus kyis co 'phrul ston pa 'dis kyang 'bras bu 'dod pa skyed pas 'bras bu rgyu brtags nas 'di la chos ston pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Just as the desire for results is generated by teaching the Dharma with words, the desire for results is generated by this display of physical miracles. Therefore, this is called teaching the Dharma by examining the cause of the result.

original: dper na mi blun po la ba lang zhes phya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na mi blun po la ba lang zhes phya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a fool who calls a cow “cow.”

original: tshig gis mi ston pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gis chos mi ston pas so //
analyzed: tshig gis mi ston pas zhes bya ba ni tshig gis chos mi ston pas so //
translated: “Because they do not teach with words” means because they do not teach the Dharma with words.

original: 'o na bdag nyid chen po de dag ni snying rjes bskyad pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa dang / sems can gyi spyod pa yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa yin na /
analyzed: 'o na bdag nyid chen po de dag ni snying rjes bskyad pa'i rgyu dang ldan pa dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi thob pa dang / sems can gyi spyod pa yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa yin na /
translated: If those great beings are endowed with the cause of compassion, have attained the four analytical knowledges, and are skilled in knowing the conduct of sentient beings,

original: ci'i phyir de dag tshig gis chos mi ston can /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de dag tshig gis chos mi ston can /
translated: why do they not teach the Dharma with words?

original: bden mod kyi de dag ni dus dpag tu med pa nas goms pa'i dbang gis dben pa la mos pa nyid kyis mchog tu zab pa'i chos gzung ba'i phyir sems can rnams la bya ba byed par mi spro ste /🔽'di ltar sems can 'di dag ni thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun gyis 'khor ba'i rgyun phyogs su 'dong ba yin pas de dag 'khor ba'i rgyun las bzlog phyogs su bkri ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas
analyzed: bden mod kyi de dag ni dus dpag tu med pa nas goms pa'i dbang gis dben pa la mos pa nyid kyis mchog tu zab pa'i chos gzung ba'i phyir sems can rnams la bya ba byed par mi spro ste / 'di ltar sems can 'di dag ni thog ma med pa nas bsags pa'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun gyis 'khor ba'i rgyun phyogs su 'dong ba yin pas de dag 'khor ba'i rgyun las bzlog phyogs su bkri ba ni bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas
translated: True, but they are not inclined to take up the profound teaching because they are accustomed to the mundane for countless eons, and they are not inclined to work for the welfare of sentient beings.

original: rnams ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis bya dka'o snyam pa'i @234a * //
analyzed: rnams ma gtogs pa gzhan gyis bya dka'o snyam pa'i @234a * //
translated: Thus, these sentient beings are carried along in the current of cyclic existence by the stream of afflictions that have accumulated since beginningless time. It is difficult for anyone other than the unsurpassed, perfect buddhas to lead them away from the current of cyclic existence.

original: phyir ro // yang na skye bo ma lus pa la rjes su ston par thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: phyir ro // yang na skye bo ma lus pa la rjes su ston par thal bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Or, it is in order to completely avoid the consequence that they would have to teach all beings,

original: rnam par g-yeng ba sna tshogs la brten pas 'jigs shing skrag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba sna tshogs la brten pas 'jigs shing skrag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are frightened and terrified of the various distractions.

original: 'dab ma brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni gshog pa 'phyar ba'o //
analyzed: 'dab ma brkyang ba zhes bya ba ni gshog pa 'phyar ba'o //
translated: “With outstretched wings” means with outstretched feathers.

original: nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni bar snang la'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' la zhes bya ba ni bar snang la'o //
translated: “In the sky” means in the air.

original: mngon par 'phags nas zhes bya ba ni gyen du song nas so //🔽'bar ba zhes bya ba ni me la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'phags nas zhes bya ba ni gyen du song nas so // 'bar ba zhes bya ba ni me la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Having risen up” means having gone up.🔽“Blazing” means having the appearance of fire.

original: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'od zer la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhes bya ba ni 'od zer la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Shining” means having the appearance of light rays.

original: char 'bebs pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: char 'bebs pa zhes bya ba ni de nyid la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Raining” means having the appearance of rain.

original: glog 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba la mos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: glog 'byin pa zhes bya ba ni snang ba la mos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Lightning” means having the appearance of lightning.

original: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'o //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo zhes bya ba ni de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'o //
translated: “Ordinary people” means those who have not seen reality.

original: sems gtod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems gtod pa zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par byed pa'o //
translated: “Direct their minds” means they make a wish.

original: shing ljon pa zhes bya ba ni shing skye ba'o //
analyzed: shing ljon pa zhes bya ba ni shing skye ba'o //
translated: “Trees” means the growth of trees.

original: rtsa ba nas bcad pa zhes bya ba ni drung ba nas bcad pa'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba nas bcad pa zhes bya ba ni drung ba nas bcad pa'o //
translated: “Cut down at the root” means cut down at the base.

original: mkho ba bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos la sogs pas bkur sti bya ba'o /
analyzed: mkho ba bstabs pa zhes bya ba ni bza' ba dang / btung ba dang / gos la sogs pas bkur sti bya ba'o /
translated: “Providing what is needed” means to honor them with food, drink, clothing, and so on.

original: mi 'dod bzhin du dang bar bya na zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du yang gso bar bya na'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod bzhin du dang bar bya na zhes bya ba ni mi 'dod bzhin du yang gso bar bya na'o //
translated: “Even if they do not want to” means that one should nurse them even if they do not want to be nursed.

original: smos kyang ci dgos kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam ci dgos kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: smos kyang ci dgos kyis zhes bya ba ni bsam ci dgos kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “What need is there to mention” means “what need is there to think about?”

original: chen po la 'os pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo zhes ba ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chen po la 'os pa zhes bya ba ni gtso bo zhes ba ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Worthy of the great” means “the chief.”

original: rno bo rno bar gcod ces bya ba ni myur du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rno bo rno bar gcod ces bya ba ni myur du gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Sharp, cutting sharply” means cutting quickly.

original: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni myur du don yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab rno ba zhes bya ba ni myur du don yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Sharp wisdom” means quickly discerning the meaning.

original: zab mo zab mor 'bigs zhes ba ba ni thag ring por 'bigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zab mo zab mor 'bigs zhes ba ba ni thag ring por 'bigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Deep, penetrating deeply” means penetrating far.

original: shes rab zab mo zhes bya ba ni don cha phra mo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes rab zab mo zhes bya ba ni don cha phra mo yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Deep wisdom” means discerning subtle meanings.

original: thal bung thal bung du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis pa la tug par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: thal bung thal bung du 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni rim pa gnyis pa la tug par 'gro ba'o //
translated: The phrase they go to the state of being a heap of ashes means that they go to the second hell.

original: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i shes rab ces bya ba ni ma lus pa'i don yongs su gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the wisdom of penetration means that it completely severs all objects.

original: dge slong dag de la bya ba la sogs pa yan skabs kyi mjug bsdu pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag de la bya ba la sogs pa yan skabs kyi mjug bsdu pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase monks, in this regard is used to conclude the section on action, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dmigs kyis bsal ba'o //
translated: The word there is used to indicate a specific case.

original: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bskal ba'i be brag go //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhes bya ba ni bskal ba'i be brag go //
translated: The phrase at that time indicates a specific eon.

original: de'i dus zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus mtshon pa'i dus na'o //
analyzed: de'i dus zhes bya ba ni 'phags pa sh'a ri'i bus mtshon pa'i dus na'o //
translated: The phrase at that time indicates the time of the noble Śāriputra.

original: skabs 'dir gzung kha cig las dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems zhes kyang 'byung ste /
analyzed: skabs 'dir gzung kha cig las dge slong dag 'di ji snyam du sems zhes kyang 'byung ste /
translated: In this context, some editions have the phrase monks, what do you think?

original: de'i gzung nyams pa yin pas de ltar @234b mi gzung ste /
analyzed: de'i gzung nyams pa yin pas de ltar @234b mi gzung ste /
translated: But since this is missing in some editions, it should not be included.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde la sogs pa gzhung gzhan las dge slong dag 'di ji snam du sems de'i tshe de'i dus na che ge mo zhig gang yin pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam du khyed yid gnyis dang the tshom za na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde la sogs pa gzhung gzhan las dge slong dag 'di ji snam du sems de'i tshe de'i dus na che ge mo zhig gang yin pa de gzhan zhig yin snyam du khyed yid gnyis dang the tshom za na /
translated: For example, in other scriptures such as the sutras, it says:

original: de ltar mi blta ste /
analyzed: de ltar mi blta ste /
translated: Monks, if you think that at that time, on that occasion, he was someone else, you should not regard it in that way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: che ge mo nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na che ge mo de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'bung ba'i lugs ltar ni //
analyzed: che ge mo nyid de'i tshe de'i dus na che ge mo de yin pa'i phyir ro zhes 'bung ba'i lugs ltar ni //
translated: Because he himself was the one who was so and so.

original: 'di snyam du sems zhes bya ba de rung gi //
analyzed: 'di snyam du sems zhes bya ba de rung gi //
translated: But it is not proper to think that.

original: 'dir 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi skabs su /
analyzed: 'dir 'dul ba'i sde snod kyi skabs su /
translated: Here, in the context of the Vinaya scriptures,

original: dge slong dag de la de'i tshe de'i dus na /
analyzed: dge slong dag de la de'i tshe de'i dus na /
translated: monks, at that time, on that occasion,

original: bram ze'i bu mo zhib mo gang yin pa de ni dge slong sh'a ri'i bu nyid yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su ni /
analyzed: bram ze'i bu mo zhib mo gang yin pa de ni dge slong sh'a ri'i bu nyid yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs su ni /

analyzed: 'di ji snyam du sems zhes bya ba de 'brel pa med pa'i phyir mi gzung ngo //

analyzed: mchod pa zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i bye brag ste bza' ba dang / btung ba la sogs pa'i mchod pa'o //

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de ltar na'o /
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni de ltar na'o /

original: las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni las ram pa thams cad du mi dge ba rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni las ram pa thams cad du mi dge ba rnams kyi'o //
translated: Of actions that are entirely dark means of all actions that are entirely non-virtuous.

analyzed: rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu mi 'dod pa yin no //

analyzed: las gcig tu dkar ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba ni las rnam pa thams cad du dge ba rnams kyi'o //

original: rnam par smin pa yang gcig tu dkar ba yin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'dod pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa yang gcig tu dkar ba yin zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu 'dod pa yin pa'o //

analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug bsdu ba'i rgyu'i tshig yin no //

analyzed: brtsal bar bya ste zhes bya ba ni bsam par ba ste'o //

analyzed: khyad kyis zhes bya ba ni khyed cag gis so //

original: chos dang chos ma yin pas zhes bya ba la /

translated: “By virtue and nonvirtue” means

translated: “by virtue and nonvirtue.” “ Virtue” means “abandoning killing” and so on.

translated: “You will go to hell” means

analyzed: der 'gro bar 'gyur ba ni der lhung bar 'gyur zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //

analyzed: legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: “In the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya” means

translated: “He is a monk” means he is a mendicant who has gone forth from the household life into homelessness and who is a holder of the monastic code and who is a holder of the discourses and who is a holder of the Vinaya and who is a holder of the Mātṛkā.

analyzed: bsti gnas zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba'i 'dag gnas so //
translated: “He is a monk” means he is a mendicant who has gone forth from the household life into homelessness and who is a holder of the monastic code and who is a holder of the discourses and who is a holder of the Vinaya and who is a holder of the Mātṛkā and who is a holder of the Abhidharma.

analyzed: mngon par shes pa lnga zhes bya ba ni rdza 'phrul gyi yul dang / lha'i rna ba dang / sems kyi rnam grangs dang / sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa dang / 'chi 'pho dang ; skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: “He is a monk” means he is a mendicant who has gone forth from the household life into homelessness and who is a holder of the monastic code and who is a holder of the discourses and who is a holder of the Vinaya and who is a holder of the Mātṛkā and who is a holder of the Abhidharma and who is a holder of the five branches of knowledge.

original: dul ba dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang bcas pas so //
analyzed: dul ba dang bcas pas zhes bya ba ni 'dun pa dang bcas pas so //
translated: “He is a monk” means he is a mendicant who has gone forth from the household life into homelessness and who is a holder of the monastic code and who is a holder of the

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni chags pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The so-called roots of virtue are the absence of attachment, etc.

original: smon lam gyi dbang gis shes bya ba ni smon lam gyi rgyus so //
analyzed: smon lam gyi dbang gis shes bya ba ni smon lam gyi rgyus so //
translated: By the power of vows means by the cause of vows.

original: bskal pa bzang po zhes bya ba ni dus kyi phye brag ste /
analyzed: bskal pa bzang po zhes bya ba ni dus kyi phye brag ste /
translated: The so-called Fortunate Aeon is a division of time.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga brgya 'byung ba'i phyir bzang ba yin no //🔽ston pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa lnga brgya 'byung ba'i phyir bzang ba yin no // ston pa zhes bya ba ni ji lta ba bzhin du ston pa'i phyir ram /
translated: It is fortunate because five hundred Tathagatas appear.

original: gtan du ston pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: gtan du ston pa'i phyir ro//
translated: The so-called Teacher is so called because he teaches as it really is, or because he teaches permanently.

original: kha cig na re gzhan gyi don la shes pas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ston pa yod pa'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig na re gzhan gyi don la shes pas brtson pa'i mtshan nyid kyi ston pa yod pa'i phyir rgyu la 'bras bu btags pa ste /
translated: Some say that the effect is figuratively used for the cause, because the Teacher exists who is characterized by striving with knowledge for the benefit of others.

original: gzhan gyi don shes brtson pa ste //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don shes brtson pa ste //
translated: He is the one who strives with knowledge for the benefit of others.

original: de'i phyir thugs brtse ston pa yin //
analyzed: de'i phyir thugs brtse ston pa yin //
translated: Therefore, he is the compassionate Teacher.

original: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa'i phyir ro zhes zer ro /
translated: This is explained.

original: ston pa ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: ston pa ji lta bu zhig ce na de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: What kind of Teacher? Therefore, he says the Tathagata, etc.

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum dang / mi slob pa'i lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i spyod pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa'i rig pa gsum dang / mi slob pa'i lus kyi sdom pa dang / ngag gi sdom pa dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba'i spyod pa dag dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessed of knowledge and good conduct means that he is endowed with the three knowledges of the adept, the restraint of the body of the adept, the restraint of speech of the adept, and the conduct of right livelihood.

original: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni kun du gzigs pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mdzes pas gshegs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni kun du gzigs pa la sogs pa'i spyod pa mdzes pas gshegs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Well-Gone means that he is endowed with the going of one who has seen all, etc.

original: kha cig na re bkra shis pa dang / yang mi ldog pa dang / ma lus par shes pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: kha cig na re bkra shis pa dang / yang mi ldog pa dang / ma lus par shes pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Some say: because of the auspiciousness, the non-return, and the complete knowledge, or

original: de kho na nyid dang / brtan pa nyid dang / lhag ma med pa'i bye brag mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang zer ro /
analyzed: de kho na nyid dang / brtan pa nyid dang / lhag ma med pa'i bye brag mkhyen pa'i phyir ro zhes kyang zer ro /
translated: because of the knowledge of the distinctions of reality, stability, and the absence of remainder.

original: 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhyen pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Knower of the world means

original: sems can 'khor ba thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can 'khor ba thugs su chud pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of his understanding of the world of sentient beings.

original: kha cig na re 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig na re 'jig rten zhes bya ba ni nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga la sogs pa'o //
translated: Some say: the world is the five appropriative aggregates, etc.

original: de dag @235b mkhyen pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa ste /
analyzed: de dag @235b mkhyen pa ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa ni ji lta ba bzhin du mkhyen pa ste /
translated: His knowledge of these is knowledge of impermanence, etc., just as it is.

original: thugs su chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
analyzed: thugs su chud ces bya ba'i tha tshig go zhes zer ro //
translated: The phrase “he has realized” means “he has known.”

original: skyes bu 'dul pa'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub ba pa dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi 'dul ba rnam pa gsum gyis 'dul ba skyes bu lta bu dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: skyes bu 'dul pa'i kha lo sgyur ba bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni 'jam pa dang / rtsub ba pa dang / gnyi ga'i rang bzhin gyi 'dul ba rnam pa gsum gyis 'dul ba skyes bu lta bu dag phyin ci ma log par 'dul ba mdzad pa'i phyir ro /
translated: He is the unsurpassed trainer and tamer of persons to be trained means that he is the trainer of those who are like persons to be trained, because he trains them in the three kinds of training gentle, harsh, and both and because he trains them without error.

original: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lha dang mi rnams kyi ston pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du bden pa ston par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the teacher of gods and humans means that he is the teacher of gods and humans because he teaches the truth just as it is.

original: nyi tshe ba'i ston pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i ston pa ni ma yin te /
translated: He is not a partial teacher,

original: 'di ltar mi dang / lha dang bcas pa'i ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi dang / lha dang bcas pa'i ston pa yin te /
translated: because he is the teacher of gods and humans.

original: ji skad du dge slong dag nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa gsal ba ram par phye ba rgyur ba bcad pa ni lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du dge slong dag nga'i chos 'dul ba legs par gsungs pa gsal ba ram par phye ba rgyur ba bcad pa ni lha dang mi'i bar dag la yang dag par rab tu bstan to zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: As it is said, “Monks, my Dharma and Vinaya is well-proclaimed, clear, open, free of patchwork, and is taught with its source revealed to gods and humans.”

original: 'od srungs zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs kyi rigs las 'khrungs pa'i phyir ro zhes sgra grags so zhes bya ba ni sgra grags pa'o //
analyzed: 'od srungs zhes bya ba ni 'od srungs kyi rigs las 'khrungs pa'i phyir ro zhes sgra grags so zhes bya ba ni sgra grags pa'o //
translated: “Kāśyapa” is a well-known name, because he was born into the Kāśyapa family.

original: 'jig rten du byung ste zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba thams cad du byung ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten du byung ste zhes bya ba ni khams gsum pa'i 'gro ba thams cad du byung ba'o //
translated: “Appeared in the world” means he appeared in all the realms of the three realms.

original: bstan pa la zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa nye bar bstan pa dang ldan pa bstan pa'i chos la'o //
analyzed: bstan pa la zhes bya ba ni phan pa dang gnod pa nye bar bstan pa dang ldan pa bstan pa'i chos la'o //
translated: “In the teaching” means in the teaching of the Dharma, which is a teaching that is endowed with the demonstration of benefit and harm.

original: yon gnas zhes bya ba ni yod dul bar 'os pa'o //
analyzed: yon gnas zhes bya ba ni yod dul bar 'os pa'o //
translated: “Worthy of offerings” means worthy of being tamed.

original: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog go //
analyzed: bla na med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog go //
translated: “Unsurpassed” means the best of all sentient beings.

original: bral ze'i khye'u bla ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bram ze'i khye'u bla ma rab tu byung ba'i gtam ni gzung 'di nyid las 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: bral ze'i khye'u bla ma la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la bram ze'i khye'u bla ma rab tu byung ba'i gtam ni gzung 'di nyid las 'og nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: The story of the young brahmin Uttara who went forth is found in this very text, below.

original: sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na grong khyer du gshegs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: sh'akya thub pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpar gyur pa na grong khyer du gshegs pa'i tshe /
translated: Shakyamuni means that when he was a bodhisattva, when he entered the city,

original: sha kya gtum po rnams thub pa dag bzhin du 'khod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sha kya gtum po rnams thub pa dag bzhin du 'khod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: the Shakya people sat like sages,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi tshig mi gsung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or because he did not speak defiled words.

original: sha kya'i seng ge zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sha kya'i seng ge zhes bya ba la /
translated: As for Shakya Lion,

original: sha kya zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i rgud yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sha kya zhes bya ba ni mang pos bkur ba'i rgud yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Shakya means he is of the Shakya clan,

original: seng ge zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: seng ge zhes bya ba ni mi 'jigs pa bzhis bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: and lion means he is fearless due to the four fearlessnesses.

original: seng ge bzhin du bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ste /
analyzed: seng ge bzhin du bsnyengs pa mi mnga' ba ste /
translated: He is fearless like a lion,

original: mu stegs can gyi ri dags kyi tshogs ma lus pa skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi ri dags kyi tshogs ma lus pa skrag par mdzad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he terrifies the entire herd of non-Buddhist deer.

original: sha kya'i rgyal po gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sha kya'i rgyal po gang dag yin pa de dag gi gtso bo ste /
analyzed: sha kya'i rgyal po gtso bo zhes bya ba ni sha kya'i rgyal po gang dag yin pa de dag gi gtso bo ste /
translated: The chief of the Shakyas is the chief of the Shakyas.

original: chos kyi rje yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi rje yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He is the lord of the Dharma.

original: rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i @236a * //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul che ba zhes bya ba ni nyan thos thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'i rdzu 'phrul dang ldan pa'i @236a * //
translated: He has great spiritual powers because he possesses spiritual powers that are superior to all the disciples.

analyzed: phyir ro // mthu che ba zhes bya ba ni bsod nams dang ldan pa'o // byams pa'i bdag nyid can zhes bya ba ni byams pa thob pa'o //
translated: He has great might because he possesses merit.🔽He is of a loving nature because he has attained love.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje thog pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni snying rje thog pa'o //
translated: He is compassionate because he has attained compassion.

original: sems can la byams pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o ;
analyzed: sems can la byams pa zhes bya ba ni byams pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o ;
translated: He is loving toward sentient beings because he possesses the intention to love.

original: ; nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang / nor nyams pa ste /
analyzed: ; nyon mongs pa zhes bya ba ni yon tan dang / nor nyams pa ste /
translated: He is afflicted means that his qualities and wealth have declined.

original: dbul po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dbul po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He is poor means that he is destitute.

original: tshegs chen pos zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bas so //
analyzed: tshegs chen pos zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal bas so //
translated: With great difficulty means with suffering.

original: 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs so //
analyzed: 'tsho ba zhes bya ba ni 'tsho ba'i thabs so //
translated: “Livelihood” is the means of livelihood.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di ltar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba ni rnam pa 'di ltar ro //
translated: “In this way” means in this manner.
