analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba don du gnyer ba'o //
translated: “Desiring to go forth” means seeking to go forth.

original: rgyun chad cing dus la bab ces bya ba ni ris mthun pa spangs pas shi ba yin gyi skad cig gis zhig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyun chad cing dus la bab ces bya ba ni ris mthun pa spangs pas shi ba yin gyi skad cig gis zhig pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: “The continuum is severed and the time has come” means that death occurs through the abandonment of the class affiliate, not through momentary destruction.

original: kye ma zhes bya ba ni thugs brtse ba'o //
analyzed: kye ma zhes bya ba ni thugs brtse ba'o //
translated: “Alas” expresses compassion.

original: dge 'dun thams cad ces bya ba'i tshig ni dkyil 'khor sa phyogs gcig gi dge 'dun 'dus pa dgag pa'i don to //
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad ces bya ba'i tshig ni dkyil 'khor sa phyogs gcig gi dge 'dun 'dus pa dgag pa'i don to //
translated: The phrase “the entire saṅgha” means the saṅgha that has gathered in one place within the maṇḍala.

original: 'di skad bstan te mtshams de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa de dag thams cad las kyis gnas der lhags pa yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te mtshams de na dge slong ji snyed gnas pa de dag thams cad las kyis gnas der lhags pa yin pas de'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad ces bya ba'o //
translated: This is explained as follows: Since all the bhikṣus who dwell within that maṇḍala have come to that place through karma, they are called “the entire saṅgha.”

original: 'dus pa na zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa na'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa na zhes bya ba ni tshogs pa na'o //
translated: “When they have gathered” means when they have assembled.

original: cha lugs 'di bzhin byas zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa des /
analyzed: cha lugs 'di bzhin byas zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa des /
translated: The phrase having assumed this sort of appearance means that the person who desires to go forth and be fully ordained

original: chos 'di pa'i rab tu 'byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i cha lugs ci 'dra ba de bzhin byas pa ste /
analyzed: chos 'di pa'i rab tu 'byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i cha lugs ci 'dra ba de bzhin byas pa ste /
translated: has assumed the appearance of a Buddhist going forth and being fully ordained.

original: gang gi skra dang / kha spu dag bregs shing chos gos gsum ba gos par gyur pa de'i tshe na /🔽cha lugs 'di bzhin byas zhes bya ba'o //🔽rgan rims la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rabs gnyis te /🔽gzhon rims dang / rgan rims yod pas /
analyzed: gang gi skra dang / kha spu dag bregs shing chos gos gsum ba gos par gyur pa de'i tshe na / cha lugs 'di bzhin byas zhes bya ba'o // rgan rims la zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la rabs gnyis te / gzhon rims dang / rgan rims yod pas /
translated: When he has shaved off his hair and beard and has put on the three robes, at that time he has assumed this sort of appearance.🔽The phrase having bowed down to the feet of the elder monks means that he has bowed down to the feet of the elder monks.🔽The community of monks is divided into two groups: the younger monks and the elder monks.

original: dge slong rgan pa rnams kyi rabs ni rgan rims te /🔽der phyag 'tshal du bcug ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽thal mo sbyar nas zhes bya ba ni de thal mo sbyor ba'i tshul dang ldan par byas nas so //
analyzed: dge slong rgan pa rnams kyi rabs ni rgan rims te / der phyag 'tshal du bcug ste zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // thal mo sbyar nas zhes bya ba ni de thal mo sbyor ba'i tshul dang ldan par byas nas so //
translated: The group of elder monks is called the elders.🔽 The phrase having bowed down to the feet of the elders means that he has bowed down to the feet of the elder monks.🔽The phrase having placed his upper robe over one shoulder means that he has placed his upper robe over his left shoulder in the manner in which a monk wears his robes.🔽The phrase having placed his right knee on the ground means that he has placed his right knee on the ground.🔽The phrase having made añjali the proper way means that he has made añjali in the proper manner.

original: tsog tsog por 'dug tu bcug ste zhes bya ba ni tsog pus 'dug tu bcug pa ste /
analyzed: tsog tsog por 'dug tu bcug ste zhes bya ba ni tsog pus 'dug tu bcug pa ste /
translated: The phrase having sat down in the position of a supplicant means that he has sat down in the position of a supplicant.

original: stan la mi gzhag par pus mo gnyis gyen du tsog tsog por byung bas 'dug tu bcug ste'o //
analyzed: stan la mi gzhag par pus mo gnyis gyen du tsog tsog por byung bas 'dug tu bcug ste'o //
translated: He should not sit on a seat, but should sit squatting with his two knees raised.

original: lan gsum gsol ba 'debs su bcug nas zhes @236b bya ba ni gsol ba gdab pa'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba 'di lan gsum zlos su bcug nas te /
analyzed: lan gsum gsol ba 'debs su bcug nas zhes @236b bya ba ni gsol ba gdab pa'i tshig 'og nas 'byung ba 'di lan gsum zlos su bcug nas te /
translated: Having had him repeat the petition three times means that he should have him repeat three times the words of the petition that will be given below.

original: rang gi don du sngags brjod pa thams cad ni lan gsum du bzlas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi don du sngags brjod pa thams cad ni lan gsum du bzlas so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is said that all the recitations of the mantra for one’s own benefit are to be repeated three times.

original: gsol ba byas te las bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis cig car rab tu 'byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen pa nye bar bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsol ba byas te las bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis cig car rab tu 'byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen pa nye bar bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: Having petitioned, the rite should be performed means that the rite of petition and four proclamations is to be performed simultaneously to accomplish the going forth and the full ordination.

original: las gang la las brjod pa gsum dang / gsol ba dang bzhi byed pa de ni /
analyzed: las gang la las brjod pa gsum dang / gsol ba dang bzhi byed pa de ni /
translated: The rite in which the proclamation of the motion and the proclamation of the four proclamations are performed

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las yin no //
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las yin no //
translated: is the rite of petition and four proclamations.

original: 'di skad brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni lan gsum gsol ba 'debs su gzhug pa'i tshig yin no ;
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni lan gsum gsol ba 'debs su gzhug pa'i tshig yin no ;
translated: This is what should be said means the words for having him repeat the petition three times.

original: ; dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni spyi la phod pa'o //
analyzed: ; dge 'dun zhes bya ba ni spyi la phod pa'o //
translated: The community is the general refuge.

original: btsun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni so so nas sems gtod du gzhug pa'i phyir bod pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa rnams zhes bya ba ni so so nas sems gtod du gzhug pa'i phyir bod pa'o //
translated: The venerable ones are addressed individually in order to attract their attention.

original: gsan du gsol ba zhes bya ba ni rna ba gtod cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsan du gsol ba zhes bya ba ni rna ba gtod cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Listen! means pay attention!

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nye bar ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nye bar ston par byed pa'o //
translated: I, named so-and-so, indicates the person himself.

original: thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dge 'dun ni sdug bsngal gyi 'dam du bying ba rnams yongs su skyob par mdzad pa de'i phyir thugs brtse ba can yin no //
analyzed: thugs brtse ba zhes bya ba ni gang gi phyir dge 'dun ni sdug bsngal gyi 'dam du bying ba rnams yongs su skyob par mdzad pa de'i phyir thugs brtse ba can yin no //
translated: Compassionate ones means that the community is compassionate because it rescues those who are sunk in the mire of suffering.

original: thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni thugs brtse ba sngon du btang nas te /
analyzed: thugs brtse ba'i slad du zhes bya ba ni thugs brtse ba sngon du btang nas te /
translated: Out of compassion means having compassion beforehand.

original: lan du phan 'dogs pa'i blos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lan du phan 'dogs pa'i blos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that it is not with the intention of getting something in return.

original: bdag ces bya ba ni sdom pa 'dod pa nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: bdag ces bya ba ni sdom pa 'dod pa nyid du bstan to //
translated: The word I indicates the desire for the vow.

original: rab tu 'byung du gsol /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung du gsol /
translated: Please let me go forth means

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par mdzad du gsol zhes bya bas ni dge 'dun la bskul ba bstan to //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par mdzad du gsol zhes bya bas ni dge 'dun la bskul ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase please admit me to full ordination indicates the request to the community.

original: gsol ba byas te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la go bar byas ste'o //
analyzed: gsol ba byas te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun la go bar byas ste'o //
translated: The phrase having made the request means having informed the community.

original: las bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las bya ba'o //
analyzed: las bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang / bzhi'i las bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase the rite means the rite of request and the rite of four proclamations.

original: dus la bab cing zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i tshul yin zhing ngo //
analyzed: dus la bab cing zhes bya ba ni rigs pa'i tshul yin zhing ngo //
translated: The phrase if the time is right means if it is the proper way.

original: bzod na zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i rigs pa'i tshul yin par gnang na ste /
analyzed: bzod na zhes bya ba ni rab tu byung ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i rigs pa'i tshul yin par gnang na ste /
translated: The phrase if you agree means if you approve of the proper way of going forth and being admitted to full ordination.

original: 'dod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dod na zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase if you desire means if you wish.

original: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang zhes bya ba ni rigs par gnang na de'i phyir dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig dang zhes bya ba ni rigs par gnang na de'i phyir dge 'dun gyis gnang bar mdzod cig ces bya ba ste /
translated: The phrase may the community grant it means if you approve of the proper way, then for that reason may the community grant it.

original: 'dis ni lam byed pa go bar bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni lam byed pa go bar bstan to //
translated: This indicates the understanding of the performance of the rite.

original: bzod pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa de dag ni'o //
analyzed: bzod pa de dag ni zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa de dag ni'o //
translated: The phrase those who agree means those who desire.

original: cang ma gsung shig ces bya ba ni cang mi smra bas dang du long shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: cang ma gsung shig ces bya ba ni cang mi smra bas dang du long shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Do not say anything means accept it by remaining silent.

original: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni @237a * //
analyzed: gang dag mi bzod pa de dag ni @237a * //
translated: Those who do not accept it should say,

original: gsungs shig ces bya ba ni gang dag mi 'dod pa de dag gis ni mi rung ngo zhes gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsungs shig ces bya ba ni gang dag mi 'dod pa de dag gis ni mi rung ngo zhes gyis shig ces bya ba'o //
translated: Those who do not want it should say, It is not suitable.

original: las brjod pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi skabs kyi don brjod pa ste /
analyzed: las brjod pa zhes bya ba ni las kyi skabs kyi don brjod pa ste /
translated: The expression karma means the expression of the meaning of the occasion of the karma.

original: bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bzlas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means recitation.

original: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'i tha tshig yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis bzod cing gnang nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni mjug bsdu ba'i tha tshig yin no //
translated: The expression if the saṅgha accepts and allows and so on is the conclusion.

original: de ni sngon gyi cho ga'o zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi cho ga bas sngar cho ga rigs pa rnam pa de lta bu byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ni sngon gyi cho ga'o zhes bya ba ni da ltar gyi cho ga bas sngar cho ga rigs pa rnam pa de lta bu byung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The expression that is the ancient procedure means before the present procedure, there was a procedure of that kind which was reasonable.

original: 'dir la la dag 'di skad ces /
analyzed: 'dir la la dag 'di skad ces /
translated: Here, some say this:

original: gal te sngon gyi cho gas rab tu 'byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos po bsgrub par 'gyur na ni da ltar gyi cho gas ci bya /
analyzed: gal te sngon gyi cho gas rab tu 'byung ba dang rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba'i rgyu'i dngos po bsgrub par 'gyur na ni da ltar gyi cho gas ci bya /
translated: If the former rite were the cause for going forth and for receiving full ordination, then what would be the point of the present rite?

original: gal te da ltar gyi cho ga kho nas rgyu'i dngos po sgrub par 'gyur na yang /
analyzed: gal te da ltar gyi cho ga kho nas rgyu'i dngos po sgrub par 'gyur na yang /
translated: If the present rite alone were the cause for going forth and for receiving full ordination,

original: sngon gyi cho gas ci bya ste /
analyzed: sngon gyi cho gas ci bya ste /
translated: then what would be the point of the former rite?

original: gcig kho nas bya ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gcig kho nas bya ba'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because the rite would be performed only once.

original: de la nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in this.

original: gnyi ga yang rgyu'i dngos po sgrub par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
analyzed: gnyi ga yang rgyu'i dngos po sgrub par 'gyur ba yin mod kyi /
translated: Both rites are causes for going forth and for receiving full ordination.

original: 'on kyang gdul ba'i sems can gyi bye brag las cho ga gnyis rnam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: 'on kyang gdul ba'i sems can gyi bye brag las cho ga gnyis rnam par bzhag ste /
translated: However, the two rites are presented in terms of the specific beings to be trained.

original: 'di ltar dang po mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus kyi tshe na ni sems can rnam par dag pa sha stag byung bas gdul ba'i rim pa la mi ltos shing mkhan po dang / slob dpon la sogs pa la ma ltos par tshegs chung du kho nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar dang po mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa'i dus kyi tshe na ni sems can rnam par dag pa sha stag byung bas gdul ba'i rim pa la mi ltos shing mkhan po dang / slob dpon la sogs pa la ma ltos par tshegs chung du kho nas /
translated: Thus, at the time of the Buddha’s original enlightenment, only pure beings existed. Therefore, the rite did not depend on the stages of training, and without relying on a preceptor, an instructor, and so on, they went forth and received full ordination with little difficulty.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' rdzogs par byed pa dang / de dag bsod nams byas pa yin pas nad med pa dang / ci ste de dag las nad cig 'byung du zin na yang de dag gis nad g-yog la sogs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' rdzogs par byed pa dang / de dag bsod nams byas pa yin pas nad med pa dang / ci ste de dag las nad cig 'byung du zin na yang de dag gis nad g-yog la sogs pa rnyed par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because they are the ones who complete the Bhagavat's teachings, and because they have made merit, they are free from illness. And if any of them should become ill, they will find nurses, etc.

original: de ltar ni de lta bu'i rgyud rnam par dag pa dag med pas des na da ltar gyi cho ga rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: de ltar ni de lta bu'i rgyud rnam par dag pa dag med pas des na da ltar gyi cho ga rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Thus, because they are not of such a pure lineage, they are established as present-day monks.

original: mkhan po dang slob dpon med pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i phyir de dag la mkhan po dang slob dpon med pas so //
analyzed: mkhan po dang slob dpon med pas zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun gyis rab tu byung zhing rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i phyir de dag la mkhan po dang slob dpon med pas so //
translated: Because they have no preceptor or teacher means that they have no preceptor or teacher because they are ordained and fully admitted into the monastic life by the Saṅgha.

original: legs par ma sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni sham thabs legs par ma sbyangs pa'o //
analyzed: legs par ma sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ni sham thabs legs par ma sbyangs pa'o //
translated: Not well trained means not well trained in the lower robe.

original: legs par ma bgos la zhes bya ba ni stod kyi chos gos legs par ma bgos so //
analyzed: legs par ma bgos la zhes bya ba ni stod kyi chos gos legs par ma bgos so //
translated: Not well covered means not well covered by the upper robe.

original: sgra mthon po zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig gi rgyun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra mthon po zhes bya ba ni sgra gcig gi rgyun 'byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Loud sound means because they emit a continuous sound.

original: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni sgra mang po dag 'byin pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang sgra mthon po zhes bya ba ni sgra'i gsang @237b mthon pos so //
analyzed: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni sgra mang po dag 'byin pa'i phyir ro // yang sgra mthon po zhes bya ba ni sgra'i gsang @237b mthon pos so //
translated: “Loudly” means with many sounds.🔽“Loudly” means with a loud voice.

original: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni ku co'i sgras so //
analyzed: sgra chen po zhes bya ba ni ku co'i sgras so //
translated: “Loudly” means with a loud noise.

original: rgod bag gi spyod lam gyis zhes bya ba ni nye bar ma zhi bar 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa'i bya bas so //
analyzed: rgod bag gi spyod lam gyis zhes bya ba ni nye bar ma zhi bar 'gro ba dang ldog pa la sogs pa'i bya bas so //
translated: “With a frivolous manner” means with an unpeaceful manner of going and returning, and so on.

original: khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag gi mchod ston nam khyim bdag gi rje dpon dag gi gan du'o //
analyzed: khyim bdag gi khyim dag tu zhes bya ba ni khyim bdag gi mchod ston nam khyim bdag gi rje dpon dag gi gan du'o //
translated: “In the houses of householders” means in the houses of householders who are giving a feast, or in the houses of householders who are the masters of the feast.

original: bstan pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa dang 'gal ba zhes bya ba ni bstan pa dang mi mthun pa'o //
translated: “Contradicting the teaching” means acting in a way that is not in accordance with the teaching.

original: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gshe ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pa'o //🔽sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma nyid du khas blangs pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag ces bya ba ni gshe ba dang rdeg pa la sogs pa'o // sh'akya'i bu'i dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma nyid du khas blangs pa ste /
translated: “Others” means those who scold, beat, and so on.🔽“Śākya-son monks” means disciples of the Blessed One.

original: chos kyi sras nyid du nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sras nyid du nye bar btags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they are designated as spiritual sons of the Buddha.

original: mgo reg ces bya ba ni gtsug phud bregs pas nye du rnams kyis nye du'i gral nas phyung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mgo reg ces bya ba ni gtsug phud bregs pas nye du rnams kyis nye du'i gral nas phyung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The term shaven-headed one means that they are expelled from the ranks of their relatives because they have shaved their topknot.

original: 'jig rten nas smad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten nas smad pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means despised by the world.

original: bsod snyoms zhes bya ba ni zas so //
analyzed: bsod snyoms zhes bya ba ni zas so //
translated: Alms means food.

original: sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni g-yos byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su gtang ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa zhes bya ba ni g-yos byas pa'i ngo bo nyid yongs su gtang ba'o //
translated: Giving means giving up the nature of what is prepared.

original: bya ba zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir g-yos gzhan bya ba'o //🔽smod par byed ces bya ba ni ming nas 'byin cing nyes pa sgrogs pa'o //🔽phyar ka gtong bar byed ces bya ba ni gzhogs kyis snyad 'dogs pas so //
analyzed: bya ba zhes bya ba ni de'i phyir g-yos gzhan bya ba'o // smod par byed ces bya ba ni ming nas 'byin cing nyes pa sgrogs pa'o // phyar ka gtong bar byed ces bya ba ni gzhogs kyis snyad 'dogs pas so //
translated: Work means preparing something else for that purpose.🔽They disparage means they expel them by name and proclaim their faults.🔽They slander means they slander them by implication.

original: kha zer bar byed ces bya ba ni spyo bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha zer bar byed ces bya ba ni spyo bar byed pa'o //
translated: They speak ill of them means they revile them.

original: gcig gis gcig bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha dang bu'i tha snyad kyis gcig gis gcig la byams pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig gis gcig bsdu ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni pha dang bu'i tha snyad kyis gcig gis gcig la byams pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to gather them together means in order to generate mutual affection through the conventions of father and son.

original: dge tshul gyi slob dpon zhes bya ba ni dge tshul gyi sdom pa byin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge tshul gyi slob dpon zhes bya ba ni dge tshul gyi sdom pa byin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “novice master” is so called because he bestows the novice vows.

original: skyabs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: skyabs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “goes for refuge” is explained as follows.

original: skyabs zhes bya ba ni 'dir thar pa dang / lam thob par bya ba'i rten du gyur pa dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba'i dngos po'o //🔽skyabs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni skyabs de la skyabs su 'gro ba ste /
analyzed: skyabs zhes bya ba ni 'dir thar pa dang / lam thob par bya ba'i rten du gyur pa dkon mchog gsum zhes bya ba'i dngos po'o // skyabs su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni skyabs de la skyabs su 'gro ba ste /
translated: The term “refuge” refers to the Three Jewels, which are the support for attaining liberation and the path.

original: skyabs su 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs su 'jug pa'o //
translated: The phrase “goes for refuge” means to go to that refuge, to enter that refuge.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi dag ces bya ba la /
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi dag ces bya ba la /
translated: The phrase “the bases of the training” is explained as follows.

original: bslab pa zhes bya ba ni bslab par bya bas bslab pa ste /
analyzed: bslab pa zhes bya ba ni bslab par bya bas bslab pa ste /
translated: The term “training” is so called because it is what is to be trained in.

original: nyon mongs pa sbong pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa sbong pa'o //
translated: It is the abandonment of the afflictions.

original: gzhi dag ces bya ba ni gnas dang rten ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gzhi dag ces bya ba ni gnas dang rten ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: The term “bases” means the basis and the support.

original: 'di ltar de la rnam par gnas na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de la rnam par gnas na mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir te /
translated: Thus, it is because one who abides in that training attains nirvana.

original: ji skad du /🔽mkhas pa tshul la gnas byas te //
analyzed: ji skad du / mkhas pa tshul la gnas byas te //
translated: As it is said:🔽The wise abide in the training

original: sems dang shes rab sgom byed pa //
analyzed: sems dang shes rab sgom byed pa //
translated: and cultivate the mind and wisdom.

original: brtun ldan rtag tu 'khrud byed pa'i //
analyzed: brtun ldan rtag tu 'khrud byed pa'i //
translated: The monk who is always diligent and pure

original: dge slong sdug bsngal zad pa 'thob //🔽ces @238a * //
analyzed: dge slong sdug bsngal zad pa 'thob // ces @238a * //
translated: attains the end of suffering.

original: tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is stated in verse.

original: yang na bsla par bya ba'i gzhi ni bslab pa'i gzhi ste /
analyzed: yang na bsla par bya ba'i gzhi ni bslab pa'i gzhi ste /
translated: Or, the basis of training is the basis of training.

original: srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa spong ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: It is the avoidance of killing and so on.

original: gsang ste ston pa zhes bya ba ni dben pa stong pa'i phyogs su bar chad kyi chos dri ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsang ste ston pa zhes bya ba ni dben pa stong pa'i phyogs su bar chad kyi chos dri ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The term secretly taught means in a secluded, empty place, in order to ask about the factors that are obstacles.

original: gsang ste bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gsang ste bstan pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term secretly revealed means

original: dben par bkar te bar chad kyi chos dris pa'o //
analyzed: dben par bkar te bar chad kyi chos dris pa'o //
translated: in a secluded place, in order to ask about the factors that are obstacles.

original: las byed pa zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i tshe gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byas pa'o //
analyzed: las byed pa zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i tshe gsol ba dang bzhi'i las byas pa'o //
translated: The term action done means the four-part ceremony of full ordination, which is done by request.

original: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya ba ni bya ba gang la las brjod pa gsum dang / gsol ba dang bzhi byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya ba ni bya ba gang la las brjod pa gsum dang / gsol ba dang bzhi byed pa'o //
translated: The term four-part ceremony of request means the ceremony in which the three announcements and the four-part ceremony are done for the action.

original: gnas sbyin pa'i slob dpon zhes bya ba ni gnas sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: gnas sbyin pa'i slob dpon zhes bya ba ni gnas sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: The term master who gives the place means the one who gives the place.

original: de la gnas pas dge ba'i tshogs 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la gnas pas dge ba'i tshogs 'phel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the accumulation of virtue increases by abiding in that.

original: zhag gcig tsam yang gnas pas 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams gcig gi nang du gnas gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: zhag gcig tsam yang gnas pas 'dug pa zhes bya ba ni mtshams gcig gi nang du gnas gcig pa nyid kyi phyir /
translated: One who abides even for one day is called a resident because of being in one place within one boundary.

original: zhag gcig tsam yang de'i drung du 'dug ste /
analyzed: zhag gcig tsam yang de'i drung du 'dug ste /
translated: One who abides even for one day in his presence.

original: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtha' bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: yang zhes bya ba'i sgra ni mtha' bstan pa yin no //
translated: The word also indicates the limit.

original: klog pa'i slob dpon zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag gi tshig klog tu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: klog pa'i slob dpon zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag gi tshig klog tu 'jug pa'o //
translated: The reading master means one who makes one read the words of the scriptures.

original: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang lan gsum bzlas te /
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang lan gsum bzlas te /
translated: Even a four-line verse, recited three times,

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: is called to be upheld.

original: tshig bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhung gang na tshig bzhi yod pa ste /
analyzed: tshig bzhi zhes bya ba ni gzhung gang na tshig bzhi yod pa ste /
translated: Four lines refers to any text that has four lines.

original: dper na / sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
analyzed: dper na / sdig pa thams cad mi bya ste //
translated: For example, Do not commit any evil,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gcig pa yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gcig pa yin /
translated: is one line.

original: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
analyzed: dge ba phun sum tshogs par bya //
translated: Completely perfect virtue,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gnyis pa yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gnyis pa yin /
translated: is the second line.

original: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
analyzed: rang gi sems ni yongs su gdul //
translated: Fully tame one's own mind,

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum pa yin /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig gsum pa yin /
translated: is the third line.

original: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
analyzed: 'di ni sangs rgyas bstan pa yin //
translated: This is the teaching of the Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba ni tshig bzhi pa yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni tshig bzhi pa yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: This is an example of a four-line verse.

original: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni de'i tshad dang mnyam pa'i gzhung rkyang pa'i dpe yin par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa 'di ni de'i tshad dang mnyam pa'i gzhung rkyang pa'i dpe yin par bstan pa'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: The verse “a verse is a composition of four lines” is stated to show that this is an example of a composition of the same length as a verse.

original: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang rung /
analyzed: tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa yang rung /
translated: A four-line verse is a composition of four lines.

original: de dang tshad mnyam pa tsam gyis gzhung rkyang pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de dang tshad mnyam pa tsam gyis gzhung rkyang pa yang rung ngo zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: A composition of the same length as that is also a verse.

original: 'dir de gnyi ga yang gtsug lag gi gzhung yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir de gnyi ga yang gtsug lag gi gzhung yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, both of these should be understood as scriptural compositions.

original: lan gsum bzlas te zhes bya ba ni lan gcig dang / lan gnyis kyis ni bzlas pa'i mthar phyin kyang /
analyzed: lan gsum bzlas te zhes bya ba ni lan gcig dang / lan gnyis kyis ni bzlas pa'i mthar phyin kyang /
translated: “Recited three times” means that if it is recited once or twice, the recitation is not completed.

original: rdzogs pa ma yin @238b pas slob dpon du mi 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rdzogs pa ma yin @238b pas slob dpon du mi 'gyur gyi /
translated: One does not become a master.

original: lan gsum bzlas na /
analyzed: lan gsum bzlas na /
translated: But if it is recited three times,

original: de ni klog pa mthar thug pa yin pas des na slob dpon du gyur pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni klog pa mthar thug pa yin pas des na slob dpon du gyur pa yin no //
translated: that recitation is completed. Therefore, one becomes a master.

original: de ltar yang bcom brlag tu yang dag par sdud pa las kyang klog pa'i slob dpon gang zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar yang bcom brlag tu yang dag par sdud pa las kyang klog pa'i slob dpon gang zhe na /
translated: What is a teacher of reading?

original: gang las tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang lan gsum bzlas te /
analyzed: gang las tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa tsam yang lan gsum bzlas te /
translated: One who recites three times the four line verse

original: bzung ba yin no zhes 'byung la /
analyzed: bzung ba yin no zhes 'byung la /
translated: and one who recites it is a teacher of reading.

original: da ltar gyi gtsug lag las kyang de skad 'byung bas sngon gyi 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gi lugs mthun te /
analyzed: da ltar gyi gtsug lag las kyang de skad 'byung bas sngon gyi 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gi lugs mthun te /
translated: This is stated in the present treatises and accords with the system of past upholders of the vinaya.

original: tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / de tsam gyi gzhung rkyang pa yan chad nas /
analyzed: tha na tshig bzhi pa'i tshigs su bcad pa dang / de tsam gyi gzhung rkyang pa yan chad nas /
translated: Even if one recites three times a single verse of four lines or a single text of that length,

original: gzhung mang po mtha' yas pa'i bar dag lan gsum bzlas na de ni klog pa'i mthar thug pa yin pas /
analyzed: gzhung mang po mtha' yas pa'i bar dag lan gsum bzlas na de ni klog pa'i mthar thug pa yin pas /
translated: up to an infinite number of texts, that is the culmination of reading.

original: des na slob dpon du gyur pa yin gyi lan gnyis bzlas pas mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na slob dpon du gyur pa yin gyi lan gnyis bzlas pas mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, one becomes a teacher by that, but not by reciting it twice.

original: gzung ba zhes bya ba ni klog pa'i slob dpon gyis smras pa zlos par byed pas rjes su bzlas pa yin no //
analyzed: gzung ba zhes bya ba ni klog pa'i slob dpon gyis smras pa zlos par byed pas rjes su bzlas pa yin no //
translated: Recitation is the repetition of what the teacher of reading says.

original: klog pa'i bsam pa med pas brjod pa ni klog pa nyid ma yin pas slob dpon du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: klog pa'i bsam pa med pas brjod pa ni klog pa nyid ma yin pas slob dpon du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Since he does not have the intention to read, he is not a reader, and therefore he is not a preceptor.

original: rab tu 'byin par byed pa gang yin pa dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig gis de gnyis ka byas na yang de mkhan po yin la /
analyzed: rab tu 'byin par byed pa gang yin pa dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gang zag gcig gis de gnyis ka byas na yang de mkhan po yin la /
translated: One who gives the going forth and one who gives full ordination, even if it is done by one person, is a preceptor.

original: gang zag gnyis kyis byas na yang de gnyis ka mkhan po yin no /🔽// / bam po drug pa /
analyzed: gang zag gnyis kyis byas na yang de gnyis ka mkhan po yin no / // / bam po drug pa /
translated: If it is done by two persons, both are preceptors.

original: des zhes bya ba ni dang po'i mkhan por ma gyur pa des so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni dang po'i mkhan por ma gyur pa des so //
translated: “By him” means by the first preceptor.

original: de la bar chad kyi chos rnams dris nas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de la bar chad kyi chos rnams dris nas zhes bya ba la /
translated: “Having asked about the impediments” means

original: 'dir bar chad kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni ma bsad pa la sogs pa yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: 'dir bar chad kyi chos rnams zhes bya ba ni ma bsad pa la sogs pa yin par 'dod de /
translated: here the impediments are considered to be the killing of one’s mother and so on,

original: rab tu 'byung ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'byung ba la bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are obstacles to going forth.

original: bar chad kyi chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bar chad kyi chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: There are two kinds of impediments:

original: kha cig ni sdom pa skye ba la bar chad byed pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni sdom pa skye ba la bar chad byed pa ste /
translated: some are obstacles to the arising of vows,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: such as

original: ma bsad pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ma bsad pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as killing one's mother.

original: kha cig ni mdzes pa nyid la bar du gcod pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni mdzes pa nyid la bar du gcod pa ste /
translated: Some are obstacles to beauty,

original: 'di lta ste lag rdum la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste lag rdum la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as having a crippled arm, and so on.

original: gzhan yang bar chad kyi chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bar chad kyi chos rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, there are two kinds of obstacles to the Dharma:

original: kha cig ni lta ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni lta ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Some are forms of wrong views,

original: 'di lta ste mu stegs can ma yin nam zhes bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste mu stegs can ma yin nam zhes bstan pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: such as the question, Are you a tīrthika?

original: kha cig ni bya ba ste /
analyzed: kha cig ni bya ba ste /
translated: Some are actions,

original: 'di lta ste rgyal pos bkrabs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la @239a * //
analyzed: 'di lta ste rgyal pos bkrabs pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba la @239a * //
translated: such as the question, Are you a king's servant?

original: sogs pa'o // de dag kyang rab tu byung ba'i gzhi 'di nyid kyis bsdu bar bya ba'i skabs dang / de 'phongs pa phran tshegs la sogs pa ma gsungs pa thams cad go rims bzhin du dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'o // de dag kyang rab tu byung ba'i gzhi 'di nyid kyis bsdu bar bya ba'i skabs dang / de 'phongs pa phran tshegs la sogs pa ma gsungs pa thams cad go rims bzhin du dri bar bya'o //
translated: and so on. All of these should be asked about in order, according to the circumstances, in the context of this very basis for going forth, and all that is not mentioned should be included.

original: dris nas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dris nas yongs su dag pa la skabs dbye bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: dris nas gzung bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni dris nas yongs su dag pa la skabs dbye bar bya ba ste /
translated: Having asked, one should accept means that, having asked, one should grant permission to those who are completely pure.

original: gal te dge slong 'ga' zhig gi gan du rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa zhig 'ong zhing /
analyzed: gal te dge slong 'ga' zhig gi gan du rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa zhig 'ong zhing /
translated: If someone comes to a monk wishing to go forth,

original: rab tu 'byung bar gsol na /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar gsol na /
translated: and requests the going forth,

original: de'i tshe dge slong des de la bar chad kyi chos rnams dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe dge slong des de la bar chad kyi chos rnams dri bar bya ste /
translated: then at that time the monk should ask him about the impediments.

original: gal te bar chad de dag med na de'i 'og tu yongs su dag pa de la dang po'i mkhan por 'gyur ba nyid kyis ngas khyod rab tu dbyung ngo zhes skabs dbye zhing khas blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: gal te bar chad de dag med na de'i 'og tu yongs su dag pa de la dang po'i mkhan por 'gyur ba nyid kyis ngas khyod rab tu dbyung ngo zhes skabs dbye zhing khas blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: If he has no impediments, then after that, the monk should invite him, saying, “I will give you the going forth,” since he is the first preceptor for that one who is completely purified.

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshig 'di skad ces brjod du gzhug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni tshig 'di skad ces brjod du gzhug par bya ba'o //
translated: He should say this: this is the statement that should be uttered.

original: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
analyzed: btsun pa zhes bya ba ni bod pa'o //
translated: “Venerable” is the salutation.

original: dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba ni sems gtod cig ces bya ba'o //
analyzed: dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba ni sems gtod cig ces bya ba'o //
translated: “Please consider” means “pay attention.”

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes bya bas ni bdag nyid nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: “I, named so-and-so” is the self-introduction.

original: dus 'di nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / sdom pa len par rtsom pa'i dus 'di nas brtsams te'o //
analyzed: dus 'di nas bzung ste zhes bya ba ni dus gang gi tshe gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / sdom pa len par rtsom pa'i dus 'di nas brtsams te'o //
translated: From this time forward means from the time of beginning to go for refuge and to take up the precepts.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid ris mthun pa ma spangs kyi bar du'o //🔽rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dag dang ldan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du zhes bya ba ni ji srid ris mthun pa ma spangs kyi bar du'o // rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni rang dang gzhan gyi don phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan dag dang ldan pa'i phyir /
translated: For as long as i live means for as long as the continuity of the aggregates is not relinquished.

original: sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad las khyad par du 'phags pa'o //
translated: The supreme of bipeds means that he is superior to all sentient beings because he possesses the qualities characterized by the perfection of benefit for self and other.

original: sangs rgyas la zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa la ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la zhes bya ba ni mi slob pa la ste /
translated: Buddha means the state of no more learning,

original: sangs rgyas su byed pa zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa la'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas su byed pa zad pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa la'o //
translated: the state of the knowledge of extinction and the knowledge of nonarising that causes buddhahood.

original: skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir rten nyid du khas blang pa'o //
analyzed: skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab pa'i phyir rten nyid du khas blang pa'o //
translated: I go for refuge means i accept him as a refuge in order to be protected from suffering.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams pas zag pa med pa'i lam 'thob pa'i phyir dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir mchog go //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i lam gyi 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams pas zag pa med pa'i lam 'thob pa'i phyir dang / yongs su mi nyams pa'i phyir dang / dge ba dang rtag pa'i phyir mchog go //
translated: The phrase the best of those who are free from attachment means that the path of cultivation is the best because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the realm of desire by means of the mundane path, because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the realm of desire by means of the supramundane path, because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the higher realms by means of the supramundane path, because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the peak of cyclic existence, because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the entire realm of existence, because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the entire realm of existence by means of the supramundane path, because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the entire realm of existence by means of the mundane path, and because it is the path of those who are free from attachment to the entire realm of existence by means of the supramundane path.

original: chos la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: chos la zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The phrase the Dharma that is the best of all things means nirvana.

original: tshogs rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu ma @239b byung ba'i tshogs rnams pas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshogs rnams kyi mchog ces bya ba ni rab tu 'byung ba dang / rab tu ma @239b byung ba'i tshogs rnams pas mi phyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase the best of all assemblies means that the assembly of those who are fully ordained is the best because it is not divided.

original: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir mchog go //🔽dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni /🔽slob pa dang mi slob pa la ste /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi zhing bla na med pa yin pa'i phyir mchog go // dge 'dun la zhes bya ba ni / slob pa dang mi slob pa la ste /
translated: The phrase the best of all fields of merit means that the assembly of those who are fully ordained is the best because it is the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: dge 'dun du byed pa la'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun du byed pa la'o //
translated: The phrase the Sangha of those who are training and those who are beyond training means that the Sangha of those who are training and those who are beyond training is the best because it is the unsurpassed field of merit.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po med par sdom pa mi skye bas skyabs su 'gro bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po med par sdom pa mi skye bas skyabs su 'gro bas mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po sgrub par byed de /
translated: Thus, since one does not generate the vows without a stable thought of nirvana, going for refuge establishes a stable thought of nirvana.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam nye bar ston par mdzad pa la yang dag par rten par byed /
analyzed: rkang gnyis rnams kyi mchog sangs rgyas la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni lam nye bar ston par mdzad pa la yang dag par rten par byed /
translated: By saying “I go for refuge to the Buddha, the supreme of bipeds,” one relies on the one who teaches the path.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog chos la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par rten par byed /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi mchog chos la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni chos kyi mchog mya ngan las 'das pa la yang dag par rten par byed /
translated: By saying “I go for refuge to the Dharma, the supreme of those free from attachment,” one relies on the supreme Dharma, nirvana.

original: tshogs rnams kyi mchog dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i zla grogs la yang dag par rten par byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tshogs rnams kyi mchog dge 'dun la skyabs su mchi'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i grong khyer du 'gro ba'i zla grogs la yang dag par rten par byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: By saying “I go for refuge to the Saṅgha, the supreme of communities,” one relies on companions who go to the city of nirvana.

original: de ltar na skyabs su 'gro bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po sgrub par byed la /
analyzed: de ltar na skyabs su 'gro bas ni mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan po sgrub par byed la /
translated: Thus, one should understand that by going for refuge, one accomplishes the firm intention to attain nirvana.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan pos ni sdom pa 'thob par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa'i bsam pa brtan pos ni sdom pa 'thob par 'gyur bar shes par bya'o //

original: bdag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dge bsnyen du btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes bya ba ni dge bsnyen nyid du khas blangs pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dge bsnyen du btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes bya ba ni dge bsnyen nyid du khas blangs pa yin no //
translated: The words May the Venerable One accept me as an upasaka for as long as I live indicate the acceptance of the upasaka vow.

original: de la dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de la dge bsnyen zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Here, an upasaka is so called

original: dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir dang / bslab pa'i gzhi ji skad gsungs pa dag yongs su srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir dang / dge ba'i chos la bsnyen bkur byed pa'i phyir dang / bslab pa'i gzhi ji skad gsungs pa dag yongs su srung bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he serves the Three Jewels, because he serves virtuous dharmas, and because he guards the bases of training as they have been taught.

analyzed: btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes bya ba ni thugs su chud par mdzod cig ces bya ba'o //

analyzed: de bzhin du lan gnyis lan gsum du bzlas zhes bya ba ni lhag por ma gtogs pa rang gi don gyi sngags brjod pa ni lan gsum mo zhes 'byung bas 'dir gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba dang / dge bsnyen nyid du khas blangs pas /
translated: Since it is said that one goes for refuge three times and accepts the vows of a layperson,

original: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa sbyin pa yang lan gsum brjod dgos pas /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa sbyin pa yang lan gsum brjod dgos pas /
translated: the vows of a layperson must be given three times.

original: ji ltar brjod pa dang po sngar bstan pa de bzhin du brjod pa gnyis pa dang / brjod pa gsum pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ji ltar brjod pa dang po sngar bstan pa de bzhin du brjod pa gnyis pa dang / brjod pa gsum pa yang brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Just as the first recitation is taught above, so too the second recitation and the third recitation should be made.

original: tshig @240a * //
analyzed: tshig @240a * //

original: gsum pa la slob dpon gyis zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes bya ba de brjod pa dang po dang / gnyis pa la ni btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes brjod par bya'i brjod pa gsum pa la ni btsun pas zhes mi bya bar slob dpon gyis gzung du gsol zhes brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gsum pa la slob dpon gyis zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes bya ba de brjod pa dang po dang / gnyis pa la ni btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes brjod par bya'i brjod pa gsum pa la ni btsun pas zhes mi bya bar slob dpon gyis gzung du gsol zhes brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: The first statement is “Please accept me, Venerable,” the second statement is “Please accept me, Venerable,” but the third statement is not “Please accept me, Venerable,” but “Please accept me, Master.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /

original: de'i dus ni slob dpon du yang 'gyur la /

analyzed: brjod pa dang po dang / gnyis pa la ni dge bsnyen nyid du yang ma grub la /

analyzed: slob dpon nyid du yang ma gyur pas btsun pas gzung du gsol zhes brjod par bya'o //

analyzed: brjod pa tha ma gang yin pa'i cha gsum pa la ni dge bsnyen nyid du grub cing /

analyzed: de'i phyir khas blangs pa'i tshul gyis bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /

original: bya ba'i tshul gyis bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i tshul gyis bya'o //
translated: They should be stated by the method of injunction.

original: 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ltar bya ste zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: 'phags pa zhes bya ba ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las ring du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, noble means far from sinful unwholesome dharmas.

original: de dag gang zhe na de'i phyir dgra bcom pa de dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gang zhe na de'i phyir dgra bcom pa de dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: What are they? Therefore, it is said, those arhats.

original: des na ji ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa de dag gis sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa dang spong ba'i dgongs pas /
analyzed: des na ji ltar 'phags pa dgra bcom pa de dag gis sems can thams cad la thugs brtse ba nyid dang / sems can thams cad la dmigs pa dang spong ba'i dgongs pas /
translated: Therefore, just as the noble arhats, out of compassion for all sentient beings, and with a mind that takes all sentient beings as its object and is intent on abandoning all their suffering,

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa spangs te @241a * //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du srog gcod pa spangs te @241a * //
translated: abandon taking life for as long as they live,🔽and turn away from taking life, in the same way, I too will do likewise.

original: srog gcod pa las slar log pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang de ltar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni ched du bsams te /
analyzed: srog gcod pa las slar log pa de bzhin du bdag gis kyang de ltar bgyi'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // srog gcod pa zhes bya ba ni ched du bsams te /
translated: This is the meaning.

original: srog gi skad cig ma ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyun gcod cing 'jig par byed pa'o //🔽spangs te zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len pa'i dus na /
analyzed: srog gi skad cig ma ma 'ongs pa rnams kyi rgyun gcod cing 'jig par byed pa'o // spangs te zhes bya ba ni yang dag par len pa'i dus na /
translated: Taking life means intentionally cutting off and destroying the continuum of the life faculty of future moments.

original: srog chags gsod pa yid kyis btang ste'o //
analyzed: srog chags gsod pa yid kyis btang ste'o //
translated: Abandon means that at the time of taking the vow, one gives up killing living beings.

original: srog gcod pa las slar log pa zhes bya ba ni dus phyis kyang lus dang / dag dang yid dag gis phyir log par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa las slar log pa zhes bya ba ni dus phyis kyang lus dang / dag dang yid dag gis phyir log par gyur pa'o //
translated: Turn away from taking life means that later on, one turns away from it with one's body, speech and mind.

original: yan lag dang po 'dis zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i srog gcod pa spangs pas te /
analyzed: yan lag dang po 'dis zhes bya ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa thob pa'i rjes su mthun pa'i srog gcod pa spangs pas te /
translated: This means that after attaining nirvana, they abandon killing and so on.

original: tshul khrims ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rjes su slob bo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de dag thar pa'i dgongs pas //
analyzed: tshul khrims ni mya ngan las 'das pa 'thob pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro // rjes su slob bo zhes bya ba ni ji ltar de dag thar pa'i dgongs pas //
translated: Morality is the cause of attaining nirvana.🔽“I follow the training” means that just as they train in the precepts with the intention of attaining liberation,

original: bslab pa slob pa de bzhin du bdag kyang de dag gi bslab pa la rjes su slob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bslab pa slob pa de bzhin du bdag kyang de dag gi bslab pa la rjes su slob po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: so too do I follow their training in the precepts.

original: rjes su sgrub po zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i bsam pas zhugs pas sems can la yang gnod pa mi bya bar bsgrub pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su sgrub po zhes bya ba ni thar ba'i bsam pas zhugs pas sems can la yang gnod pa mi bya bar bsgrub pa'o //
translated: “I practice” means that with the intention of attaining liberation, I practice not harming sentient beings.

original: rjes su bgyid do zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams srog dang bsngo zhing yongs su srung bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rjes su bgyid do zhes bya ba ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams srog dang bsngo zhing yongs su srung bar byed pa'o //
translated: “I do” means that I will guard the bases of training taught by the Bhagavat even at the cost of my life.

original: ma byin par len pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rdzas bdag gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi rdzas bdag gir byed pa'o //
translated: “Taking what is not given” means making another’s property one’s own.

original: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dag tu smad pa'i 'dod pa bsten pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa zhes bya ba ni bgrod pa ma yin pa dang / yan lag ma yin pa dang / yul ma yin pa dang / dus ma yin pa dag tu smad pa'i 'dod pa bsten pa'o //
translated: Sexual misconduct is the practice of improper sexual intercourse, with someone who is not one’s wife, with an animal, with an improper part of the body, or at an improper time.

original: brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ba ni bslu ba'i phyir gzhan du ston pa'o //🔽'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni zas kyi chang ngo //
analyzed: brdzun du smra ba zhes bya ba ni bslu ba'i phyir gzhan du ston pa'o // 'bru'i chang zhes bya ba ni zas kyi chang ngo //
translated: Lying is the intentional speaking of something else for the purpose of deceiving someone.🔽Liquor is a fermented grain drink.

original: bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi chang ngo //
analyzed: bcos pa'i chang zhes bya ba ni rdzas kyi chang ngo //
translated: An intoxicating drink is a fermented fruit drink.

original: de gnyis kyis kyang myos bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ra ro bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas so //
analyzed: de gnyis kyis kyang myos bar 'gyur ba zhes bya ba ni ra ro bar 'gyur ba'i rdzas so //
translated: Both of these are intoxicating drinks if they are intoxicating.

original: bag med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: bag med pa'i gnas zhes bya ba ni 'bru'i chang dang / bcos pa'i chang gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The characteristic of liquor and intoxicating drinks is that they are the basis of heedlessness.

original: bag med pa zhes bya ba'i don ni nyams la /
analyzed: bag med pa zhes bya ba'i don ni nyams la /
translated: The meaning of heedlessness is the decline of the mind.

original: don ma yin pa ni 'phel ba'o //
analyzed: don ma yin pa ni 'phel ba'o //
translated: The meaning of harm is the increase of what is unwholesome.

original: de'i gnas zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i gnas zhes bya ba ni de'i rgyu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The basis of that is the cause of that.

original: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa byin pa'i 'og tu ji ltar rab tu dbyung bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: dge bsnyen gyi sdom pa byin pa'i 'og tu ji ltar rab tu dbyung bar bya zhe na /
translated: After the lay practitioner vows are given, how should one be fully ordained?

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu gang gis de zhu bar byed pa'i dge slong la gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu gang gis de zhu bar byed pa'i dge slong la gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “After that, he should be entrusted to the monk who will request ordination.”

original: dge slong gang gis rab tu 'byung bar @241b 'dod pa de dge 'dun la zhu bar byed pa'i dge slong la gtad par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong gang gis rab tu 'byung bar @241b 'dod pa de dge 'dun la zhu bar byed pa'i dge slong la gtad par bya ste /
translated: The monk who will give the full ordination should entrust the one who desires full ordination to the monk who will request ordination from the Saṅgha.

original: 'di dge 'dun la zhus shig ces bya ba'i tshig gis bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di dge 'dun la zhus shig ces bya ba'i tshig gis bkri bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He should be led with the words, “You should request this from the Saṅgha.”

original: 'dir zhu bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'dir zhu bas ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should be done by requesting?

original: de'i phyir zhu ba'i dge slong gis khyod kyi bar chad kyi chos rnams dris sam zhes dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhu ba'i dge slong gis khyod kyi bar chad kyi chos rnams dris sam zhes dri bar bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The requesting monk should ask, ‘Have you been asked about the obstructive phenomena?’”

original: gang gis dge bsnyen nyid du nye bar bsgrubs pa'i dge slong la dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis dge bsnyen nyid du nye bar bsgrubs pa'i dge slong la dri bar bya'o //
translated: The monk who has accomplished the state of a lay practitioner should ask.

original: 'gal tshabs can zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: 'gal tshabs can zhes bya ba ni nyes pa dang bcas pa ste /
translated: “Obstructive” means with faults.

original: nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nyes byas kyi ltung ba dang ldan zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: “he is guilty of a downfall that is a serious offense.”

original: de'i 'og tu zhu ba'i dge slong gis zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bar chad kyi chos rnams dag na zhu bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu zhu ba'i dge slong gis zhu bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni bar chad kyi chos rnams dag na zhu bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the monk who is requesting should request it, means: if there are no obstacles, he should request it.

original: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni stan dag go rims bzhin du bting nas so //
analyzed: gnas mal bsham pa byas nas zhes bya ba ni stan dag go rims bzhin du bting nas so //
translated: Having prepared the seats, means: having arranged the seats in order.

original: gand'i brdungs te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun bsdu pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gand'i brdungs te zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun bsdu pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Having rung the gong, means: in order to assemble the Saṅgha.

original: dris pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni gand'i brdungs pa na gzhan dag gis ci'i phyir gand'i de brdungs zhes dris pa'i lan du de dang mthun pa'i tshig brjod pa ni /
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig gis zhes bya ba ni gand'i brdungs pa na gzhan dag gis ci'i phyir gand'i de brdungs zhes dris pa'i lan du de dang mthun pa'i tshig brjod pa ni /
translated: With the words of inquiry, means: when the gong is rung, others ask, “Why is that gong rung?” The reply to that question is a statement that is consistent with that,

original: dris pa'i tshig ste des so //
analyzed: dris pa'i tshig ste des so //
translated: and that is the words of inquiry.

original: dge slong rnams la yang dag par bskul nas zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams bsdu ba'i phyir bsgo nas so //
analyzed: dge slong rnams la yang dag par bskul nas zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams bsdu ba'i phyir bsgo nas so //
translated: Having exhorted the monks, means: having announced in order to assemble the monks.

original: 'dug cing zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dug cing zhes bya ba ni nye bar zhugs pa'o //
translated: Sitting down, means: having approached.

original: mthun par gyur zhes bya ba ni bya ba mthun pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mthun par gyur zhes bya ba ni bya ba mthun pa nyid du gyur pa'o //
translated: “In agreement” means that they are in agreement about the action.

original: gnas khang so so na 'khod pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang so so so so na gnas pas 'khod pa'o //
analyzed: gnas khang so so na 'khod pa zhes bya ba ni gnas khang so so so so na gnas pas 'khod pa'o //
translated: “In their respective dwellings” means that they are in their respective dwellings.

original: gnyis kar yang rung zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni /
analyzed: gnyis kar yang rung zhes bya ba'i sgra smos pa ni /
translated: The word “both” is used because

original: rnam pa gnyis kar bstan pa'i tshig ste /🔽rnam pa 'dis zhur yang rung la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis kar bstan pa'i tshig ste / rnam pa 'dis zhur yang rung la /
translated: it is a statement that shows two aspects.

original: rnam pa 'dis zhur yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: rnam pa 'dis zhur yang rung ba'o //
translated: “In this way” means that it is suitable to request in this way.🔽“In this way” means that it is suitable to request in this way.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is taught.

original: dge 'dun thams cad phyogs gcig tu 'dus par gyur pa de'i tshe zhur yang rung /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad phyogs gcig tu 'dus par gyur pa de'i tshe zhur yang rung /
translated: When the entire Saṅgha gathers in one place, it is suitable to request.

original: yang na gang gi tshe dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag / rang rang gi gnas khang na gnas pa'i tshe /
analyzed: yang na gang gi tshe dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong dag / rang rang gi gnas khang na gnas pa'i tshe /
translated: Or, when the monks who are part of the Saṅgha are in their own dwellings,

original: gnas khang so sor song ste /
analyzed: gnas khang so sor song ste /
translated: they go to their respective dwellings

original: de dag gi mdun du zhur yang rung ngo zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de dag gi mdun du zhur yang rung ngo zhes bstan to //
translated: and it is suitable to request in front of them.

original: zhu bar byed pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zhu bar byed pa'i dge slong gis sngags 'di brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: zhu bar byed pas 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni zhu bar byed pa'i dge slong gis sngags 'di brjod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: The one who requests should say this means that the monk who requests should say this mantra.

original: rab tu byung bar 'dod pas bzlas par ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung bar 'dod pas bzlas par ni mi bya'o //
translated: But one who desires to go forth should not recite it.

original: khyim pa zhes bya ba ni khyim ma spangs pa ste /
analyzed: khyim pa zhes bya ba ni khyim ma spangs pa ste /
translated: Householder means one who has not abandoned the household,

original: de la khyim yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la khyim yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he has a household.

original: ming tsam gyis khyim yin nam zhe na /🔽de'i @242a * //
analyzed: ming tsam gyis khyim yin nam zhe na / de'i @242a * //
translated: Is it a household just by name?

original: phyir gos dkar po can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: phyir gos dkar po can zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said one who wears white clothes.

original: gos dkar po gyon pa'o //
analyzed: gos dkar po gyon pa'o //
translated: One who wears white clothes.

original: yang na khyim pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la gos dkar po can zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig yin no //
analyzed: yang na khyim pa zhes bya ba ni bstan pa'i tshig yin la gos dkar po can zhes bya ba ni bshad pa'i tshig yin no //
translated: Or, householder is a word of instruction, and one who wears white clothes is a word of explanation.

original: gang dag gi mdun du zhu bar bya ba de dag gis cho ga gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang dag gi mdun du zhu bar bya ba de dag gis cho ga gang yin pa de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show the procedure for those in front of whom the request is made,

original: de dag thams cad kyis gal te yongs su dag na'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis gal te yongs su dag na'o zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: it is said, All of them should say, 'If you are completely pure.'

original: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong ma lus pa de dag thams cad kyis gal te rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa de bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag par gyur na de'i tshe rab tu 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong ma lus pa de dag thams cad kyis gal te rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa de bar chad kyi chos rnams yongs su dag par gyur na de'i tshe rab tu 'byung bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Translation: དགེ་སློང་མ་དགེ་འདུན་དུ་གྱུར་པ་དེ་དག་ཐམས་ཅད་ཀྱིས་གལ་ཏེ་རབ་ཏུ་འབྱུང་བར་འདོད་པ་དེ་བར་ཆད་ཀྱི་ཆོས་རྣམས་ཡོངས་སུ་དག་པར་གྱུར་ན་དེའི་ཚེ་རབ་ཏུ་འབྱུང་བར་བྱའོ་ཞེས་བྱ་བའི་ཐ་ཚིག་གོ་།།

original: de'i 'og tu mkhan por gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhus pa'i 'og tu rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pas mkhan por gsol bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mkhan por gsol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni zhus pa'i 'og tu rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pas mkhan por gsol bar bya ba'o //
translated: After that, he should request the preceptor means that after the request, the one who desires ordination should request the preceptor.

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni slob ma bzlos su gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni slob ma bzlos su gzhug pa'o //
translated: This is what should be said is the disciple's recitation.🔽

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid nye bar bstan pa'o //
translated: The words I, named so-and-so indicate the person himself.

original: tshig gsum la mkhan po zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na khas blangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi mkhan por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gsum la mkhan po zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de'i tshe na khas blangs pa'i bdag nyid kyi mkhan por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who is called preceptor in the three statements is the one who has accepted the role of preceptor at that time.

original: 'di mkhan por 'gyur ba ni mkhan por gsol ba khas blangs pa na der gyur pa yin te /🔽ji srid du dge tshul nyid du mi byed pa 'am /
analyzed: 'di mkhan por 'gyur ba ni mkhan por gsol ba khas blangs pa na der gyur pa yin te / ji srid du dge tshul nyid du mi byed pa 'am /
translated: The one who is the preceptor is the one who is requested to be the preceptor and accepts.🔽He is not the preceptor until he has accepted the request.

original: ji srid du rdzogs par bsnyen par mi byed kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: ji srid du rdzogs par bsnyen par mi byed kyi bar du mi 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: He is not the preceptor until he has accepted the request.🔽After that, he should be entrusted to a monk who will shave his hair and beard.

original: de'i 'og tu gang gis de'i skra dang kha spu dag 'dreg par byed pa'i dge slong la bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mkhan por bskos pa'i 'dreg mkhan gyis skra dang kha spu dag 'dreg par byed na de ltar na yang nyes pa med par bstan pa
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang gis de'i skra dang kha spu dag 'dreg par byed pa'i dge slong la bcol bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni mkhan por bskos pa'i 'dreg mkhan gyis skra dang kha spu dag 'dreg par byed na de ltar na yang nyes pa med par bstan pa
translated: This teaches that there is no fault if the barber who has been appointed as the preceptor shaves the hair and beard.

original: yin gyi / nus na mkhan po nyid kyis breg par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yin gyi / nus na mkhan po nyid kyis breg par bya ba yin no //
translated: But if he is able, the preceptor himself should shave it.

original: gtsug phud gzhag par bya zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i rab tu 'byung bar nges pa yin nam zhes dri bas yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtsug phud gzhag par bya zhes bya ba ni dgos pa ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa'i rab tu 'byung bar nges pa yin nam zhes dri bas yongs su shes par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The topknot should be left. The purpose is to know whether the one who desires to go forth is definitely going forth by asking.

original: de'i gtsug phud gang gi tshe breg par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i gtsug phud gang gi tshe breg par bya zhe na /
translated: When should his topknot be shaved?

original: de'i phyir gtsug phud breg gam zhes dri bar bya zhing gal te bregs shig ces zer na breg par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir gtsug phud breg gam zhes dri bar bya zhing gal te bregs shig ces zer na breg par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he should be asked, “Should your topknot be shaved?” If he says, “Shave it,” then it should be shaved.

original: de'i 'og tu khrus byed du gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa de skra dang kha spu bregs pa'i 'og tu dus dang mthun pa'i chus khrus byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu khrus byed du gzhug ste zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa de skra dang kha spu bregs pa'i 'og tu dus dang mthun pa'i chus khrus byed du gzhug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: After that, he should be made to bathe. This means that after the person who desires to go forth has his hair and beard shaved, he should be made to bathe with water that is suitable for the time of year.

original: de'i 'og tu mkhan pos gos dur smrig dag @242b sbyin par bya zhes bya ba ni khrus byas pa'i 'og tu mkhan pos rab tu byung ba de la rab tu byung ba'i tshul dang cha mthun pa'i tshon gyis kha sgyur ba'i gos dag sbyin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mkhan pos gos dur smrig dag @242b sbyin par bya zhes bya ba ni khrus byas pa'i 'og tu mkhan pos rab tu byung ba de la rab tu byung ba'i tshul dang cha mthun pa'i tshon gyis kha sgyur ba'i gos dag sbyin par bya ba'o //
translated: After that, the preceptor should give him the saffron-colored robes. This means that after he has bathed, the preceptor should give the robes to the person who is going forth. The robes should be dyed with a color that is suitable for ascetics.

original: des kyang rkang pa gnyis la gtugs te blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa des kyang mkhan po la phyag btsal te gos de dag blang bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: des kyang rkang pa gnyis la gtugs te blang bar bya'o zhes bya ba ni rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa des kyang mkhan po la phyag btsal te gos de dag blang bar bya ba'o //
translated: And he should also take them by touching them to his feet. This means that the one who desires ordination should bow to the preceptor and take those robes.

original: de'i 'og tu mkhan pos bskon par bya zhes bya ba ni mkhan po rang gis rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa de la gos de dag bskon par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu mkhan pos bskon par bya zhes bya ba ni mkhan po rang gis rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa de la gos de dag bskon par bya ba'o //
translated: Then the preceptor should put them on. This means that the preceptor himself should put those robes on the one who desires ordination.

original: bskon pa na mkhan pos rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa des mtshan med pa'am /
analyzed: bskon pa na mkhan pos rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa des mtshan med pa'am /
translated: When putting them on, the preceptor should examine the one who desires ordination, asking, Are you without sex organs,

original: mtshan gnyis pa'am gle 'dams pa ma yin nam zhes brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan med pa dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang / gle 'dams pa la sogs pa'i skyon yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa'am gle 'dams pa ma yin nam zhes brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni za ma dang / ma ning dang / mtshan med pa dang / mtshan gnyis pa dang / gle 'dams pa la sogs pa'i skyon yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: or with two sex organs, or with a defective sex organ? This is to completely avoid the faults of being a eunuch, a hermaphrodite, one without sex organs, one with two sex organs, or one with a defective sex organ.

original: mtshan med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan med pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po med pa'o //
translated: Without sex organs means without faculties.

original: mtshan gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis ka yod pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan gnyis pa zhes bya ba ni pho dang mo'i dbang po gnyis ka yod pa'o //
translated: One with two organs is one who has both male and female organs.

original: gle 'dams pa zhes bya ba ni bshang ba dang gci ba'i lam gnyis gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gle 'dams pa zhes bya ba ni bshang ba dang gci ba'i lam gnyis gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: One with a defective organ is one whose anus and penis are in one place.

original: ma tshor bar brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa des bdag gi mtshan mkhan pos mthong ngo snyam du mi shes pa de ltar brtag par bya'i /
analyzed: ma tshor bar brtag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni ci nas kyang rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa des bdag gi mtshan mkhan pos mthong ngo snyam du mi shes pa de ltar brtag par bya'i /
translated: One should examine him out of sight, so that the one who wishes to go forth does not know, “My examiner is a eunuch.”

original: sgren mor phyung ste ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sgren mor phyung ste ni ma yin no //
translated: But he should not be examined naked.

original: rab tu dbyung ba'i dus kho nar mtshan brtag par nges pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rab tu dbyung ba'i dus kho nar mtshan brtag par nges pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not certain that the examination of the organs should be done at the time of going forth.

original: 'di ltar gang tshun chad kho bos rab tu dbyung ngo zhes mkhan po nyid du khas blangs pa de tshun chad nas sham thabs bskon pa'i bar dag gzung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar gang tshun chad kho bos rab tu dbyung ngo zhes mkhan po nyid du khas blangs pa de tshun chad nas sham thabs bskon pa'i bar dag gzung ngo //
translated: Because from the time that the preceptor has agreed to give the going forth, until the time of putting on the lower robe, the preceptor should examine him.

original: mkhan po rang kho nas nges par bya ba yang ma yin te /
analyzed: mkhan po rang kho nas nges par bya ba yang ma yin te /
translated: And it is not certain that the preceptor alone should do the examination.

original: gal te dge slong yid ches pa las de byas pa de las mkhan pos thos par gyur na yang las mkhan po nyid kyis byas pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te dge slong yid ches pa las de byas pa de las mkhan pos thos par gyur na yang las mkhan po nyid kyis byas pa yin par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: If a bhikṣu who is trusted hears of that action, even though the preceptor has done it, he should understand that the action was done by the preceptor himself.🔽After that, the going for refuge should be undertaken, and the going forth should be accomplished.

original: de'i 'og tu skyabs su 'gro ba rtsom pas rab tu 'byung ba nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa za ma la sogs ba'i skyon dang bral bar shes nas de'i 'og tu rab tu 'byung ba nye bar bsgrub
analyzed: de'i 'og tu skyabs su 'gro ba rtsom pas rab tu 'byung ba nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de ltar rab tu 'byung bar 'dod pa za ma la sogs ba'i skyon dang bral bar shes nas de'i 'og tu rab tu 'byung ba nye bar bsgrub
translated: Thus, having understood that one who desires to go forth is free from the faults of being a eunuch, etc., after that the going forth should be accomplished.

original: par bya'o // ji ltar nye bar bsgrub par bya zhe na /🔽skyabs su 'gro ba rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: par bya'o // ji ltar nye bar bsgrub par bya zhe na / skyabs su 'gro ba rtsom pa ste /
translated: How should it be accomplished?🔽The going for refuge should be undertaken.

original: rab tu 'byung bar nye bar bsgrub pa de'i dang po rtsom pa de ni skyabs su 'gro ba rtsom pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu 'byung bar nye bar bsgrub pa de'i dang po rtsom pa de ni skyabs su 'gro ba rtsom pa ste /
translated: The beginning of accomplishing the going forth is the undertaking of the going for refuge.

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is taught.

original: dang po skyabs su 'gro ba sbyin par @243a * //
analyzed: dang po skyabs su 'gro ba sbyin par @243a * //
translated: First, the going for refuge should be given.
