original: bya zhing phyis rab tu 'byung ba yang dag par len du gzhug go //
analyzed: bya zhing phyis rab tu 'byung ba yang dag par len du gzhug go //
translated: Afterwards, the going forth should be caused to be taken.

original: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'di skad ces brjod par bya ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: This is what should be said means

original: mkhan pos zlos su gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan pos zlos su gzhug par bya'o //
translated: the preceptor should make him repeat it.

original: khyim pa'i rtags zhes bya ba ni gos dkar po gyon pa dang skra dang kha spu ring por 'jog pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i rtags zhes bya ba ni gos dkar po gyon pa dang skra dang kha spu ring por 'jog pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The signs of a layperson means wearing white clothes, letting hair and beard grow long, and so on.

original: rab tu byung ba'i rtags zhes bya ba ni gos dur smrig gyon pa dang / sba dang kha spu ring por mi 'jog pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de'i 'og tu dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i dge slong la gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mkhan pos rab tu phyung ba'i gang zag de de la gtad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i rtags zhes bya ba ni gos dur smrig gyon pa dang / sba dang kha spu ring por mi 'jog pa la sogs pa'o // de'i 'og tu dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i dge slong la gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni mkhan pos rab tu phyung ba'i gang zag de de la gtad par bya ba'o //
translated: The signs of one gone forth means wearing saffron robes, not letting hair and beard grow long, and so on.🔽After that, he should be entrusted to a monk who will establish him in the state of a novice. This means the preceptor should entrust that person who has gone forth to him.

original: dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang gis de la dge tshul gyi sdom pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i zhes bya ba ni gang gis de la dge tshul gyi sdom pa sbyin par byed pa ste /
translated: The one who establishes him in the state of a novice is the one who gives him the novice vows.

original: dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni dge tshul nyid sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub pa'i ngang tshul gang la yod pa de ni dge tshul nyid sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: He who has the nature of being established as a novice monk is one who establishes the state of a novice monk.

original: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i dge slong de la'o //
analyzed: dge slong la zhes bya ba ni gsol ba dang bzhi'i las kyis rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i dge slong de la'o //
translated: With regard to the monk, it is in relation to a monk who is fully ordained by means of the rite of asking three times and the assembly declaring it is suitable three times.

original: gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gtad par bya'o zhes bya ba ni sbyin par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He should be entrusted, which means he should be given.

original: des kyang ci yongs su dag gam zhes dris nas /
analyzed: des kyang ci yongs su dag gam zhes dris nas /
translated: Having asked, Is it pure?

original: yongs su dag na skyabs su 'gro ba dang dge tshul nyid du khas blangs pas dge tshul nyid du nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub par byed par nges pa 'di bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag na skyabs su 'gro ba dang dge tshul nyid du khas blangs pas dge tshul nyid du nye bar bsgrub par bya'o zhes bya ba ni dge tshul nyid du nye bar sgrub par byed par nges pa 'di bya ba yin no //
translated: If it is pure, he should be established as a novice monk by taking refuge and accepting the novice monk vows. This is the procedure for establishing the state of a novice monk.

original: ci yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni ci 'di la bar chad kyi chos rnams med dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ci yongs su dag gam zhes bya ba ni ci 'di la bar chad kyi chos rnams med dam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Is it pure? means Are there no obstacles to this?

original: dris nas zhes bya ba ni gtod par byed pa'i dge slong de la dris nas so //
analyzed: dris nas zhes bya ba ni gtod par byed pa'i dge slong de la dris nas so //
translated: Having asked means having asked the monk who is the instructor.

original: gal te de 'di skad ces 'di ni yongs su dag go zhes zer na de'i tshe gang zag de yongs su dag pa yin pas skyabs su 'gro ba dang ; dge tshul nyid du khas blang pa'i cho ga 'og nas 'byung bas dge tshul nyid du nye bar bsgrub par bya'i ma dag na ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: gal te de 'di skad ces 'di ni yongs su dag go zhes zer na de'i tshe gang zag de yongs su dag pa yin pas skyabs su 'gro ba dang ; dge tshul nyid du khas blang pa'i cho ga 'og nas 'byung bas dge tshul nyid du nye bar bsgrub par bya'i ma dag na ni mi bya'o //
translated: If he says, It is pure, then since that person is pure, he should be made a novice by the rite of taking refuge and accepting the novice precepts that will be explained below. If he is impure, then he should not be made a novice.

original: dge tshul gyi bslab pa'i gzhi ni bcu ste /
analyzed: dge tshul gyi bslab pa'i gzhi ni bcu ste /
translated: The bases of training for a novice are ten.

original: de dag las dang po lnga ni dge bsnyen dang thun mong yin no //
analyzed: de dag las dang po lnga ni dge bsnyen dang thun mong yin no //
translated: The first five are common with the lay practitioner.

original: lnga ni thun mong ma yin te /
analyzed: lnga ni thun mong ma yin te /
translated: The latter five are not common.

original: de la glu gar dang rol mo'i sgra spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig ste /
analyzed: de la glu gar dang rol mo'i sgra spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gcig ste /
translated: Abandoning singing, dancing, and playing musical instruments is one basis of training.

original: rgod bag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgod bag gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are by nature frivolous.

original: phreng ba dang spos nyug pa dang rgyan dang kha dog 'chang ba spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: phreng ba dang spos nyug pa dang rgyan dang kha dog 'chang ba spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gnyis pa ste /
translated: Abandoning wearing garlands, applying fragrances and makeup, and using cosmetics and jewelry is the second basis of training.

original: rgyags pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyags pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to become conceited.

original: de la spos nyug ba zhes bya ba ni rdzas dri zhim po dag gis lus thams cad nyug pa'o //
analyzed: de la spos nyug ba zhes bya ba ni rdzas dri zhim po dag gis lus thams cad nyug pa'o //
translated: Among them, anointing with perfumes means to anoint one's entire body with fragrant substances.

original: rgyan @243b zhes bya ba ni mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan la sogs pa thogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan @243b zhes bya ba ni mgul rgyan dang / gdu bu rgyan can dang / dpung rgyan la sogs pa thogs pa'o //
translated: Wearing garlands means to wear necklaces, bracelets, armlets, and so on.

original: kha dog 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni gur kum dang ga bur la sogs pas rang gi lus la ri mo byed pa'o //
analyzed: kha dog 'chang ba zhes bya ba ni gur kum dang ga bur la sogs pas rang gi lus la ri mo byed pa'o //
translated: Wearing scents means to apply saffron, camphor, and so on to one's body.

original: khri stan mthon po dang / khri stan chen po spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gsum pa ste /
analyzed: khri stan mthon po dang / khri stan chen po spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi gsum pa ste /
translated: The third precept is to abandon high and large seats.

original: 'dod zhen che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod zhen che ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it causes one to become very attached to desire.

original: de la khri stan mthon po zhes bya ba ni khru tshad las lhag pa'o //
analyzed: de la khri stan mthon po zhes bya ba ni khru tshad las lhag pa'o //
translated: Among them, a high seat is one that is more than a cubit in height.

original: khri stan chen po zhes bya ba ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
analyzed: khri stan chen po zhes bya ba ni dbyig dang gser la sogs pa las byas pa'o //
translated: A large seat is one that is made of gold, silver, and so on.

original: dus ma yin pa'i zas spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i zas spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth precept is to abandon eating at improper times.

original: brtul zhugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtul zhugs kyi ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the nature of ascetics to do so.

original: gser dngul len pa spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga pa ste /
analyzed: gser dngul len pa spong ba ni bslab pa'i gzhi lnga pa ste /
translated: The fifth precept is to avoid accepting gold and silver.

original: yo byad don med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yo byad don med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are useless possessions.

original: 'di la gser dngul zhes bya ba ni rin po che gzhan dag gi dpe yin no //
analyzed: 'di la gser dngul zhes bya ba ni rin po che gzhan dag gi dpe yin no //
translated: Here, “gold and silver” is an example for other precious substances.

original: len pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byed pa'o //
analyzed: len pa zhes bya ba ni bdag gir byed pa'o //
translated: “Accepting” means to make them one’s own.

original: 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la ni re re la yang rnam pa du ma yod mod kyi de dag mang ches pas bsrung bar mi nus so snyam du spa gong ba dag la bstan bla bar bya ba'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi bcur bstan te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bslab pa'i gzhi de dag la ni re re la yang rnam pa du ma yod mod kyi de dag mang ches pas bsrung bar mi nus so snyam du spa gong ba dag la bstan bla bar bya ba'i phyir bslab pa'i gzhi bcur bstan te /
translated: Although each of these precepts has many aspects, they are taught as ten precepts in order to encourage those who think, “I cannot keep them because there are too many.”

original: dper na 'phags pa rgya gar bu la bslab pa gsum bstan pa dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dper na 'phags pa rgya gar bu la bslab pa gsum bstan pa dang 'dra'o //
translated: This is like the noble Divyāvadāna’s teaching of three trainings.

original: de ltar dge tshul nyid kyi cho ga rnam par bshad nas /
analyzed: de ltar dge tshul nyid kyi cho ga rnam par bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the ceremony for becoming a novice monk in this way,

original: da ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste ;
analyzed: da ni rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i cho ga brjod par bya ste ;
translated: now the ceremony for full ordination should be explained.

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu gal te de lo nyi shu tshang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu gal te de lo nyi shu tshang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “If he is twenty years old and so on.”

original: dge tshul de lo nyi shu tshang na'o //
analyzed: dge tshul de lo nyi shu tshang na'o //
translated: When the novice has completed twenty years.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen pa ni dge 'dun kho na las 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen pa ni dge 'dun kho na las 'gyur gyi /
translated: Full ordination is obtained from the Sangha alone.

original: ji ltar rab tu byung ba dang dge tshul nyid gang zag kho na las 'gyur ba ltar gang zag las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu byung ba dang dge tshul nyid gang zag kho na las 'gyur ba ltar gang zag las ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not obtained from an individual, as is the case with going forth and the novice vow.

original: thabs gang gis dge 'dun las rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: thabs gang gis dge 'dun las rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what means is full ordination obtained from the Sangha?

original: de'i phyir de'i ltung bzed dang chos gos dag btsal bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i ltung bzed dang chos gos dag btsal bar bya zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “He should search for his begging bowl and robes,” and so on.

original: mkhan po nyid du phyogs par gyur pas slob ma de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos dag btsal bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
analyzed: mkhan po nyid du phyogs par gyur pas slob ma de'i lhung bzed dang chos gos dag btsal bar bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro ;
translated: Since the preceptor is the one who is oriented toward the ordination, he should search for the disciple’s begging bowl and robes.

original: ; las byed pa dang / gsang ste ston pa dang / gang dag de'i las kyi gnas su 'jug pa'i dge slong de dag la yang gsol ba gdab bar bya'o zhes bya ba yang mkhan po nyid du phyogs par gyur pa de nyid kyis de dag bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: ; las byed pa dang / gsang ste ston pa dang / gang dag de'i las kyi gnas su 'jug pa'i dge slong de dag la yang gsol ba gdab bar bya'o zhes bya ba yang mkhan po nyid du phyogs par gyur pa de nyid kyis de dag bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: And he should request the preceptor, the instructor, the monk who is the reciter of the code of discipline, the monk who is the exhorter of the nuns, the monk who is the assigner of meals, the monk who is the assigner of cells, the monk who is the assigner of bedding, the monk who is the assigner of robes, the monk who is the assigner of bath-time, the monk who is the assigner of work, the monk who is the instructor in the secret, and those monks who enter into his place of work.

original: las kyi gnas su zhes bya ba ni de @244a * //🔽rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa'i las kyi mtshams su ste /
analyzed: las kyi gnas su zhes bya ba ni de @244a * // rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa'i las kyi mtshams su ste /
translated: The place of work is the place of the ceremony of full ordination.

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa'i mtshams sam /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa'i mtshams sam /
translated: The place of the ceremony of full ordination is the place where the entire Saṅgha is present and agrees.

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams su'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i mtshams su'o //
translated: Or it is the place of the mandala.🔽Since it is said that a non-natural monk should not be included in the assembly, in order to exclude that here, it is said those monks who enter into his place of work.

original: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pas tshogs kyi kha bskang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'dir de bsal ba'i phyir dge slong gang dag de'i las kyi gnas su 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong rang bzhin du gnas pa ma yin pas tshogs kyi kha bskang bar mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'dir de bsal ba'i phyir dge slong gang dag de'i las kyi gnas su 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag gis kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Here, the preceptor is the one who gives the full ordination.

original: der 'du bar 'gyur ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams de rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir 'du ba gang yin pa'i las kyi gnas der 'du ba'i mdun rol du 'du ba la sbyor ba'i tshe'o //🔽zla ba phyed 'das pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du zla ba phyed kyi gso sbyong gang 'das pa phan chad kyi nyes pa ni gso sbyong de nyid kyi tshe bsdam pa dang bshags pa la sogs pa byas zin pas de la ni so
analyzed: der 'du bar 'gyur ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni dge slong rnams de rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir 'du ba gang yin pa'i las kyi gnas der 'du ba'i mdun rol du 'du ba la sbyor ba'i tshe'o // zla ba phyed 'das pa'i nyes pa zhes bya ba ni de'i mdun rol du zla ba phyed kyi gso sbyong gang 'das pa phan chad kyi nyes pa ni gso sbyong de nyid kyi tshe bsdam pa dang bshags pa la sogs pa byas zin pas de la ni so
translated: The term at the time of the assembly refers to the time of the assembly prior to the rite of the assembly, which is the rite for the purpose of fully ordaining the monks.🔽The term the fault of passing beyond the fortnight means that since the fortnightly confession ceremony has already been performed at the time of that assembly, the fault of passing beyond the fortnightly confession ceremony that occurs after that is not to be individually investigated.

original: sor brtag mi dgos kyi de tshun chad kyi nyes pa la so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: sor brtag mi dgos kyi de tshun chad kyi nyes pa la so sor brtag par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The term “fault” is to be supplied.

original: nyes pa de yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa de yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is that fault?

original: de'i phyir bsdam par bya ba dang / bshags par bya ba dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsdam par bya ba dang / bshags par bya ba dang / byin gyis brlab par bya ba dag ces bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, the text says, “that which is to be restrained, confessed, and blessed.”

original: bsdam par bya ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi nyes byas phra mo'o //
analyzed: bsdam par bya ba zhes bya ba ni yid kyi nyes byas phra mo'o //
translated: “To be restrained” means the minor offenses of the mind.

original: bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ltung byed dang / sa  sor bshags par bya ba dang / bshags pa'i nyes byas so //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba zhes bya ba ni ltung byed dang / sa  sor bshags par bya ba dang / bshags pa'i nyes byas so //
translated: “To be confessed” means the downfalls, the downfalls that require confession and probation, and the minor offenses that are to be confessed.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya ba dag ces bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma dang / spang ba'i ltung byed dag go //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya ba dag ces bya ba ni dge 'dun lhag ma dang / spang ba'i ltung byed dag go //
translated: “To be restored” means the remaining offenses of the Sangha and the downfalls that require relinquishment.

original: de dag la so sor brtag par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de dag la so sor brtag par bya zhing zhes bya ba ni /
translated: “One should examine them” means

original: bdag la nyes pa de dag gang byung ba la so sor brtag par bya zhing ngo //
analyzed: bdag la nyes pa de dag gang byung ba la so sor brtag par bya zhing ngo //
translated: “one should examine which of these faults has occurred for oneself.”

original: ci so sor brtags nas ltung ba de phyir ma bcos pa kho nar 'dug par bya 'am zhe na /
analyzed: ci so sor brtags nas ltung ba de phyir ma bcos pa kho nar 'dug par bya 'am zhe na /
translated: “Having examined, should one remain in that downfall without making amends?”

original: de'i phyir nyes pa shes pa bsdam pa'am bshags pa'am byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa shes pa bsdam pa'am bshags pa'am byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te 'dug par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore it is said, “One should remain by restoring through restraint, confession, or restoration.”

original: gal te bsdam par bya ba'i nyes pa dag shes nas bsdams pas phyir bcos pas 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te bsdam par bya ba'i nyes pa dag shes nas bsdams pas phyir bcos pas 'dug par bya'o //
translated: If one knows the faults that are to be restrained, one should remain by restoring through restraint.

original: bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa dag shes nas bshags pas phyir bcos te 'dug par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bshags par bya ba'i nyes pa dag shes nas bshags pas phyir bcos te 'dug par bya ba'o //
translated: Having understood the faults that are to be confessed, one should remain by way of restoration through confession.

original: byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i nyes pa dag shes nas byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te 'dug par bya'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab par bya ba'i nyes pa dag shes nas byin gyis brlabs pas phyir bcos te 'dug par bya'o //
translated: Having understood the faults that are to be consecrated, one should remain by way of restoration through consecration.

original: 'dir ltung byed la sogs pa bshags par gsungs pa @244b ni nyi ma de nyid la phyir bcos par nus pa yin pas de dag ni byin gyis brlabs pas dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ltung byed la sogs pa bshags par gsungs pa @244b ni nyi ma de nyid la phyir bcos par nus pa yin pas de dag ni byin gyis brlabs pas dag pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan te /
translated: Here, the statement that the downfalls and so on are to be confessed is taught in order to show that they can be restored on that very day, and therefore they are not purified by consecration.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma dang spang ba dag byin gyis brlabs par gsungs pa ni nyi ma de nyid la phyir bcos pa mi nus pa yin pas byin gyis brlabs pas dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma dang spang ba dag byin gyis brlabs par gsungs pa ni nyi ma de nyid la phyir bcos pa mi nus pa yin pas byin gyis brlabs pas dag pa nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bstan to //
translated: The statement that the offenses entailing suspension and the offenses of wrongdoing are to be consecrated is taught in order to show that they can be restored on that very day, and therefore they are purified by consecration.

original: da ltar na ji skad bstan pa'i cho ga 'dis ni thams cad lta ba mthun pa /
analyzed: da ltar na ji skad bstan pa'i cho ga 'dis ni thams cad lta ba mthun pa /
translated: Now, by this ritual as it has been taught, all the monks should be in agreement.

original: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa dag gis gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o zhes gsungs pa bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: tshul khrims yongs su dag pa 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa dag gis gso sbyong dang / dgag dbye dang / gsol ba dang / gsol ba dang gnyis dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las bya'o zhes gsungs pa bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The statement, “The purification of the morality of those who are present and in agreement should be performed by means of the ceremony of the half-monthly recitation of the Prātimokṣa, the ceremony of the lifting of restrictions, the ceremony of the invitation, the ceremony of the invitation and the two, and the ceremony of the invitation and the four,” is a summary.

original: de'i las kyi mtshams gang zhe na /
analyzed: de'i las kyi mtshams gang zhe na /
translated: What is the boundary of the rite?

original: de'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa'am /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa'am /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “The entire Saṅgha should be present and in agreement,

original: dkyil 'khor ba la yang rung ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba la yang rung ste zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: or it is permissible in the middle of the Saṅgha.”

original: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i cho ga nyid bstan te /
analyzed: dge 'dun thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa'am zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i cho ga nyid bstan te /
translated: The statement, “The entire Saṅgha should be present and in agreement,” teaches the rite of the basis.

original: mtshams gcig na dge 'dun ji snyed bzhugs pa thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa las rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'o //
analyzed: mtshams gcig na dge 'dun ji snyed bzhugs pa thams cad 'dug cing mthun par gyur pa las rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'o //
translated: The entire Saṅgha should be present and in agreement in the same place.

original: dkyil 'khor la yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i cho ga nyid la brten par mi nus na dkyil 'khor pa'i mtshams su dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong phyogs gcig tu bcad pa dag las rdzogs par bsnyen par byar yang rung bar bstan to //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor la yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni gzhi'i cho ga nyid la brten par mi nus na dkyil 'khor pa'i mtshams su dge 'dun du gyur pa'i dge slong phyogs gcig tu bcad pa dag las rdzogs par bsnyen par byar yang rung bar bstan to //
translated: Or in a maṇḍala means that if one is unable to rely on the very rite of the site, it is also suitable to complete the full ordination from a group of monks who have become a saṃgha within the boundary of the maṇḍala.

original: dge 'dun du ma gyur pa dag gis las mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'dir rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i las la du dag dge 'dun nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun du ma gyur pa dag gis las mi bya'o zhes gsungs pas 'dir rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i las la du dag dge 'dun nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Since it is said that those who have not become a saṃgha should not perform the rite, here, in the rite of full ordination, how many are the saṃgha?

original: de'i phyir yul dbus su dge slong bcu la sogs pa'i tshogs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir yul dbus su dge slong bcu la sogs pa'i tshogs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that in the central country, a group of ten or more monks, and so on.

original: yul dbus kyi mtshan ma shar du ni li kha ra shing 'phel gyi mdun gyi nags mi kha ra'i shing tshang tshing can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yul dbus kyi mtshan ma shar du ni li kha ra shing 'phel gyi mdun gyi nags mi kha ra'i shing tshang tshing can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: In the central country, to the east is the sign of the country of Li, in front of which is the dense forest of the tree called Mikharī.

original: lhor ni grong khyer 'dam bu can gyi lho na chu klung 'dam bu can zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhor ni grong khyer 'dam bu can gyi lho na chu klung 'dam bu can zhes bya ba'o //
translated: To the south, south of the city of Paṃsukūla, is the river called Paṃsukūla.

original: nub tu ni bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis so ;
analyzed: nub tu ni bram ze'i grong ka ba dang nye ba'i ka ba zhes bya ba gnyis so ;
translated: In the west are the two brahmin villages of Kaba and Nyekaba.🔽In the north is the mountain called Usira.

original: ; byang du ni au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa de dag gi khongs su gtogs pa ni yul dbus te /
analyzed: ; byang du ni au shi ra'i ri zhes bya ba'o zhes gsungs pa de dag gi khongs su gtogs pa ni yul dbus te /
translated: The central region is included in these.

original: dge slong yul dbus su rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i bya ba'i las la ni /
analyzed: dge slong yul dbus su rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i bya ba'i las la ni /
translated: A monk who is fully ordained in a central region

original: dge slong bcu la sogs pa dge 'dun nyid yin no //🔽mtha' 'khob dag tu gzhan med na 'dul ba 'dzin @245a * //
analyzed: dge slong bcu la sogs pa dge 'dun nyid yin no // mtha' 'khob dag tu gzhan med na 'dul ba 'dzin @245a * //
translated: is a monk in the Sangha of ten or more monks.

original: pa dang / lnga la sogs pa'i tshogs la yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: pa dang / lnga la sogs pa'i tshogs la yang rung ste zhes bya ba ni /
translated: In the border regions, if there is no other option, the ordination can be done by a group of five that includes a vinaya master.

original: yul dbus kyi phyogs bzhi'i mtshams kyi mtshan ma sngar smos pa de dag phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob ste /
analyzed: yul dbus kyi phyogs bzhi'i mtshams kyi mtshan ma sngar smos pa de dag phan chad ni yul mtha' 'khob ste /
translated: Beyond the four boundaries mentioned above in the central region are the border regions.

original: dge slong yul mtha' 'khob tu rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i las la ni dge slong bcu la sogs pa gzhan med na 'dul ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba las byed pa nyid gtogs par lnga la sogs pa dge 'dun nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong yul mtha' 'khob tu rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i las la ni dge slong bcu la sogs pa gzhan med na 'dul ba 'dzin pa zhes bya ba las byed pa nyid gtogs par lnga la sogs pa dge 'dun nyid yin no //
translated: In the rite of full ordination in a remote region, if there are no other monks, the saṅgha itself consists of five or more, including the one who performs the rite called the “vinaya master.”

original: yod na ni gzhi'i cho ga kho na la brten par bya ste /
analyzed: yod na ni gzhi'i cho ga kho na la brten par bya ste /
translated: If there are other monks, then one should rely on the procedure of the basis.

original: chog las 'das na las mi chags so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽dang por dge slong re re la phyag gsum gsum 'tshal du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chog las 'das na las mi chags so zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro // dang por dge slong re re la phyag gsum gsum 'tshal du gzhug go zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Because it is said that if one exceeds the procedure, the rite is not established.🔽First, each monk should be made to bow down three times.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i dang por dge slong dang phrad do cog thams cad la rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba des phyag lan gsum gsum bya bar rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i dang por dge slong dang phrad do cog thams cad la rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba des phyag lan gsum gsum bya bar rigs pa yin te /
translated: At the beginning of the assembly for the purpose of full ordination, it is proper for the one who is to be fully ordained to bow down three times to all the monks who are present for the full ordination.

original: 'di ltar phyag byas pas bdag nyid dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par ston cing bsam pa drag pos drang por 'jug par rigs pas de'i phyir 'dir dang por phyag lan gsum bya bar gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar phyag byas pas bdag nyid dge 'dun gyi nang du 'jug par ston cing bsam pa drag pos drang por 'jug par rigs pas de'i phyir 'dir dang por phyag lan gsum bya bar gsungs so //
translated: Thus, by doing homage, one shows that one is entering into the midst of the Saṅgha, and it is proper to enter with a sincere, intense attitude. Therefore, it is taught that one should do homage three times at the beginning here.

original: phyag lan gsum 'tshal du bcug nas /
analyzed: phyag lan gsum 'tshal du bcug nas /
translated: Having made one do homage three times,

original: de'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: what should one do after that?

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mkhan por gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mkhan por gsol ba bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, “After that, one should request the preceptor.”

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pas dge 'dun gyi dbus de nyid du mkhan por gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pas dge 'dun gyi dbus de nyid du mkhan por gsol bar bya'o //
translated: One who wishes to be fully ordained should request the preceptor right there in the midst of the Saṅgha.

original: pha gu'i steng du rtsva bting ba la rting pa gnyis kyis mnan te tsog tsog por 'dug tu bcug ste /
analyzed: pha gu'i steng du rtsva bting ba la rting pa gnyis kyis mnan te tsog tsog por 'dug tu bcug ste /
translated: Having spread grass on top of the wall, one should make them sit squatting, pressing down with both heels.

original: zhes bya ba la pha gu'i steng du rting pa gnyis kyis mnan nas tsog tsog por 'dug tu gzhug pa yun ring du tsog tsog por 'dug pa sdug bsngal bas de'i phyir 'di rjes su gnang ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la pha gu'i steng du rting pa gnyis kyis mnan nas tsog tsog por 'dug tu gzhug pa yun ring du tsog tsog por 'dug pa sdug bsngal bas de'i phyir 'di rjes su gnang ste /
translated: Here, having pressed down with both heels on top of the wall, one should make them sit squatting. Because sitting squatting for a long time is painful, this is allowed.

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa na chos gos dang / lhung bzed byin gyis brlab pa dang / gsang ste ston pa ma gtogs par mkhan por gsol ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par gsol ba dang / las kyi slob dpon gyis bar chad dri ba mnyan pa dang /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par byed pa na chos gos dang / lhung bzed byin gyis brlab pa dang / gsang ste ston pa ma gtogs par mkhan por gsol ba dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par gsol ba dang / las kyi slob dpon gyis bar chad dri ba mnyan pa dang /
translated: When one is to be fully ordained, except for the consecration of the robes and the begging bowl and the secret instruction, the request to the preceptor, the request for full ordination, and the listening to the questions about obstacles by the ceremonial master,

original: de'i lan 'debs pa dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs thams cad du rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i gang zag de pha gu'i steng du rkang pa gnyis kyis 'dug tu gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i lan 'debs pa dang / rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba la sogs pa'i skabs thams cad du rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i gang zag de pha gu'i steng du rkang pa gnyis kyis 'dug tu gzhug par bya'o //
translated: the answer to those questions, and all the occasions of the full ordination, the person to be fully ordained should be made to sit on the platform with both feet on the ground.

original: 'dir pha gu zhes bya ba ni bong ba yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir pha gu zhes bya ba ni bong ba yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand that the “platform” is a brick.

original: rtsva bting @245b ba la rting pa gnyis kyis mnan nas tsog tsog por 'dug tu gzhug pa ni chos gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gis man ngag las khong du chud par bya'o //🔽ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang kho na la gnas ste /
analyzed: rtsva bting @245b ba la rting pa gnyis kyis mnan nas tsog tsog por 'dug tu gzhug pa ni chos gos ma rung bar 'gyur ba yongs su spang ba'i phyir ro zhes 'dul ba 'dzin pa dag gis man ngag las khong du chud par bya'o // ci rigs par brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba ni gang kho na la gnas ste /
translated: This should be understood from the oral instructions of the vinaya masters.

original: rab tu byung ba de kho na la gnas te /🔽rdzogs par bsnyen par nges pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba de kho na la gnas te / rdzogs par bsnyen par nges pa ma yin gyi /
translated: One should say whatever is appropriate means that one should say whatever is appropriate for the one who is taking ordination.

original: 'di ltar 'dod pas 'dug par rigs par bya ste /🔽de'i phyir gal te dang po'i mkhan po nyid la mkhan por gsol na ni de'i tshe 'di skad ces /🔽mkhan po dgongs su gsol /🔽bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mkhan po la mkhan por gsol gyi /🔽mkhan po bdag gi mkhan po mdzad du gsol /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'dod pas 'dug par rigs par bya ste / de'i phyir gal te dang po'i mkhan po nyid la mkhan por gsol na ni de'i tshe 'di skad ces / mkhan po dgongs su gsol / bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba mkhan po la mkhan por gsol gyi / mkhan po bdag gi mkhan po mdzad du gsol /
translated: One should say, “I request full ordination from the saṅgha.”🔽One should say, “I request full ordination from the saṅgha.”🔽One should say, “I request full ordination from the saṅgha.”

original: mkhan po mkhan pos rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: mkhan po mkhan pos rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, “I request full ordination from the saṅgha.”

original: dge tshul gyis slob dpon la sogs pa slob dpon la mkhan por gsol na ni de'i tshe 'di skad ces slob dpon dgongs su gsol /
analyzed: dge tshul gyis slob dpon la sogs pa slob dpon la mkhan por gsol na ni de'i tshe 'di skad ces slob dpon dgongs su gsol /
translated: If the novice monk requests the preceptor to be the ceremonial master, then at that time he should say, I request you, ceremonial master,🔽to be my preceptor. Please be my preceptor, ceremonial master. I will be fully admitted to the order by the ceremonial master and preceptor.

original: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba slob dpon la mkhan por gsol gyi slob dpon bdag gi mkhan po mdzad du gsol slob dpon mkhan pos rdzogs par bsnyen par bgyi'o zhes brjod cing tshig gsum pa la mkhan po zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag ming 'di zhes bgyi ba slob dpon la mkhan por gsol gyi slob dpon bdag gi mkhan po mdzad du gsol slob dpon mkhan pos rdzogs par bsnyen par bgyi'o zhes brjod cing tshig gsum pa la mkhan po zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the third line, he should say preceptor.

original: dge slong gzhan zhig la mkhan po la ni de'i tshe btsun pa dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong gzhan zhig la mkhan po la ni de'i tshe btsun pa dgongs su gsol zhes bya ba la sogs pa gzhung nyid las 'byung ba bzhin du brjod par bya'o //
translated: If he requests another fully ordained monk to be the preceptor, then at that time he should say, Venerable, please consider this.

original: mkhan por gsol ba'i 'og tu mkhan pos ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: mkhan por gsol ba'i 'og tu mkhan pos ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should the preceptor do after the request?🔽Therefore it is said,

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mkhan po rang gis de la chos gos gsum byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mkhan po rang gis de la chos gos gsum byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Immediately after that, the preceptor himself should consecrate the three robes for him.

original: mkhan po zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba'i mkhan po la bsnyegs te /
analyzed: mkhan po zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen par 'gyur ba'i mkhan po la bsnyegs te /
translated: The term preceptor refers to the preceptor who will confer full ordination.

original: 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das ma thag tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the term immediately is explained in the immediately preceding verse.

original: 'o na rang gis zhes bya ba smos mi dgos te /
analyzed: 'o na rang gis zhes bya ba smos mi dgos te /
translated: If that is so, then the term himself is unnecessary,

original: mkhan pos de las chos gos gsum byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyang don rtogs pa'i phyir rang gis zhes bya ba smos ci dgos she na /
analyzed: mkhan pos de las chos gos gsum byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba 'di gnyis kyang don rtogs pa'i phyir rang gis zhes bya ba smos ci dgos she na /
translated: because the term himself is also understood in the statement, The preceptor should consecrate the three robes for him.

original: de ni 'di lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni 'di lta ma yin te /
translated: This is not so,

original: rang gis smos pa ni bcol ba'i cho ga spang ba'i phyir te //
analyzed: rang gis smos pa ni bcol ba'i cho ga spang ba'i phyir te //
translated: because the term himself is used to exclude the rite of requesting another to act on one's behalf.

original: 'di ltar dper na skra dang kha spu bregs pa dang / mtshan brtag pa la sogs pa dag gzhan gyis byed na yang nyes pa med pa lta bu cho ga ma nges pa ni bcol ba'i @246a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar dper na skra dang kha spu bregs pa dang / mtshan brtag pa la sogs pa dag gzhan gyis byed na yang nyes pa med pa lta bu cho ga ma nges pa ni bcol ba'i @246a * //
translated: For example, there is no fault if another shaves the hair and beard, examines the private parts, and so on, but the rite is not definite.

original: cho ga zhes bya'o //
analyzed: cho ga zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the rite of requesting another to act on one's behalf.

original: 'dir ni chos gos byin gyis brlab pa mkhan po nyid kyi rang gis bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir ni chos gos byin gyis brlab pa mkhan po nyid kyi rang gis bya ba yin gyi /
translated: Here, the consecration of the three robes is the preceptor's own rite.

original: gzhan byed du mi gzhug pa de'i don du rang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra nye bar brjod par byas so //
analyzed: gzhan byed du mi gzhug pa de'i don du rang gis zhes bya ba'i sgra nye bar brjod par byas so //
translated: The word “himself” is used to indicate that he should not have another do it.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba la'o //
translated: “In that” means in the ceremony of full ordination.

original: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste /🔽mkhan po de rang gi rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba de la chos gos gsum dras shing drubs pa dag yod cing bdog pa 'am /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir tshig gi don 'di 'byung ste / mkhan po de rang gi rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba de la chos gos gsum dras shing drubs pa dag yod cing bdog pa 'am /
translated: Thus, the meaning of the passage is as follows.

original: med cing mi bdog na rgyu gzhan la yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: med cing mi bdog na rgyu gzhan la yang byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: If the preceptor has the three robes cut and sewn for the one who is to be fully ordained, or if he does not have them, he should consecrate another set.

original: byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'og tu bskon par bya ste /
analyzed: byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'og tu bskon par bya ste /
translated: After the consecration, he should put them on.

original: chos gos byin gyis brlab pa ni cha lugs kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlab pa ni cha lugs kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The consecration of the robes is for the purpose of the appearance of a monk.

original: chos gos dras shing drubs pa dag ces bya ba ni snam sbyar rnam pa dgu pa glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa dang / bla gos rnam pa bdun pa glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa dang mthang gos rnam pa lnga pa glegs bu phyed dang gnyis pa dras shing drubs zin pa dag go //
analyzed: chos gos dras shing drubs pa dag ces bya ba ni snam sbyar rnam pa dgu pa glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa dang / bla gos rnam pa bdun pa glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa dang mthang gos rnam pa lnga pa glegs bu phyed dang gnyis pa dras shing drubs zin pa dag go //
translated: The phrase having cut and sewn the Dharma robes refers to the nine-panel outer robe, the three-and-a-half panel upper robe, and the five-panel lower robe, which have been cut and sewn.

original: gnyis ka 'greng ste lag pas chos gos snam sbyar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni chos gos la sogs pa gos byin gyis brlab pa ni 'greng pa'i mdun du 'greng ste /
analyzed: gnyis ka 'greng ste lag pas chos gos snam sbyar bzung nas zhes bya ba ni chos gos la sogs pa gos byin gyis brlab pa ni 'greng pa'i mdun du 'greng ste /
translated: The phrase standing face to face, holding the Dharma robe with both hands means that the consecration of the Dharma robes and so forth is done while standing in front of the person who is to be consecrated.

original: gnyi ga'i lag pas rdzas de bzung nas byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gdon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga'i lag pas rdzas de bzung nas byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags gdon par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the consecration mantra is recited while holding the cloth with both hands.

original: bgyis zhes bya ba ni tha ga pas so //
analyzed: bgyis zhes bya ba ni tha ga pas so //
translated: The phrase having made refers to the tailor.

original: lag pa zhes bya ba ni bkru ba dang / btsems pa dang / kha bsgyur ba la sogs pas so //
analyzed: lag pa zhes bya ba ni bkru ba dang / btsems pa dang / kha bsgyur ba la sogs pas so //
translated: The phrase with both hands refers to washing, sewing, dyeing, and so forth.

original: rung ba zhes bya ba ni rnga mo'i bal dang / ri dags kyi bal la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rung ba zhes bya ba ni rnga mo'i bal dang / ri dags kyi bal la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: “Suitable” means free from camel hair, goat hair, and so on.

original: spyad par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni spyad bzod pa ste /
analyzed: spyad par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni spyad bzod pa ste /
translated: “Fit to be used” means that it can be used.

original: bgo bzas yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bgo bzas yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of “having clothing.”

original: byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba ni sngags sngon du gtang bas bdag gir bya ba'o //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab po zhes bya ba ni sngags sngon du gtang bas bdag gir bya ba'o //
translated: “Consecrate” means to make it one’s own by reciting a mantra over it.

original: mthang gos zhes bya ba ni smad du bgo ba'o //
analyzed: mthang gos zhes bya ba ni smad du bgo ba'o //
translated: “Lower robe” means the lower garment.

original: de'i 'og tu chos gos bskon par bya zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'og tu mkhan po nyid kyis sam mkhan pos bskos pa'i dge slong dag gis de la chos gos dag bskon par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu chos gos bskon par bya zhes bya ba ni byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'og tu mkhan po nyid kyis sam mkhan pos bskos pa'i dge slong dag gis de la chos gos dag bskon par bya ste /
translated: “Then the Dharma robes should be put on” means that after the consecration, the preceptor himself or the monks appointed by the preceptor should put the Dharma robes on him.

original: chos gos byin gyis brlab pa ni cha lugs kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlab pa ni cha lugs kyi don du yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the consecration of the Dharma robes is for the purpose of the appearance.

original: des kyang snam sbyar dang bcas pa nyid yin na der 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la phyag bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen par byed @246b pa'i gang zag la mkhan pos chos gos gsum byin gyis rlob tu bcug ste /🔽snam sbyar dang bcas pa nyid du gyur pa na /
analyzed: des kyang snam sbyar dang bcas pa nyid yin na der 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la phyag bya'o zhes bya ba ni rdzogs par bsnyen par byed @246b pa'i gang zag la mkhan pos chos gos gsum byin gyis rlob tu bcug ste / snam sbyar dang bcas pa nyid du gyur pa na /
translated: If he has the patched robe, he should pay respect to the Saṅgha that is the basis of his full ordination.

original: nges bdag nyid rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la phyag bya ba nyid du rigs pa'o //
analyzed: nges bdag nyid rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i phyir 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la phyag bya ba nyid du rigs pa'o //
translated: If he has the patched robe, it is proper for him to pay respect to the Saṅgha that is the basis of his full ordination.🔽If he does not have the cut and sewn robes, he should bless the material.

original: chos gos dras shing drubs pa dag med na rgyu la byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtad pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: chos gos dras shing drubs pa dag med na rgyu la byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba ni brtad pa'i dbang gis gsungs pa yin te /
translated: This is stated from the perspective of those who are in a hurry,

original: 'di ltar rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i tshogs pa rnyed pa'i tshe chos gos dras shing drubs pa dag med na phyis rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i tshogs pa rnyed par dka'o snyam du bsams nas gang nas su las kyang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i tshogs pa rnyed pa'i tshe chos gos dras shing drubs pa dag med na phyis rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba'i tshogs pa rnyed par dka'o snyam du bsams nas gang nas su las kyang rung ste /
translated: because if one does not have the cut and sewn robes when the assembly for full ordination is gathered, it will be difficult to find such an assembly again.

original: chos gos ma dras shing ma drubs pa kha ma bsgyur ba dag rnyed na de'i tshe ma dras pa ma drubs pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs te rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i las byas la /
analyzed: chos gos ma dras shing ma drubs pa kha ma bsgyur ba dag rnyed na de'i tshe ma dras pa ma drubs pa'i sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs te rdzogs par bsnyen pa'i las byas la /
translated: If one obtains a Dharma robe that is not cut, not sewn and not dyed, then at that time, one should consecrate it with the mantra of the uncut and unsewn and perform the rite of full ordination.🔽Later, when one cuts and sews that robe, one should consecrate it. This is the intention of the Bhagavan.

original: phyis gos de dag dras shing drubs te byin gyis brlab par bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs so zhes 'du la ba 'dzin pa dag gi man ngag las shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyis gos de dag dras shing drubs te byin gyis brlab par bcom ldan 'das kyis dgongs so zhes 'du la ba 'dzin pa dag gi man ngag las shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood from the oral instructions of the upholders of the Vinaya.

original: 'o na dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang ji ltar mi 'ga' zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na dras shing drubs pa chos gos nyid du byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes gsungs pa dang ji ltar mi 'ga' zhe na /
translated: If one asks, how is this not contradictory to the statement, “One should consecrate the cut and sewn robe as a Dharma robe”?🔽This should be understood from the scriptures, which state, “Venerable, is it suitable to consecrate a Dharma robe that is not cut?

original: de ni gzhung las btsun pa chos gos ma dras pa las byin gyis brlab tu rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ni gzhung las btsun pa chos gos ma dras pa las byin gyis brlab tu rung ngam nye ba 'khor mi rung ste /
translated: Upali, it is not suitable.

original: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na mi rung ngo zhes gsungs pa las khong du chud par bya ste /
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag yod na mi rung ngo zhes gsungs pa las khong du chud par bya ste /
translated: If such conditions exist, it is not suitable.”

original: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa la brtad pa'i rkyen byung ngam /
analyzed: rdzogs par bsnyen par 'dod pa la brtad pa'i rkyen byung ngam /
translated: If the conditions for full ordination arise,

original: dge slong gis gos phrogs sam /
analyzed: dge slong gis gos phrogs sam /
translated: If a monk’s robe is stolen,🔽lost,

original: gos brlag gam /🔽gos tshig gam /
analyzed: gos brlag gam / gos tshig gam /
translated: burned,

original: gos rlung gis khyer ram /
analyzed: gos rlung gis khyer ram /
translated: blown away by the wind,

original: gos chus khyer ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na snam sbyar yang ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab par gnang la /
analyzed: gos chus khyer ba'i rkyen de lta bu dag yod na snam sbyar yang ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab par gnang la /
translated: or carried away by water, then it is permitted to consecrate an uncut patched robe if such conditions exist.

original: rkyen de lta bu dag med na snam sbyar ni ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab tu mi gnang ngo //
analyzed: rkyen de lta bu dag med na snam sbyar ni ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab tu mi gnang ngo //
translated: If such conditions do not exist, then it is not permitted to consecrate an uncut patched robe.

original: bla gos dang mthang gos ni dras shing drubs pa dag med na rkyen de lta bu dag yod kyang rung med kyang rung ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab tu rung ngo //
analyzed: bla gos dang mthang gos ni dras shing drubs pa dag med na rkyen de lta bu dag yod kyang rung med kyang rung ma dras pa la byin gyis brlab tu rung ngo //
translated: If a monk does not have a cut and sewn upper robe or lower robe, then it is permitted to consecrate an uncut robe, whether such conditions exist or not.

original: lung las kyang chos gos zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar yin par gsungs te /
analyzed: lung las kyang chos gos zhes bya ba ni snam sbyar yin par gsungs te /
translated: The scriptures also state that the term Dharma robe refers to the patched robe.🔽Thus, the Questions of Upāli in the Vinaya states:

original: de ltar yang ma me las nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis snam sbyar ni nges par dras te'o //
analyzed: de ltar yang ma me las nye ba 'khor gyis zhus pa las bcom ldan 'das kyis snam sbyar ni nges par dras te'o //
translated: The Blessed One said, “The patched robe must be cut and sewn.

original: bla gos dang mthong gos ni nges pa med do zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bla gos dang mthong gos ni nges pa med do zhes gsungs so //
translated: The upper robe and the lower robe are not definite.”

original: 'dul ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa byed kyang snam sbyar nges par dras te bcang /
analyzed: 'dul ba'i tshig le'ur byas pa byed kyang snam sbyar nges par dras te bcang /
translated: The patched robe is definitely cut and worn.

original: gzhan dag ma nges @247a * //
analyzed: gzhan dag ma nges @247a * //
translated: Other robes are not definite.

original: gang gi phyir //🔽'dod chung gang gi chos gos kyi //
analyzed: gang gi phyir // 'dod chung gang gi chos gos kyi //
translated: Why?🔽Because the patched robe is the Dharma robe.

original: las kyis sdug bsngal 'gyur phyir ro //
analyzed: las kyis sdug bsngal 'gyur phyir ro //
translated: If one is unhappy with the work of the patched robe,

original: zhes smras so //
analyzed: zhes smras so //
translated: one will be unhappy with the Dharma.

original: de dag gi tshang ci tsam zhe na /
analyzed: de dag gi tshang ci tsam zhe na /
translated: What are the measurements of those robes?

original: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang / mthang gos byin gyis brlab tu rung ba chen po dag ni tshad gcig ste /
analyzed: snam sbyar dang bla gos dang / mthang gos byin gyis brlab tu rung ba chen po dag ni tshad gcig ste /
translated: The large robes that are suitable for consecration as the patched robe, upper robe, and lower robe are one cubit in size.

original: zheng du khru gsum /
analyzed: zheng du khru gsum /
translated: Three cubits wide.

original: chur khru lnga'o //
analyzed: chur khru lnga'o //
translated: Five cubits long.

original: chung du dag gi tshad ni zhed du khru phyed dang gsum chur khru phyed dang lnga'o //
analyzed: chung du dag gi tshad ni zhed du khru phyed dang gsum chur khru phyed dang lnga'o //
translated: The small robes are one and a half cubits wide and five cubits long.

original: 'bring rnams kyi tshad ni che chung gnyis kyi bar ma'o //🔽yang mthang gos kyi tshad ni zhed du khru do //
analyzed: 'bring rnams kyi tshad ni che chung gnyis kyi bar ma'o // yang mthang gos kyi tshad ni zhed du khru do //
translated: The medium robes are the same as the large robes.

original: chur khru lnga yang yin zhing zheng du khru do /
analyzed: chur khru lnga yang yin zhing zheng du khru do /
translated: The lower robe is four cubits wide and five cubits long.🔽It is also four cubits wide and four cubits long.

original: chur khru bzhi yang yin 'khor gsum khebs pa nyid kyang yin no //
analyzed: chur khru bzhi yang yin 'khor gsum khebs pa nyid kyang yin no //
translated: It also covers the three areas.

original: tshal la zhes bya ba ni 'dod na'o //
analyzed: tshal la zhes bya ba ni 'dod na'o //
translated: In a grove means in a pleasure grove.

original: bar chad ma byung na zhes bya ba ni srog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad med na'o //
analyzed: bar chad ma byung na zhes bya ba ni srog dang tshangs par spyod pa'i bar chad med na'o //
translated: If there is no obstacle means if there is no obstacle to life or pure conduct.

original: snam phran dgu par bgyis te zhes bya ba ni tshal bu dgu par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: snam phran dgu par bgyis te zhes bya ba ni tshal bu dgu par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is made with nine panels, which means it is made with nine sections.

original: 'dir snam phran zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshal bu la bya'i /
analyzed: 'dir snam phran zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshal bu la bya'i /
translated: Here, the term panel refers to a section,

original: glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed la ni mi bya'o //
analyzed: glegs bu dang glegs bu phyed la ni mi bya'o //
translated: not to a page or half-page.

original: glegs bu phyed dang gsum par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni snam phran dgu pa la glegs bu phyed dang gsum par bya ba'o //
analyzed: glegs bu phyed dang gsum par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni snam phran dgu pa la glegs bu phyed dang gsum par bya ba'o //
translated: It is made with one and a half pages means that on a nine-panel robe, one and a half pages are used.

original: de ni mtshon pa tsam du zang de snam sbyar gyi snam phran dag ni dgu yan chad nyi shu rtsa lnga man chad de zung ma gtogs so //
analyzed: de ni mtshon pa tsam du zang de snam sbyar gyi snam phran dag ni dgu yan chad nyi shu rtsa lnga man chad de zung ma gtogs so //
translated: This is just an illustration, because the panels of a patched robe are from nine to twenty-five, excluding the pair.

original: de yan chad ni tshems bu'o //
analyzed: de yan chad ni tshems bu'o //
translated: Beyond that, it is a patchwork.

original: snam phran de dag la glegs bu dang glegs bu byed ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: snam phran de dag la glegs bu dang glegs bu byed ji ltar rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: How are pages and half-pages determined for those panels?

original: dang po gsum la ni de dag gi glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa nyid do //
analyzed: dang po gsum la ni de dag gi glegs bu phyed dang gsum pa nyid do //
translated: In the first three, the first half of the leaf is the same.

original: gnyis pa la ni glegs bu byed dang bzhi pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa la ni glegs bu byed dang bzhi pa nyid do //
translated: In the second, the fourth leaf is the same.

original: gsum pa la ni glegs bu phyed dang lnga pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsum pa la ni glegs bu phyed dang lnga pa nyid do //
translated: In the third, the first half of the leaf is the same.

original: bkru'o zhes bya ba ni bkru bshal bya ba'o //
analyzed: bkru'o zhes bya ba ni bkru bshal bya ba'o //
translated: “Wash” means to wash and rinse.

original: brkyang ngo zhes bya ba ni gding bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: brkyang ngo zhes bya ba ni gding bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Stretch” means to spread out.

original: dra'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis su gcad par bya ba'o //🔽bsdeb po zhes bya ba ni dras pa phan tshun sbyar bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dra'o zhes bya ba ni gnyis su gcad par bya ba'o // bsdeb po zhes bya ba ni dras pa phan tshun sbyar bar bya ba'o //
translated: “Cut” means to cut in two.🔽“Sew” means to sew together the cut pieces.

original: gzungs gdab bo zhes bya ba ni bsdeb pa skud pas gzungs gdab par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gzungs gdab bo zhes bya ba ni bsdeb pa skud pas gzungs gdab par bya ba'o //
translated: “Weave” means to weave with thread.

original: drub po zhes bya ba ni gzungs btab pa btsem par bya ba'o //
analyzed: drub po zhes bya ba ni gzungs btab pa btsem par bya ba'o //
translated: “Dye” means to dye the woven cloth.

original: kha bsgyur ro zhes bya ba ni kha bsgyur ba gsum po sngon po 'am /
analyzed: kha bsgyur ro zhes bya ba ni kha bsgyur ba gsum po sngon po 'am /
translated: “Color” means to color with one of the three colors:🔽blue,

original: dmar po 'am /🔽ngur smrig las gang yang rung bar kha bsgyur bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: dmar po 'am /🔽ngur smrig las gang yang rung bar kha bsgyur bar bya ba'o //
translated: red,🔽or ochre.

original: yang na 'di lhan thabs su glan no zhes bya ba ni chos gos ma dras pa 'di'i steng du gzhan gyi @247b snam phran dang / glegs bu dang / glegs bu phyed kyis lhan thabs su glan par bya'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di lhan thabs su glan no zhes bya ba ni chos gos ma dras pa 'di'i steng du gzhan gyi @247b snam phran dang / glegs bu dang / glegs bu phyed kyis lhan thabs su glan par bya'o //
translated: Or, it is sewn as a patch means that another patch, a strip, or half a strip is sewn on top of this uncut Dharma robe.

original: yang na gal te ldang na gos de nyid la dras te snam phran dang / glegs bur sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na gal te ldang na gos de nyid la dras te snam phran dang / glegs bur sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Or, if it is possible to stand, that very robe is cut, and the strips and strips are joined together.

original: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bgyi ste zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi chos gos gzhan rnyed na 'di gang las re zhig g-yar por blangs pa de la phyir sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du bgyi ste zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi chos gos gzhan rnyed na 'di gang las re zhig g-yar por blangs pa de la phyir sbyin par bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: As for it is done according to the circumstances, if another Dharma robe is obtained for oneself, it is given back to the one from whom it was borrowed for the time being, and so on.

original: snam phran bdun par bgyis te glegs bu phyed dang gsum par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni bla gos so //
analyzed: snam phran bdun par bgyis te glegs bu phyed dang gsum par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni bla gos so //
translated: As for it is made with seven strips and one and a half strips, it is the upper robe.

original: snam phran lnga par bgyis te glegs bu phyed dang gnyis par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni mthang gos so //
analyzed: snam phran lnga par bgyis te glegs bu phyed dang gnyis par bgyi'o zhes bya ba ni mthang gos so //
translated: As for it is made with five strips and one and a half strips, it is the lower robe.

original: de gnyis ni chos gos byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags 'di las shes par bya'i /
analyzed: de gnyis ni chos gos byin gyis brlab pa'i sngags 'di las shes par bya'i /
translated: These two are to be understood from this mantra for consecrating the Dharma robes.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis kyis snam phran gyi tshad ni snam sbyar tshad ltang gang du yang bka' ma stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi bla gos dang mthang gos gnyis kyis snam phran gyi tshad ni snam sbyar tshad ltang gang du yang bka' ma stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One did not declare the size of the panels of the upper robe and the lower robe in terms of cubits.

original: chos gos kyi sngags dbyung ba yang 'greng ba'i mdun du 'greng ste /
analyzed: chos gos kyi sngags dbyung ba yang 'greng ba'i mdun du 'greng ste /
translated: The mantra for taking out the Dharma robes is recited while standing in front of the robes.

original: gnyis kas lag pas bzung nas dbyung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis kas lag pas bzung nas dbyung bar bya'o //
translated: Both should hold the robes with their hands and recite the mantra.

original: chos gos byin gyis brlab pa dang dbyung ba ni chos gos nye bar gnas na dge slong nye bar mi gnas kyang rang gi yid kyis rnam par brtag pas kyang byar rung ngo //
analyzed: chos gos byin gyis brlab pa dang dbyung ba ni chos gos nye bar gnas na dge slong nye bar mi gnas kyang rang gi yid kyis rnam par brtag pas kyang byar rung ngo //
translated: The consecration and taking out of the Dharma robes is suitable to be done by imagining it with one's own mind, even if the monk is not present, if the Dharma robes are present.

original: chos gos dbyung ba la ni chos gos nye bar mi gnas kyang dbyung ba 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chos gos dbyung ba la ni chos gos nye bar mi gnas kyang dbyung ba 'grub pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the Dharma robes are not present, the taking out of the Dharma robes will certainly be accomplished.

original: de ltar chos gos byin gyis brlabs te bskon nas der 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal du gzhug pa de'i 'og tu de'i lhung bzed bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar chos gos byin gyis brlabs te bskon nas der 'dus pa'i dge 'dun la phyag 'tshal du gzhug pa de'i 'og tu de'i lhung bzed bstan par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: After that, the alms bowl should be shown to him.

original: btsun pa 'am tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gal te rgan na btsun pa zhes bod cing /
analyzed: btsun pa 'am tshe dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni gal te rgan na btsun pa zhes bod cing /
translated: “Venerable” or “long-lived one” means if he is older, he is called “venerable,”

original: gzhon na tshe dang ldan pa zhes bod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gzhon na tshe dang ldan pa zhes bod pa yin gyi /
translated: and if he is younger, he is called “long-lived one.”

original: 'dir gnyis ka brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir gnyis ka brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But here, neither should be used.

original: dge 'dun la lhung bzed bstan pa ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir mi chung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba'i phyir te /🔽byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'i lhung bzed gsum las mi chung ngam zhes bya ba ni mi dman nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge 'dun la lhung bzed bstan pa ci'i phyir zhe na de'i phyir mi chung ngam zhes bya ba la sogs pa dri ba'i phyir te / byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'i lhung bzed gsum las mi chung ngam zhes bya ba ni mi dman nam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Why should the alms bowl be shown to the Saṅgha? It is for the purpose of asking, “Is he not small?” and so on.🔽“Is he not small” means “Is he not inferior” in terms of the three suitable alms bowls.

original: mi che'am zhes bya ba ni tshad gsum pa dag las bong tshod ma lhag gam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi che'am zhes bya ba ni tshad gsum pa dag las bong tshod ma lhag gam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Is he not large” means “Is his size not greater than the three measures?”

original: mi skya'am zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dkar por mi 'gyur tam zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mi skya'am zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dkar por mi 'gyur tam zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “Will it last?” means “Will it not become a white bowl?”

original: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'i lhung bzed che chung gsum gyi chad ji tsam zhe na /
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu rung ba'i lhung bzed che chung gsum gyi chad ji tsam zhe na /
translated: What are the sizes of the three types of bowls that are suitable to be consecrated?

original: dge slong gi lhung @248a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi lhung @248a * //
translated: The size of a monk’s bowl that is suitable to be consecrated is as follows:

original: bzed kyi che tshad byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa'i chan de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa blugs na mthe bo'i lto gang gis ma gang pa yin
analyzed: bzed kyi che tshad byin gyis brlab tu rung ba ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do btsos pa'i chan de'i rkyen gyi tshod ma gang yang rung ba dang bcas pa blugs na mthe bo'i lto gang gis ma gang pa yin
translated: When dry, cooked white rice and any type of vegetable are put into it, it is not filled by a thumb-sized portion of cooked rice from Magadha.

original: no // lhung bzed chung tshad ni de'i phyed blugs na mthe bo'i lto gang gis ma gang ba yin no //
analyzed: no // lhung bzed chung tshad ni de'i phyed blugs na mthe bo'i lto gang gis ma gang ba yin no //
translated: The size of a small bowl is that it is not filled by half a portion of cooked rice.

original: lhung bzed 'bring tshad ni de nyid kyi bar yang rung ba shong ba'o //
analyzed: lhung bzed 'bring tshad ni de nyid kyi bar yang rung ba shong ba'o //
translated: The size of a medium bowl is that it is filled by a portion of cooked rice.

original: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
analyzed: 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung gang la ni 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a'i srang bcu drug ste /
translated: One maund of dry, crushed rice is sixteen seers of dry, crushed rice in Magadha.

original: yul ma ga dh'a pa'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do //
analyzed: yul ma ga dh'a pa'i srang gcig la bod kyi srang gnyis yod do //
translated: One Magadha seer is two Tibetan srangs.

original: de ltar na 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a pa'i bre'u chung gang la bod kyis srang tshad du brtsi na ni srang sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na 'bras thug po che drus pa skam yul ma ga dh'a pa'i bre'u chung gang la bod kyis srang tshad du brtsi na ni srang sum cu rtsa gnyis yod do //
translated: Thus, one maund of dry, crushed rice in Magadha is thirty-two Tibetan srangs.

original: phul tshad du brtsi na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
analyzed: phul tshad du brtsi na ni bdun phul do dang khyor gang yod do //
translated: If it is measured by the Tibetan measure of a phul, it is seven phuls and one khyor.🔽Two Magadha measures is double that.

original: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do la ni de'i gnyis 'gyur yod do //
analyzed: ma ga dh'a'i bre'u chung do la ni de'i gnyis 'gyur yod do //
translated: One span is the length of four finger joints.🔽One span is the length of four finger joints.

original: mthe bo'i lto gang zhes bya ba ni mthe bo'i sor gcig ste /🔽mthe bo'i tshegs dang po'i phyogs gcig nas brtsams te /
analyzed: mthe bo'i lto gang zhes bya ba ni mthe bo'i sor gcig ste / mthe bo'i tshegs dang po'i phyogs gcig nas brtsams te /
translated: One span is the length of four finger joints.🔽One cubit is the length of twenty-four finger joints.🔽One cubit is the length of twenty-four finger joints.🔽One cubit is the length of twenty-four finger joints.🔽One fathom is the distance between the tips of the middle fingers when the arms are extended on both sides.

original: tshigs de nyid kyis phyogs gcig gi bar du lto rol nas gzhal ba ni mthe bo'i lto gang zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshigs de nyid kyis phyogs gcig gi bar du lto rol nas gzhal ba ni mthe bo'i lto gang zhes bya ste /
translated: One fathom is the distance between the tips of the middle fingers when the arms are extended on both sides.🔽One fathom is the distance between the tips of the middle fingers when the arms are extended on both sides.

original: de ni mthe bo'i sor gcig yin no //
analyzed: de ni mthe bo'i sor gcig yin no //
translated: That is one finger-width.

original: lhung bzed bstan pa'i 'og tu dge slong de dag gis ji skad brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed bstan pa'i 'og tu dge slong de dag gis ji skad brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: After showing the alms-bowl, what should the monks say?

original: de'i phyir dge slong thams cad kyis kyang lhung bzed de lta bu nyid ma yin na re re nas lhung bzed bzang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dge slong thams cad kyis kyang lhung bzed de lta bu nyid ma yin na re re nas lhung bzed bzang ngo zhes brjod par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said that all monks, if the alms-bowl is not like that, should say one by one, This alms-bowl is good.

original: lhung bzed de lta bu nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba ni chung ba dang / che ba dang / skya ba lta bu'i skyon can ma yin no //
analyzed: lhung bzed de lta bu nyid ma yin na zhes bya ba ni chung ba dang / che ba dang / skya ba lta bu'i skyon can ma yin no //
translated: If the alms-bowl is not like that, it is not defective like being small, large, or pale.

original: re re nas zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed ston pa'i dge slong gis der 'dus pa'i dge slong re re'i mdun du de skad dris pa na dge slong de dag gis kyang re re nas 'phral 'phral la lan 'di skad brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: re re nas zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed ston pa'i dge slong gis der 'dus pa'i dge slong re re'i mdun du de skad dris pa na dge slong de dag gis kyang re re nas 'phral 'phral la lan 'di skad brjod par bya'o //
translated: One by one means that when the monk showing the alms-bowl asks this in front of each monk assembled there, those monks should also say this answer one by one immediately.

original: lhung bzed bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed bzang ngo zhes bya ba ni mdzes pa ste /
translated: This alms-bowl is good means it is beautiful.

original: byin gyis brlab tu zung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: byin gyis brlab tu zung ba yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: Hold it, consecrating it.

original: lhung bzed bstan pa'i 'og tu mkhan pos ji zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed bstan pa'i 'og tu mkhan pos ji zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should the preceptor do after showing the bowl?

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mkhan po rang gis de la lhung bzed byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so //🔽gnyis ka 'greng ste lag pa g-yon par lhung bzed bzhag la lag pa g-yas @248b pas bkab nas zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang sman byin gyis brlab pa ni 'greng ba'i mdun du 'greng ba la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu mkhan po rang gis de la lhung bzed byin gyis brlab par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs so // gnyis ka 'greng ste lag pa g-yon par lhung bzed bzhag la lag pa g-yas @248b pas bkab nas zhes bya ba ni lhung bzed dang sman byin gyis brlab pa ni 'greng ba'i mdun du 'greng ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said that the preceptor himself should consecrate the bowl for him.🔽Standing, placing the bowl in the left hand, covering it with the right hand,🔽because the consecration of the bowl and medicine is done while standing in front of the one standing,

original: lag pa g-yon par bzhag ste lag pa g-yas pas bkab nas brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lag pa g-yon par bzhag ste lag pa g-yas pas bkab nas brjod par bya ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: placing it in the left hand and covering it with the right hand.

original: sman gyi sngags dbyung ba ni de'i rjes su 'brang bas cho ga 'di bzhin du bya bar shes bar bya'o //
analyzed: sman gyi sngags dbyung ba ni de'i rjes su 'brang bas cho ga 'di bzhin du bya bar shes bar bya'o //
translated: The recitation of the medicine mantra should be understood to be done according to this procedure by those who follow it.

original: lhung bzed kyi sngags dbyung ba ni lag pas steng nas g-yogs pa btang ste /
analyzed: lhung bzed kyi sngags dbyung ba ni lag pas steng nas g-yogs pa btang ste /
translated: The recitation of the bowl mantra is done after releasing the covering with the hand.

original: lag pa ya res kha nas bzung ste bya'o //
analyzed: lag pa ya res kha nas bzung ste bya'o //
translated: One should do it by holding the hand with one's own hand.

original: gser dngul la sogs pa reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ni mdun du bzhag ste byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: gser dngul la sogs pa reg par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la ni mdun du bzhag ste byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: But in the case of gold, silver, etc., which are not to be touched, one should consecrate them by placing them in front of oneself.

original: zas la spyad par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni zas kyi bya ba la spyad bzod pa'o //
analyzed: zas la spyad par 'os pa zhes bya ba ni zas kyi bya ba la spyad bzod pa'o //
translated: The phrase fit for use as food means that it is suitable for the activity of eating.

original: drang srong gi snod ces bya ba ni drang srong yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi snod yin pa'o //
analyzed: drang srong gi snod ces bya ba ni drang srong yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas dang / rang sangs rgyas dang / nyan thos rnams kyi snod yin pa'o //
translated: The phrase vessel of the sages means that it is a vessel of the sages, the Perfectly Awakened Ones, the Solitary Sages, and the Disciples.

original: blang ba'i snod du zhes bya ba ni zas blang ba'i ched du'o //
analyzed: blang ba'i snod du zhes bya ba ni zas blang ba'i ched du'o //
translated: The phrase vessel for receiving means that it is for the purpose of receiving food.

original: lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
analyzed: lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa'i 'og tu ci zhig bya zhe na /
translated: What should one do after consecrating the alms-bowl?

original: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba de thos pa'i nyen khor nas bkar te mthong ba'i nyen khor du thal mo sbyor du bcug nas tshogs la mngon du phyogs par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i 'og tu rdzogs par bsnyen par bya ba de thos pa'i nyen khor nas bkar te mthong ba'i nyen khor du thal mo sbyor du bcug nas tshogs la mngon du phyogs par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, After that, one should invite the Sangha to the place where the food is being offered, having removed the danger of eavesdropping and having made them join their palms in reverence.

original: thos pa'i nyen khor nas bkar te zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor pa'i gnas nas phyir phyung nas te /
analyzed: thos pa'i nyen khor nas bkar te zhes bya ba ni dkyil 'khor pa'i gnas nas phyir phyung nas te /
translated: Having been expelled from the place of the maṇḍala, from the danger of hearing means that.

original: thag ji srid du bkar bar bya zhe na /
analyzed: thag ji srid du bkar bar bya zhe na /
translated: How far should one be expelled?

original: gsang ste ston pa'i phyir las gang byed pa de mi thos pa de srid du bkar bar bya'i /
analyzed: gsang ste ston pa'i phyir las gang byed pa de mi thos pa de srid du bkar bar bya'i /
translated: For the sake of secret teaching, one should be expelled as far as one cannot hear what is being done.

original: dkyil 'khor pa'i mtshams kyi phyi rol du bzla bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor pa'i mtshams kyi phyi rol du bzla bar mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be expelled beyond the boundary of the maṇḍala.

original: mthong ba'i nyen khor du zhes bya ba ni gang du dge slong rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ma nyams pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba'i nyen khor du zhes bya ba ni gang du dge slong rnams kyi mig gi rnam par shes pa ma nyams pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As for from the danger of seeing, it means where the eye consciousness of the monks is not impaired.

original: thal mo sbyar du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar bar byed du bcug nas so //
analyzed: thal mo sbyar du bcug nas zhes bya ba ni thal mo sbyar bar byed du bcug nas so //
translated: Having been made to join the palms together means having been made to join the palms.

original: tshogs la mngon du phyogs par zhes bya ba ni gang nas des dkyil 'khor pa'i dge slong rnams mthong ba nas dge 'dun gyi tshogs de la kha tshur bstan te'o / gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i spyod lam gyis 'greng ste 'dud pa dang
analyzed: tshogs la mngon du phyogs par zhes bya ba ni gang nas des dkyil 'khor pa'i dge slong rnams mthong ba nas dge 'dun gyi tshogs de la kha tshur bstan te'o / gzhag par bya'o zhes bya ba ni de lta bu'i spyod lam gyis 'greng ste 'dud pa dang
translated: Facing the assembly means that he should face the assembly of monks, from where he sees the mandala of the saṅgha.🔽He should stand in that way, standing with a respectful bow.

original: bcas pas gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bcas pas gzhag par bya'o //
translated: He should be placed means that he should be placed in that way, standing with a respectful bow.

original: de ni sems dang ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / las thos pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni sems dang ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir dang / las thos pa yongs su spang bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is for the purpose of generating faith in him and for the purpose of abandoning the fault of hearing the karma.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong las byed @249a * //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dge slong las byed @249a * //
translated: After that, the karma bhikṣu

original: pas gsang ste ston pa'i dge slong las gzhung las 'byung ba'i sngags kyis gang yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
analyzed: pas gsang ste ston pa'i dge slong las gzhung las 'byung ba'i sngags kyis gang yin zhes dri bar bya'o //
translated: should ask the secret exposer bhikṣu, with the mantra from the text, Who is it?

original: de'i 'og tu gsang ste ston pa gang yin pa des bdag ming 'di zhes bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gsang ste ston pa gang yin pa des bdag ming 'di zhes bya'o zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: After that, the one who is the secret exposer should say, I am named so-and-so.

original: de'i 'og tu dge slong las byed pas gsang ste ston pa'i dge slong las gzhung las 'byung ba'i sngags kyis spro 'am zhes spro bar bya'o //
