original: yang na bkus pa yang yin la bor ba yang yin pa ni bkus te bor ba'o //
analyzed: yang na bkus pa yang yin la bor ba yang yin pa ni bkus te bor ba'o //
translated: Or, it is discarded and also sifted.

original: zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhus pa 'khyags pa'o //
analyzed: zhun mar zhes bya ba ni mar bzhus pa 'khyags pa'o //
translated: Clarified butter is butter that has been melted and then frozen.

original: 'bru mar zhes bya ba ni ti la mar la sogs pa'o //🔽sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu tshang rtsi'o //
analyzed: 'bru mar zhes bya ba ni ti la mar la sogs pa'o // sbrang rtsi zhes bya ba ni sbrang bu tshang rtsi'o //
translated: Oil means sesame oil, etc.🔽Honey means the honey of bees.

original: bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bu ram la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bu ram gyi dbu ba zhes bya ba ni bu ram la sogs pa'o //
translated: Sugar means sugar cane, etc.

original: dus su rung ba zhes bya ba ni snga dro bza' ba rgun 'bru la sog pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus su rung ba zhes bya ba ni snga dro bza' ba rgun 'bru la sog pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is proper for a time means whatever is eaten in the morning, such as grapes.

original: thun tshod du rung ba zhes bya ba ni rgun chu la sogs pa thun tshod kyi mtha' tshun chod du byin gyis brlabs te btung ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: thun tshod du rung ba zhes bya ba ni rgun chu la sogs pa thun tshod kyi mtha' tshun chod du byin gyis brlabs te btung ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: That which is proper for a period means whatever is drunk after consecrating grape juice, etc., within the limit of a period.

original: zhag bdun pa zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba 'bur mar la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun pa zhes bya ba ni zhag bdun par byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba 'bur mar la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is for seven days means whatever is eaten, such as butter, after consecrating it to be eaten for seven days.

original: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba bca' ba la sogs pa'o //🔽rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni shu dag la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i bar du bcang ba zhes bya ba ni dus thams cad du byin gyis brlabs te bza' ba bca' ba la sogs pa'o // rtsa ba zhes bya ba ni shu dag la sogs pa'o //
translated: That which is for life means whatever is eaten, such as food, after consecrating it for all time.🔽Root means orris root, etc.

original: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni tsan dan la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sdong bu zhes bya ba ni tsan dan la sogs pa'o //
translated: Stem means sandalwood, etc.

original: lo ma zhes bya ba ni ko sha ta ki la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lo ma zhes bya ba ni ko sha ta ki la sogs pa'o //
translated: Leaves are the kośāṭakī and so on.

original: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu zhes bya ba ni aa ru ra la sogs pa'o //
translated: Fruits are the āmalaka and so on.

original: gnas bzhi po de dag rdzogs par bsnyen ma thag tu brjod par bya ba ni sems las su rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnas bzhi po de dag rdzogs par bsnyen ma thag tu brjod par bya ba ni sems las su rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: As soon as the four bases are completed, the downfalls are to be recited, because the mind is workable.

original: de'i 'og tu ltung bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams brjod @255b par bya ste zhes bya ba ni las byed pas brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ltung bar 'gyur ba'i chos rnams brjod @255b par bya ste zhes bya ba ni las byed pas brjod par bya'o zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: After that, the downfalls are to be recited, which means that the one performing the rite is to recite them.

original: dge slong gi dngos po'i ltung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ltung bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po'i ltung ba dang rjes su mthun pa'i phyir ltung bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: Because they are downfalls that correspond to the downfalls of a fully ordained monk, they are called downfalls.

original: de dag kyang mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi tshangs par spyod pa la sogs pa bzhi 'og nas 'byung ba dag go //
translated: And those are the four beginning with sexual intercourse that will be explained below.

original: byas na zhes bya ba ni spyad na'o //
analyzed: byas na zhes bya ba ni spyad na'o //
translated: If one commits them means if one engages in them.

original: byas ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni spyad ma thag tu'o //
analyzed: byas ma thag tu zhes bya ba ni spyad ma thag tu'o //
translated: Immediately after committing them means immediately after engaging in them.

original: dge slong du mi rung par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos pa yongs su dag pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge slong du mi rung par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi dngos pa yongs su dag pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: One becomes unfit to be a monk means that one does not have the purity of the state of a monk.

original: gnas pa dang longs spyod du mi dbang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gnas pa dang longs spyod du mi dbang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means that he is not fit to be a support or an object of enjoyment.

original: dge sbyong du mi rung zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i bdag nyid la bya na /
analyzed: dge sbyong du mi rung zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten na dge sbyong zhes bya ba ni zhi ba'i bdag nyid la bya na /
translated: He is not fit to be a religious person means that in the world, a religious person is one who has a peaceful nature.

original: de ni lus dang ngag dang yid ma zhi bar kun du spyod pa des dge sbyong smad pa yin pa'o //
analyzed: de ni lus dang ngag dang yid ma zhi bar kun du spyod pa des dge sbyong smad pa yin pa'o //
translated: But he is not fit to be a religious person because he is not peaceful in his conduct of body, speech, and mind.

original: kha cig na re cha lugs tsam gyi lhag ma ma lus pa'i phyir sems can shi ba dang / shing tshig pa dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang rdzing skams pa dang / sa bon rul ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: kha cig na re cha lugs tsam gyi lhag ma ma lus pa'i phyir sems can shi ba dang / shing tshig pa dang / mgal me'i 'khor lo dang rdzing skams pa dang / sa bon rul ba dang 'dra'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some say that he is like a dead sentient being, a burned tree, a firebrand, a dried up pond, or rotten seed, because he has no remainder of the mere physical form.

original: sh'akya'i sras kyis mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i sras bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma yongs su dag par mi rung ba ste /
analyzed: sh'akya'i sras kyis mi rung ba zhes bya ba ni sh'akya'i sras bcom ldan 'das kyi slob ma yongs su dag par mi rung ba ste /
translated: The son of the Śākyas says that he is unfit means that the son of the Śākyas, the Blessed One, says that he is unfit to be a disciple of pure livelihood.

original: de'i bka' lung rjes su mi bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bka' lung rjes su mi bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he does not carry out his instructions.

original: dge slong gi dngos po las nyams par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bslab pa las nyams par 'gyur ba ste lhod par rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge slong gi dngos po las nyams par 'gyur te zhes bya ba ni bslab pa las nyams par 'gyur ba ste lhod par rjes su sgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He falls away from his status as a monk” means that he falls away from his training, because he is not able to continue in it.

original: de'i dge slong gi tshul zhing par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sngom pa ral bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de'i dge slong gi tshul zhing par 'gyur zhing zhes bya ba ni dge slong gi sngom pa ral bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: “His monkhood is destroyed” means that his monk vow is broken.

original: bshags pa'i sems mi skye ba'i phyir ram 'phags pa'i lam 'thob pa'i skal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshags pa'i sems mi skye ba'i phyir ram 'phags pa'i lam 'thob pa'i skal ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is not able to arouse the thought of confession, or because he is not able to obtain the noble path.

original: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni chud zos pa ste /
analyzed: nyams pa zhes bya ba ni chud zos pa ste /
translated: “He is ruined” means that he is lost.

original: bshags pa'i sems bskyed du zin kyang bshags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshags pa'i sems bskyed du zin kyang bshags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because even though he arouses the thought of confession, he is not able to confess.

original: bcom pa zhes bya ba ni dkrugs pa ste /
analyzed: bcom pa zhes bya ba ni dkrugs pa ste /
translated: “He is defeated” means that he is confused.

original: tshe de nyid la nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshe de nyid la nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because he is not able to overcome the defilements in that very life.

original: lhung ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyun la nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i nus pa skye ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lhung ba zhes bya ba ni sems kyi rgyun la nyon mongs pa bzlog pa'i nus pa skye ba'i mthu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “He falls” means that he is not able to arouse the power to overcome the defilements in the continuum of his mind.

original: pham par gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra dag gis zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pham par gyur ba zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa'i dgra dag gis zil gyis mnan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Defeated” means that one is overcome by the enemy of the afflictions.

original: ji ltar na dge sbyong du mi rung zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar na dge sbyong du mi rung zhe na /
translated: How is one unfit to be a spiritual practitioner?

original: de'i phyir de'i dge sbyong gi tshul phyir blang du med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te /🔽phyir blang du med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dag @256a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i dge sbyong gi tshul phyir blang du med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba gsungs te / phyir blang du med pa zhes bya ba ni ma dag @256a * //
translated: Therefore, it says, “his spiritual practitioner’s way becomes unrecoverable.”

original: pa'i sa nas blangs te dag pa'i sar gzhag tu med pa ste /
analyzed: pa'i sa nas blangs te dag pa'i sar gzhag tu med pa ste /
translated: “Unrecoverable” means that one cannot be lifted up from the impure stages and placed in the pure stages.
